loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es:
For six years, Liberia has earned a living selling cosmetics and other merchandise in Chinandega's Bisne market. In that time, she's shown herself to be a driven and hard-working lady. She's invested in her business in order to improve her economic situation which, by all accounts, is very difficult since she's the only income earner for her household.

Before she had this business, Liberia worked as a street vendor in the Bisne market, but when she realized she had to earn more money, she approached Ceprodel which has provided her with a total of 18 loans. She's invested the loans in purchases of merchandise that have allowed her to better serve her customers and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace seis años, en el mercado el Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Liberia B. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos varios (pulpería). Desde que inicio su negocio, ha sido una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora la cual ha invertido en su negocio para el mejoramiento de su situación económica la cual según cuenta ha estado muy difícil por el hecho de que ella es el único sostén en el hogar.

Antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba al trabajo de venta ambulante en el mercado Bisne de Chinandega pero al darse cuenta que no obtenía los recursos necesarios acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un total de 18 créditos invertidos en la compra de mercadería habiendo realizado mayores volúmenes de venta y así poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Esperanza M

texts.es:
Esperanza makes and sells decorations for birthdays and other celebrations. Since she was a young girl, she's had a knack for creating beautiful decorations, something it should be noted that not everyone has.

Unfortunately, her business isn't steady because she works to order and celebrations like weddings or religious holidays aren't evenly spread out through the year. Wisely, however, she's applying to Ceprodel, which has already provided her with 3 loans, for a new loan so that she can buy materials to make her products. Since getting those loans, she's been able to create more decorations and, in turn, increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

La venta de decoraciones como adornos para cumpleaños, recordatorios, adornos de hogar, etc. Son los que muy dignamente elabora la señora Esperanza para luego venderlos a sus clientes. Desde muy pequeña se ha caracterizado por tener la habilidad y destreza de decorar muy lindos adornos. Una virtud que hay que señalar es que no todas las personas tienen este talento pero ella si lo posee desde muy pequeña.

Lastimosamente este no es un negocio fijo debido a que trabaja por encargos ya sea cuando hay bodas, cumpleaños o cualquier actividad religiosa. Sin embargo muy sabiamente para mejorar la situación económica de su negocio acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado su apoyo con la entrega de 3 créditos invertidos directamente en la compra de los materiales para elaborar los productos. Desde que obtiene estos créditos, ha percibido mejores ingresos por lo que ha manufacturado mayores cantidades de adornos decorativos.

loans.use: Buy materials to make decorations.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorr

texts.es:
Guadalupe makes a living making and selling food which she prepares very early in her shop in Chinandega's Bisne market. To operate this business, she buys products (ingredients) on credit, paying for them weekly and, when she has the chance, paying for them in cash.

Guadalupe has operated this business for 3 years but the difficult economic situation she finds herself in has led her to look to Ceprodel, which has provided her with loans for 2 years, for help. The loans have been hugely helpful since she has used them to improve her business by purchasing bulk quantities of ingredients for making her dishes. That, in turn, has allowed her to improve her family's economic situation, a significant achievement for a single mother with two children.

Translated by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de la Sra. Guadalupe es la venta de comida la cual la prepara muy temprano en su localidad ubicada en el mercado el Bisne de Chinandega. Para poder realizar este negocio, ella compra productos (ingredientes) al crédito pagándolos a la semana y cuando tiene la oportunidad, realiza su compra de contado.

La Sra. Guadalupe tiene 3 años de tener este negocio pero la difícil situación económica que ha atravesado ha hecho que busque apoyo en Ceprodel quien le otorga créditos desde hace 2 años. Según cuenta estos créditos le han sido de mucho beneficio porque ha logrado mejorar su negocio de venta de comida adquiriendo mayores cantidades de materia prima para la elaboración. Además ha mejorado la situación económica de su hogar ya que ella es la responsable por ser madre soltera y con dos niños a sus responsabilidad.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Manzar

texts.en: Manzar is a resident of  the Saatli suburbs and she has a small plot of land where she keeps cows. She is 50 years old, not married and runs her business on her own. She has had her business for 8 years now. Currently, she has 4 cows. Manzar wants to buy more calves in order to raise them and have more income from her business. She therefore applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of 600 USD for 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her quantity of animals

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio is a single father of two children. He works hard to offer them education, food, and all their needs. The business he works at is a general store which he has been developing since he was very young, at the market of Bisne in the city of Chinandega. The business started when he went through a bad financial crisis, and he tells us that it was very difficult because he had no idea how he was going to be able to support his children, and that is why he decided to invest in this business.

With the experience he acquired with time, his business grew stronger, and in this way he has been able to support his household. He has been working with CEPRODEL for a year and a half, and in this time he has been given a total of 10 loans that he has used to invest in products to sell. His need is the urgency to invest in buying merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Eulogio es padre soltero y con dos hijos que lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio al que se dedica es una pulpería que desde muy joven la ha venido desarrollando en el mercado el Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega. El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviesa una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro ya que no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. Actualmente trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año y medio el cual le ha otorgado un total de 10 créditos que han sido utilizados en la inversión de los productos para su comercialización. Su necesidad es la urgencia de invertir en el negocio por medio de la compra de los productos.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Eneyda

texts.es:
Mrs. Eneyda R. has worked selling clothing for 10 years, in her own stand at the market of Bisne, located in the city of Chinandega. She started in this business because of her need to support her young son, because she is the only source of income in her home because she is a single mother.

Because of the difficult financial situation of Mrs. Eneyda, the clothing is placed on a wooden table, because she has not been able to save enough money to build shelves. For this reason, she has worked with Ceprodel, and been offered great opportunities to improve her business. Through these loans she has been able to acquire a greater volume of clothing to sell, and has also been able to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eneyda R. se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años en un tramo propio del mercado el Bisne ubicado en la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio por la necesidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo por la razón de que ella es el único sustento de su hogar ya que es madre soltera.

Por la difícil situación económica de la señora Eneyda, la ropa es colocada en una mesa de madera ya que no ha logrado ahorrar para construir un estante. Por este motivo, ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos créditos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de su hijo.

loans.use: Buying clothes (Compra de la ropa)

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Creating pants and shirts is a skill not everyone has, because it is a task which requires much interest and, above all, ability for fabricating clothing. Mr. Carlos Manuel is commonly known as "the tailor" at the market of Bisne in Chinandega. He has worked as a tailor for 16 years.

He started his business with lots of trouble because he has no customers and in addition he had the urgent need to support his 4 children, who are now teenagers. Through the years, he has developed his business through loans requested from Ceprodel to improve his business. Nowadays, thanks to 27 loans, Carlos Manuel, "the tailor", has acquired tailor products and has invested in buying a new sewing machine in better conditions than the one he had previously. His greatest desire is to increase his clientele to be able to keep supporting his household.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La elaboración de pantalones y camisas es una destreza que no todas las personas poseen por ser una labor que se necesita de mucho interés y sobre todo mucha habilidad para su elaboración. El señor Carlos Manuel conocido comúnmente como “el sastre” en el mercado Bisne de Chinandega se dedica a la labor de la sastrería desde hace 16 años.

Comenzó el negocio con mucha problemática ya que no poseía clientes y además tenia urgentemente que mantener a sus 4 hijos que hoy ya son jóvenes. A través de los años ha venido desarrollando su negocio por medio de créditos que ha solicitado en Ceprodel para el mejoramiento de su negocio. Hoy en día, gracias a 27 créditos otorgados Carlos Manuel “el sastre” ha adquirido sus productos de sastrería y además ha invertido en la compra de una nueva maquina con mejores condiciones que la anterior. Su mayor anhelo es captar mas clientes para seguir manteniendo su hogar.

loans.use: Buying sewing materials (Compra de materiales de costura)

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha R. is a hard working lady. She works selling basic need products at the market of Bisne in Chinandega. Barely six months ago, because of the difficult financial situation she was going through since she could not find a job anywhere, she decided to invest her meager savings buying general store products to sell.

It should be pointed out that Mrs. Martha R. is married, and mother of a son for whom she is responsible, and for whom she tries to cover all necessities because her husband's salary is not enough to pay for the household expenses. To improve her current situation, she has decided to take loans from CEPRODEL (3 loans) since she started her business, investing the first on as working capital, and the following ones in buying merchandise to stock her general store. Her greatest need is the urgency to acquire products to offer for sale in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Martha R. es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de productos de abarrotaría en el mercado el Bisne de Chinandega. Desde hace escasos seis meses por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Cabe señalar que la señora Martha R. es madre casada y con un hijo a su cargo que busca la manera de suplir todas sus necesidades ya que con el salario de su esposo no logra cubrir los gastos del hogar. Para mejorar la situación actual ha decidido hacer préstamos en CEPRODEL (3 créditos) desde que inicio su negocio, invirtiendo el primero en capital de trabajo y los siguientes en compra de los productos para la pulpería. Su mayor necesidad es la urgencia de adquirí los productos para venderlos en su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de productos)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos R. is a married father of six. For twenty one years, Carlos has operated a motorcycle shop which adjoins his house. With a good location, and constant clientele, his business has become very well known in the area. His reputation is among the best not only in motorcycle repairs but boat engine repair as well.

His ultimate goal is to have a larger shop, bring in more clientele, and increase the profits of his business. With a family of eight to support, Carlos understands the necessity of bringing in more customers, and keeping his current customers happy. He is asking for a loan to purchase motor parts and other provisions for his shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Pelagia Epifania

texts.es:
Mrs. M.'s business is selling prepared meals. She sells all sorts of dishes, which she prepares very early to then offer for sale at the market of Bisne of Chinandega. To be able to do this work, she buys ingredients on credit, paying them weekly, and when she has a chance, she buys in cash. Mrs. M. has had this business for six months, having started with great financial hardship which she has been able to overcome with time.

Ceprodel has offered her support through loans which have impacted her business, increasing the demand for her meals because she has been able to satisfy the need to buy ingredients for food preparation, and at the same time has been able to support her young son who needs his mother's help so much.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. M. es la venta de comida vendiendo todo tipo de platillos el cual los prepara muy temprano para después proceder a su venta en el mercado Bisne de Chinandega. Para poder realizar este negocio, ella compra productos (ingredientes) al crédito pagándolos a la semana y cuando tiene la oportunidad, realiza su compra de contado. La Sra. M. tiene seis meses de tener su negocio e inició con grandes dificultades económicas que a través del tiempo ha venido superando.

Ceprodel le brindó apoyo por medio de créditos otorgados siendo el impacto que han tenido estos créditos de mucha utilidad para su negocio por lo que ha habido un crecimiento en la demanda en su comida ya que ha podido suplir sus necesidades en la compra de los ingredientes de la comida y a la vez ha podido mantener a su pequeño hijo que tanto necesita del apoyo de su madre.

loans.use: Buying ingredients (Compra de ingredientes)

loans.name: Mayra Del S.

texts.es:
For 6 years now, Mrs. Maira R. has had a general store in the market of Bisne of the department of Chinandega. She is a married woman, mother of two children of school age. This is the reason that she works very hard to bring sustenance to her home, and to ensure that her children do not solely depend on their father's meager income, but also on hers as a hardworking mother.

From the beginning of her business, Mrs. Maira has had loans with Ceprodel. She has used these loans to buy products to stock her general store. Nowadays she is again in need of investment to acquire these products, and for this reason she requests a loan from CEPRODEL, knowing that she will make it. Her record is of 6 loans with this institution. It is important to point out that Mrs. R. has paid all of these loans back in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años atrás, la señora Maira R. se dedica al negocio de pulpería en el mercado el Bisne del departamento de Chinandega. Es madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar. Por tal motivo es que ella se esfuerza grandemente por llevar el sustento a su hogar y que sus hijos no solamente dependan de los bajos ingresos de su padre sino también de ella como madre esforzada.

Desde que inició su negocio, la señora Maira ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel de los cuales los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos para surtir su pulpería. Hoy en día una ves mas necesita la inversión en su negocio para la adquisición de estos productos y para ello es que solicita crédito en CEPRODEL sabiendo que no le fallará. Su record es de 6 créditos con esta institución. Cabe señalar que todos estos créditos han sido pagados en tiempo y forma por la señora R..

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her general store (Compra de los productos de la pulpería)

loans.name: Guillermo Noel

texts.es:
Cell phone repair is a business that requires much ability and dexterity because one must interact with very small and delicate parts which one must now how to manipulate for efficient repair. Guillermo Chavarri Garcia has worked on this business for three months in the city of Chinandega in the beautiful nation of Nicaragua.

Even though it has just started, his business has prospered greatly thanks to the support offered by Ceprodel, which has given him a total of 3 loans that he has used to invest in his locale, and also to buy two glass display cabinets where he can place the spare parts of the cell phones that he sells. His family life is very stable because he is a father with two children of school age whom he needs to support and offer their daily sustenance. His current need is investing to improve the infrastructure of his business, and in this way continue acquiring new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La reparación de celulares es un negocio que requiere de mucha habilidad y destrezas por el hecho de que se interactúa con piezas muy pequeñas y delicadas que deben saberse manipular para una eficiente reparación. A este negocio se dedica el caballero Guillermo Chavarri Garcia desde hace tres meses en la ciudad de Chinandega de la bella nación de Nicaragua.

Su negocio a pesar de que está naciendo ha venido prosperando grandemente gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel que le ha otorgado un total de 3 créditos que los ha utilizado para invertir en su cocal y además para la compra de dos vitrinas de vidrio donde coloca repuestos de celulares en venta. Su vida familiar es muy estable debido a que es padre de familia con dos hijos en la edad escolar a quienes tiene que mantener y llevar el sustento de cada día. Su necesidad actual es la inversión para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y de esta manera seguir ganando nuevos clientes.

loans.use: Expand his business (Ampliación del negocio)

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga Portilla is the owner and operator of a small grocery store called, “Lusito.” For five years now she has run this store to help contribute to her family income, pay the bills of the home her and her husband own, and to raise her four children.

Dominga wishes to increase the amount and variety of merchandise stocked in her store. Currently her store is in a good location and she has a good amount of clientele. In order to keep improve business, Dominga is asking for a loan to purchase popular, everyday goods like yerba, sugar, flour, rice and refreshments.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and goods for her store.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
La actividad de la señora Dinora C. se refiere a la venta de ropa (especialmente ropa interior para dama y caballero) desde hace 20 años en el mercado Central de Chinandega.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en lo interno del mercado en uno de los tramos que por cierto necesita remodelación.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero otorgándole créditos que los ha sabido utilizar debido a que ha mejorado sus ventas por haber adquirido mayores volúmenes de ropa ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. Su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de sus productos y para ello confía en que Ceprodel le apoyará con su necesidad.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
The business of señora Dinora C. has been selling clothing (especially underwear for women and men) for 20 years in the central market of Chinandega

She started the business selling outdoors using a small basket, later she used a cardboard box and, at present, she is located in the internal area of the market in one of the sections that certainly needs work.

Ceprodel has offered financial support, offering her loans that she has been known to use. Due to this she has improved her sales by acquiring greater quantities of clothes and she has managed to earn a living for her home. Her greater need is the acquisition of her products and for this she trusts that Ceprodel will support her with her need.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Dinora C. se refiere a la venta de ropa (especialmente ropa interior para dama y caballero) desde hace 20 años en el mercado Central de Chinandega.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en lo interno del mercado en uno de los tramos que por cierto necesita remodelación.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero otorgándole créditos que los ha sabido utilizar debido a que ha mejorado sus ventas por haber adquirido mayores volúmenes de ropa ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. Su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de sus productos y para ello confía en que Ceprodel le apoyará con su necesidad.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
The sale of plastic bags is the business in which Señora Maria Consuelo C. has been working very diligently for two years in the central market of the beautiful city of Chinandega.

Señora C.’s plastic bag sales business is often visited by people that are looking for plastic bags for different uses. It is for this reason that she is looking for a way to increase her business to satisfy the needs of her customers. In need because she does not have sufficient money to expand her business, she has requested loans from Ceprodel to purchase bags from her suppliers. These loans have been used directly for her business and as a result, she has managed to improve in part her situation, purchasing larger quantities of bags in order to later resell them. At present she has a credit record of 7 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de bolsas plásticas es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la dama Maria Consuelo C. desde hace dos años en el mercado central de la bella ciudad de Chinandega.

El negocio de la venta de bolsas plasticas de la señora C. se caracteriza por ser muy visitado por personas que buscan bolsas plásticas para diferentes usos y es por esta razón que ha buscado la manera de incrementar su negocio para satisfacer sus necesidades. Una necesidad que atraviesa es que a pesar de que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para ampliar su negocio, solicita créditos en Ceprodel para la compra de las bolsas a sus proveedores. Estos créditos le han sido otorgados directamente para su negocio y según comenta ha logrado mejorar en parte su situación vendiendo más cantidades de bolsas para luego comercializarlas. Actualmente tiene un record crediticio de 7 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags for resale.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel Benitaz has owned a convenience store for 17 years. With this business he is able to care for his wife, Vitalina, and their four children who are still in school. The store is called, “Comercial B.,” and is situated in a good location and services a good amount of clientele. From his sales, Gabriel has recently bought a small truck to transport his goods and his family.

He continues to work to increase his number of customers. His business is becoming popular in the neighborhood, and through good references and personal relationships, the word is spreading about the great quality of his store. With a loan he will continue to help the business grow by improving the facilities, and buying a greater variety of goods to sell in his store.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items and merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
Angelica O. is a very determined woman with a strong desire to improve herself. Amazingly, 40 long years ago she started her business making and selling tortillas in a section of the central market of Chinandga. She started with little capital that she invested on her own to purchase a wooden table for making tortillas. Nowadays her greater need is to purchase corn for making the tortillas.

Angelica has completed loans with Ceprodel (8 loans) and according to her account, they have given her of a lot of benefit in that she has acquired larger quantities of materials for making tortillas. In addition she has bought beans to prepare and sell in her own location.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelica O. es una dama muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación personal. Sorprendentemente, desde hace 40 largos años inició su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas en un tramo del mercado central de Chinandga. Inició con poco capital que lo invirtió de manera personal para la compra de una mesa de madera para elaborar las tortillas. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas.

Angélica ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (8 créditos) y según cuenta, le han sido de mucho beneficio por el hecho de que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Además ha comprado frijoles para prepararlos y venderlos en su propio local.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Paulo Abelino

texts.es:
Mr. Paulo Abelino’s business consists of selling clothing, as well as home electronics, footwear, and home products.

He began his business with about $322 US dollars, which was his life savings. He began his business in order to support his only child, as well as to make payments on his humble home. In order for support, he has sought Ceprodel, which has given him 17 loans in the past four years. With each loan, he has been able to convert it directly into purchasing his products. His main need at this time is to purchase products for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor Paulo Abelino es la venta de ropa y a la vez ofreciendo productos electrodomésticos, calzados y artículos del hogar.

Su negocio lo inicia con un capital de C$ 6000 (Seis mil córdobas) producto de sus ahorros a lo largo de su vida. Comienza el negocio porque se ve en la necesidad de mantener a su único hijo y además esta en la obligación de velar por los gastos de su humilde hogar de habitación. Para obtener apoyo ha recurrido a Ceprodel quien desde hace 4 años ha recibido un total de 17 créditos habiéndolos invertido directamente en la compra de sus productos. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es adquirir los productos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia C. Ayala is a mother of five and married to Felipe Careaga. She owns a grocery store which has been in business now for twelve years. Through this time she has gained both great business references and personal references. She has a vision for how she would like to increase the stores business. She feels that with the addition of a meat shop, she would gain more clientèle and increase business.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store with the hope that with increased business, she will be able to save enough to bring a butcher into the shop, and continue the upward growth of earnings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Dania Griselda

texts.es:
Mrs. Dania M. has a business selling fruits and vegetables, such as: yucca, onion, tomatoes, pears, and potatoes. This business is her economic basis, with which she sustains her family, and in which she converted all of her savings six years ago.

Her business is mobile, and she sells her fruits and vegetables at the bus terminals and from one corner of the market to the other. She has decided to ask for financial support through Ceprodel, which has been able to locate a permanent stand for her. Although it does not have the best conditions, it at least allows her to be in a fixed place rather than mobile.

She considers this financial support to be an economic pillar, which has allowed her to develop her business in order to improve her family’s quality of life. She hopes to improve her stand’s conditions little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Dania M. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras tales como: yuca, quiquisque, ayote, chayote, cebolla, tomate, papa. Este negocio es la base económica donde se sustenta su familia y en el cual decide invertir hace 6 años todos sus ahorros.

Inicia su negocio ambulante ofreciendo sus frutas y verduras en la terminales de buses y de un lado a otro en el mercado hasta que decide solicitar financiamiento y es por medio del apoyo de CEPRODEL que ha logrado establecerse en un local que aunque no tiene las mejores condiciones por lo menos le permite estar fija y no ambulante.

Considera que el apoyo financiero ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio ya que ha mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina Céspedes is from the city of General Aquino. She is a fifty five year old mother with four grown children.  For eight years she has owned a grocery store in a great location in the neighborhood and serves a large number of clientèle.  With a great reputation and business, Justina feels that it is time to take the next step in increasing her business. 

With a loan, Justina will buy a greater amount of goods to sell in her store, increase her earnings, and have a better quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
For the past five years, Mrs. Maria Elizabeth has been selling fruits and vegetables at her own stand in the central market in the beautiful city of Chinandega, Nicaragua.

Her business begins by strolling through the crowds, offering her fruits and vegetable in the market. However, when she secured a stand, she was trying to sell them as she could, since fruits and vegetables are perishable. Today, her main worry is acquiring products, and that is why she has sought Ceprodel to finance her loans. She has paid them correctly and on time according to her agreement.

Currently, her loan record is four loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Elizabeth desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un tramo propio del mercado central de la bella ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua.

Su negocio lo inicia ambulante ofreciendo sus frutas y verduras en el mercado pero al solicitar un local le fue otorgado por lo que buscó la manera de abastecerlo con los productos perecederos como lo son la frutas y las verduras. Hoy en día su mayor preocupación es la adquisición de los productos y para ello acude a Ceprodel quien le financia con préstamos que por cierto han sido pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo estipulado por la señora Maria Elizabeth.

Actualmente su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Marcia De La Concepc

texts.es:
Beverages such as milk, club soda, and soft drinks are in high demand in the city of Chinandega, and it is for this reason that Mrs. Marcia M. has been in the beverage business for 2 years. She is a widow with one son under her care, but despite her situation, she has managed to sustain her household and cover her living expenses. She makes every effort to improve her beloved son’s quality of life.

In order to improve her and her son’s socioeconomic status, Mrs. Marcia has requested a total of 7 loans from Ceprodel, which have greatly benefited her in the purchase of beverages for her business. Her greatest dream is to provide her son with all the tools he needs so that he can one day earn a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de productos de bebidas como leche, sodas y gaseosas es un negocio muy demandado en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es por tal motivo que la señora Marcia M. se dedica a esta actividad desde hace dos años. Es viuda y con la responsabilidad de un hijo a su cargo. A pesar de esta situación, ha logrado mantener a su hogar y cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Por tal motivo es que día a día se esfuerza para mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeño a quien tanto quiere.

Para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su hijo, la señora Marcia ha realizado un total de 7 créditos en Ceprodel que le han beneficiado grandemente en la adquisición de sus productos de bebidas para su respectiva comercialización. Son sus mayores sueños brindarle a su pequeño todas las necesidades para que en un futuro logre coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina J. works very diligently selling aluminum utensils and candy in the central market in Chinandega. She is very well known in the market due to her selling abilities and for always having a winning spirit at her business. She is the mother of three children, and works to support her husband as he helps them and their humble home.

In order to raise her standard of living, she has requested the help of Ceprodel, which has supported her through loans that have been paid correctly and on time. Her current portfolio reflects eight loans through Ceprodel, which she has used to purchase her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de utensilios de aluminio y dulces es el negocio al que con muchísimo esfuerzo se dedica la dama Luz Marina J. en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega. Esta dama es muy conocida en el mercado puesto que se caracteriza por tener habilidades para las ventas y mostrar siempre un espíritu de superación en su negocio. Es madre de tres hijos que se esfuerza para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de ellas y de su humilde hogar.

En busca de mejorar su nivel de vida, la señora Jarquein ha acudido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un apoyo por medio de créditos pagados en tiempo y forma. Su cartera crediticia actualmente es de 8 créditos con Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para adquirir sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Suyapa Yamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. M. lives in the city of Chinanega, and as of three years ago, she began selling various products via her own small store. She has two daughters, for which she works very hard to give them proper education, nutrition, and of course their mother’s love.

Her situation has been very difficult due to many hard economic crisis, and for that reason she works even harder to give her family nucleus the best life possible.

Mrs. M. has wisely uses loans from Ceprodel directly to purchase products and re-sell them. Her loan need comes from the fact that she has scarce resources, and not enough money to acquire the products she needs. She trusts Ceprodel to lend her support in order to get ahead in her business. Her record is six loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora M. es una dama que habita en la ciudad de Chinandega y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos varios o sea, pulpería. Es madre de dos hijas por las cuales lucha y se esfuerza grandemente por brindarles educación, alimentación y sobre todo el calos de madre.

Su situación ha sido muy difícil debido a que en su hogar han pasado crisis económicas fuertes y por tal razón se sobre esfuerza trabajando para brindarle lo mejor a su núcleo familiar.

Muy sabiamente la señora M. ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel que los ha utilizado directamente para la compra de los productos a los proveedores para luego comercializarlos. Su necesidad radica en que debido a que es de escasos recursos, no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir sus productos por eso es que confía en que Ceprodel le brindara su apoyo para salir adelante en su negocio. Su record es de 6 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of products to re-sale at her store

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro Antonio C. is a gentleman who has been selling food, drinks, and liquor for 35 years. In short, he owns a small bar in the city of León.

Before starting this business, Mr. S. used to work in construction, working on projects throughout different parts of the country depending on his job offers. The problem with this job was that due to its sporadic nature, there were times in which he would go many months without work, until there would be an opportunity to begin construction. Worried about this situation, he decided to invest little by little in buying beverages and liquor in order to sell them. He later decided to sell food as well, which he still does to this day.

He has achieved this long process with the support of CEPRODEL, which has given him loans that he has made good use of by remodeling his bar, offering more drinks, and selling food. He has requested a total of 9 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro Antonio C. es un caballero que desde hace 35 años se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, bebidas y licores, en otras palabras, es dueño de un pequeño bar en la ciudad de León.

Antes de tener el negocio, el señor S. se dedicaba a trabajar en la construcción, realizando obras en todas partes del país dependiendo donde les salían las ofertas de trabajo. El problema con este trabajo fue que como laboraba solamente por periodos, había momentos en los cuales pasaba largos meses sin trabajar hasta que apareciera una oportunidad para construir. Preocupado por esta situación decide invertir poco a poco para comprar bebidas y licores para comercializarlos. Luego incursiona con la venta de comidas hasta hoy en día.

Este largo proceso lo ha realizado con el apoyo de CEPRODEL que le ha brindado créditos que los ha sabido aprovechar para remodelar su negocio, ofrecer mas bebidas y la preparación de los alimentos. Su record crediticio es de 9 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of food and drinks

loans.name: Nelly Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelly S. is a very hardworking person who has been selling different styles of shoes and apparel in León, Nicaragua for 30 long years. She has two children to support. Her wish and the reason for all her efforts is to be able to save enough money to allow her children to both study and eventually attend college.

She started her business in a shabby business space, but little by little she has been investing in her business, ultimately buying shelves on which to place her shoes and apparel. It is important to stress that 3 years ago, Nelly started receiving loans from Ceprodel, loans that she has directly invested in the expansion of her business, the purchase of greater quantities of merchandise from her suppliers, and stocking up her business with the latest style of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Nelly S. es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desde hace 30 largos años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de todo estilo en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Es madre de dos hijos a los que tiene que mantener ya que su anhelo y el motivo de sus esfuerzos es para ahorrar para que sus hijos puedan estudiar e ir a la universidad.

Su negocio lo inició con un local en mal estado por lo que poco a poco ha venido invirtiendo en su negocio hasta comprar estantes donde colocar los calzados y la ropa. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 3 años la señora Nelly ha sido beneficiada con créditos en Ceprodel los que los ha invertido directamente en la ampliación de su negocio comprando mayores cantidades de ropa a sus proveedores y surtiendo su negocio con nuevos estilos de calzados.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Marcela José

texts.es:
Marcela L. is a very hardworking person who sells toys, apples, grapes, porcelain teacups, stemware, cosmetics, jewelry, grains, etc. In short, she has been operating a general store in the city of Leon for 8 years.

Her biggest motivation for having this business is her two small children whom she loves very much. She affirms that her greatest wish is to see them earn a university degree so that they can be successful in life. Despite having gone through rough times, financially speaking, Marcela has requested loans from Ceprodel in order to meet her needs, thus getting ahead in her general store. She has requested a total of 8 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcela L. es un apersona muy esforzada que se dedica a la venta de juguetes, manzanas, uvas, tasas de porcelana, copas de vidrio, cosméticos, bisuterías, granos básicos, etc. En fin es una tienda de víveres que la administra desde hace 8 años en la ciudad de Leon.

Su mayor motivo para seguir con este negocio han sido sus dos pequeños a los que ama mucho y afirma que son sus mayores deseos que ellos coronen una carrera universitaria para ser personas de éxito en la vida. A pesar de haber pasado por momentos muy complicados hablando financieramente, Marcela ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para apoyarse en sus necesidades y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio de víveres. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Juana Hilda

texts.es:
Eight years ago in the city of León, Mrs. Juana R. decided to invest her and her husband’s savings in a small cheese business in order to provide for their three children, who are underage and need a lot of support from their parents.

Mrs. R. is in charge of this business. She has been investing in her business space little by little, which is on a plot of land that she owns. Despite this fact, she still needs to invest more into her business, but she needs to have greater financial resources in order to achieve this project.

In order to bring about the improvement of her business, both in expanding the space and increasing inventory, Mrs. R. requests loans from Ceprodel. She has invested in her business buying products such as cream, cream cheese, curd, fresh cheese, and smoked curd. She has requested a total of 11 loans from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 8 años en la ciudad de León, la señora Juana R. decide invertir sus ahorros y los de su esposo en un pequeño negocio de venta de queso para mantener a sus tres hijos que necesitan un gran apoyo de sus padres por ser menores de edad.

La señora R. , se ha encargado de administrar este negocio y ha ido invirtiendo poco a poco en su localidad el cual es un terreno propio pero a pesar de esto, el negocio aun necesita de que se le invierta mas dinero y por ende se necesita tener mayores recursos financieros para realizar este proyecto.

Para llevar a cabo esta mejora en su negocio tanto en ampliación física como en aumento de productos, la señora Juana realiza créditos en Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido directamente en su negocio y adquirido otros productos como crema, queso de crema, cuajada, queso fresco y cuajada ahumada. Su record crediticio es de 11 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese from suppliers

loans.name: Guillermina De Los Á

texts.es:
“Variedades Angelitos” is the name of Mrs. Guillermina L.’s business, where she sells apparel exclusively for children ages 0-15 years. She started her business 10 years ago in the city of León using her life’s savings: $5,000 Nicaraguan córdobas.

Before starting this business, Guillermina was studying in high school, but after completing her studies and seeing the need to sustain her household, she decided to invest in this type of business. Today she sells her items cash or credit, having a steady clientele who pay off their debts responsibly.

To date, she has requested a total of 3 loans, which she has adequately invested in the purchase of apparel. Her vision is to one day sell men’s and women’s apparel as well.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Variedades Angelitos es el nombre del negocio de la señora Guillermina L. el cual vende ropa exclusiva para niños y niñas de diferentes edades que van desde recién nacidos hasta los 15 años. Su negocio lo comenzó desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de León con una inversión de Cinco mil córdobas obtenidos por ahorros propios recaudados a lo largo de su vida.

Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, Guillermina estudiaba la secundaria pero al finalizar y ver la necesidad de mantener su hogar decide invertir en este tipo de negocio. Hoy en día sus ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito, teniendo clientes fijos que son muy responsables al momento de la cancelación. Actualmente ha solicitado en Ceprodel un total de 3 créditos que los ha invertido satisfactoriamente en la adquisición de la ropa. Su visión es muy amplia ya que indica que anhela comercializar ropa para adultos damas y caballeros.

loans.use: Purchase of children’s apparel

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Elena R. sells fast food which she prepares at home, then sells in her diner. Mrs. R. has had this business for 30 years, and this eatery is frequented by numerous patrons since it is located on a busy street in the city of León.

She has two children, one of whom is under her care, so she has to provide her with an education. For this reason, Mrs. R. so enthusiastically prepares the delicious meals that she offers for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Ceprodel has been giving her support with loans for a year, giving her the opportunity to invest in her business, increasing her profits, and improving her business space. She states that those loans have made a notable impact on her business because her profits have increased and her living conditions have improved. She is determined to continue with these loans that only Ceprodel provides her with.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. Elena R. es la venta de comida la cual la prepara en su casa para después proceder a su venta en su local de habitación. La Sra. R. tiene 30 años de tener su negocio y este comedor es visitado por varios clientes ya que está ubicado en un acalle muy transitada de la ciudad de León.

Es madre de dos hijas de las cuales una de ellas esta bajo su responsabilidad y tiene el deber de brindarle los estudios, por este motivo es que muy esforzadamente la señora R. se dedica a preparar los deliciosos platillos para ofertarlos en el desayuno, almuerzo y la cena.

Ceprodel le brinda apoyo por medio de financiamientos desde hace un año dándole oportunidad para invertir en su negocio, aumentar sus utilidades y mejorar su infraestructura. Según indica, los impactos de estos créditos para su negocio han sido muy notables ya que ha aumentado sus ganancias y mejorado sus condiciones de vida por lo que está dispuesta a seguir con estos financiamientos que solo Ceprodel le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase of fast food ingredients

loans.name: Marvin Francisco

texts.es:
Before selling groceries and accessories, Marvin L. dedicated himself only to his studies. However, because of his family’s financial needs, he chose to look for a way to gain employment. Upon not being able to find a job, he decided to invest what little savings he had in purchasing merchandise to put up for sale.

During these difficult economic circumstances, he established his business in his own dilapidated house in the city of León. Nevertheless, Marvin has been investing in his business space over the years.

For two years, Marvin has obtained several loans from Ceprodel in order to improve his business space and to purchase accessories. These loans have greatly benefited him, and he says that with the help of Ceprodel, he will be able to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur in the jewelry market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marvin L. antes de tener su negocio de venta de bisuterías y viveres, solamente se dedicaba a estudiar, pero por la necesidad económica que atraviesa en su familia, decide buscar la manera de obtener un empleo, pero al no encontrarlo decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de los productos para la venta.

En medio de difíciles circunstancias económicas, al inicio se establece en la ciudad de León en su propia casa de habitación en malas condiciones, sin embargo a medida que los años pasan invierte poco a poco en la infraestructura de su localidad.

Desde hace dos años atrás, Marvin ha obtenido créditos en Ceprodel para invertirlos en el mejoramiento de su local y también en la adquisición de las bisuterías. Estos créditos le han beneficiado grandemente y según comenta seguirá trabajando con Ceprodel para realizar su sueño de ser un gran comerciante en el mercado de las bisuterías.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and jewelry

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia has been part of the community bank “Amaquella”, which means “do not be lazy” in Quechua, for two years. In the community bank she has learned to save, be responsible, and be disciplined. In addition, she has learned that she has self worth.

Anatolia is 44 years old. She is married and has six children, the youngest of whom is 12 years old and attends the local junior high. Some of her older children were unable to continue school because they did not have enough money. Anatolia sells food at the Magdalena market in Ayacucho. She has been selling from her cart for many years. Furthermore, for the last month Anatolia has been renting a stand in the Nery G. market where she sells food staples such as flour, sugar, and milk. Anatolia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy rice, sugarm noodles, milk, semolina, mayonnaise, and tuna fish.

One of the key features of the community bank is that each associate has an interest earning savings account. Anatolia plans to use her savings to pay for her children’s education and for any emergency that may arise. Her dream is to own a home, have a bigger business, help her children become professionals, and buy a motorcycle taxi that her oldest child would be able to operate.

loans.use: Anatolia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1) in order to buy rice, sugarm noodles, milk, semolina, mayonnaise, and tuna fish.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
León is an area where there exist many businesses in different places such as markets, streets and even in homes themselves. Such is the case of Martha who for 25 years has dedicated herself to the business of selling various products from her own home. Despite being a single mother with a low income, her two daughters support her in her daily work selling products.

As all beginnings are complicated, the pulpería (convenience store) began with the sale of just a few products which didn’t sell easily. However, as a result of the passing of time, her business started to become more robust and thanks to the loans which CEPRODEL granted her (12 loans), today she may enjoy better economic conditions and she has improved the standard of living for her family, especially that of her daughters, who like their mother, are hard-working women who are motivated to excel.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

León es un departamento donde existen muchos negocios en diferentes lugares como los mercados, calles y hasta en los propios hogares. Tal es el caso de la señora Martha que por largos 25 años se ha dedicado al negocio de las ventas de productos varios (pulpería) ubicado en su propio hogar de habitación. A pesar de ser madre soltera y con bajos ingresos económicos, sus dos hijas la apoyan en su labor diaria de venta de los productos.

Como todo inicio es complicado, la pulpería inició con la venta de pocos productos que a propósito no se vendían fácilmente, pero a medida del transcurso del tiempo, su negocio fue enrobusteciéndose y gracias a los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel (12 créditos ) hoy puede gozar de mejores condiciones económicas y ha mejorado el nivel de vida de su familia esencialmente el de sus hijas que al igual que su mamá son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con un alto espíritu de superación.

loans.use: Purchase products for sale.

loans.name: Hector Ramon

texts.es:
Hector G. began selling food from his home in León. He is known as being very dedicated to his business since he always has searched for the way to capture the attention of his customers and make them feel important. His home where his business is located serves as a small restaurant where customers arrive, order food and are quickly served their meals.

Hector G.’s business is in urgent need of remodeling the bathrooms that customers use. It is necessary to buy new sinks, lighting and paint. To achieve this, he has received loans from CEPRODEL, which have allowed him to improve the condition of his business through the purchase of some of the materials he needs. He will obtain the other part through the next loan that he is certain will be granted by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hector G. inicia su actividad de venta de comida en su casa de habitación en León. Se ha caracterizado por ser muy dedicado a su negocio ya que siempre ha buscado la manera de captar la atención al cliente y hacer que se sientan importantes. Su casa de habitación donde se ubica el negocio sirve como pequeño restaurante donde los clientes llegan, solicitan la comida y al instante son servidos sus alimentos.

La necesidad con urgencia del negocio de don Hector Granero es que necesita remodelar sus baños por lo que los clientes hacen uso de ellos. Es necesaria la compra de un nuevo lavamanos, luminaria y pintora. Para realizar esta actividad ha recibido créditos en CEPRODEL que le han permitido mejorar las condiciones de su negocio por medio de la compra al contado de parte de los materiales que necesita. La otra arte la obtendrá por medio del próximo crédito que muy seguro cree que le será otorgado por Ceprodel.

loans.use: Invest in restaurant.

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Cecilia, Noemí, and Teofila have been part of the community bank “Amaquella”, which means “do not be lazy” in Quechua, for 12, 8, and 8 years respectively. In that time they have learned responsibility and punctuality, how to invest and save money, and how to get along with the other associates.

Cecilia is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and four children. Cecilia and her husband sell cebiche, a traditional dish maD. from marinating fish in lemon juice. Her husband sells the cebiche from their stand and Cecilia sells it from a bicycle cart that she rides around the city.

Neomí is 29 years old. By profession she is a professor, but works selling cochinilla, an insect used to make red dyes, in regional markets and on the principal streets of Ayacucho. Later she dries the cochinilla and transports them to Lima to sell. In addition, she sells firewood from her house.

Meanwhile, Teofila is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. Teofila buys cochinilla in various markets around the region and the central market of Ayacucho. She then sells them to an intermediary who takes them to Lima.

Cecilia, Noemí, and Teofilia need loans of 1000, 1000, and 1200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying plates, spoons, cochinilla, and firewood. Cecilia will invest part of the loan in building a house. Cecilia, Noemí, and Teofilia dream of owning a home, completing a masters degree, and having their children become professionals.

loans.use: Cecilia, Neomí, and Teofilia need loans of 1000, 1000, and 1200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying plates, spoons, cochinilla, and firewood. Cecilia will invest part of the loan in building a house.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Francisco M. is a gentleman who some years ago took the time to learn a task that would generate an income for him. Because of his skills he decided to take a course in electronics. Currently he has a business in this field and he does it from his house in the city of Leon.

He is married and has two small children to maintain. Francisco makes an effort to do a high quality work in order to gain new clients, and to be able to make a living so he can provide for his wife and children . He repairs household-electric appliances, TV, recorders, irons, amplifiers, heaters, etc.

Ceprodel has offered credits to him that have been used very satisfactorily, so now he does not only repair the household- appliances but to sell parts as well. He is asking for a loan in order to buy more parts and resale them to his clients.

Francisco M. es un caballero que hace varios años atrás se preocupo por aprender un oficio que le generara recursos, de acuerdo a sus habilidades decide estudiar un curso de electrónica que es el negocio al que se dedica hoy en día en su casa de habitación en el departamento de León.

Por ser casado y con dos pequeños hijos que mantener, Francisco M. se esfuerza para hacer su trabajo con la mas alta calidad con el propósito de ganar la atención de nuevos clientes y así poder ganarse la vida apoyando a su esposa e hijos en todo lo que necesitan. Entre los electrodomésticos que repara se encuentran t.v, grabadoras, planchas, amplificadores, calentadores, etc.

Ceprodel le ha brindado créditos que han sido usados muy satisfactoriamente de manera que hoy en día no solamente repara los electrodomésticos sino que también ha adquirido algunos repuestos para su respectiva venta. Su deseo es que se le otorguen mas créditos para comprar mas repuestos y vendérselos a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy parts to resale on his business

loans.name: Noemi's Group

texts.en:
Victoria, Noemí, and Bertha have been part of the community bank “Universo” for the past 2, 1, and 1 years respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible and punctual, and to use their loans effectively.

Victoria is 50 years old. She is separated from her husband and has five children. Victoria buys grains in bulk in the town of Huanta and sells them in the markets of Ayacucho.

Noemí is 33 years old and has three children. She has had a tailor shop for six years. Her shop is located on the central street of Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Bertha is 30 years old and lives with her partner and four children. Berta sells a variety of beverages from a cart in the Nery Garcia market.

Victoria, Noemí, and Bertha need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying corn, beans, fabric, thread, and sugar. A key aspect of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Victoria, Noemí, and Bertha plan to use their savings in the case of an emergency, to continue expanding their businesses, and to build a home. Their dreams are to educate their children, open a store, and to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: Victoria, Noemí, and Berta need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying corn, beans, fabric, thread, and sugar.

loans.name: Gregoria Argentina

texts.es:
Gregoria M. is a mother of two children in scholastic age, she is an entrepreneur and desires to develop a mill business to be able to support her family. Her biggest dream is to see her children turn out as great professionals

Twenty years ago Mrs. M. started her business with her own savings and got a small mill machine. Over the years her business has been increasing, and she has been able to offer a better service with good mill machines. She grinds all type of products like cacao, corn, different grains, etc.

Mrs. M. has worked with CEPRODEL for several years and she feels very satisfied with their support, this way she has been able to increase her business, satisfy her customers’ needs and provide for her children. She has a record of 17 Loans and hopes to obtain greater amounts of credits to grow her business and get new customers. Her current need is to buy replacement parts for the mills.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Gregoria M. es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, es emprendedora y con deseos de desarrollar su negocio de molino para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.

Desde hace veinte años la Sra. M. inició con una pequeña maquina de moler la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer un mejor servicio con buenas maquinas de moler todo tipo de producto como cacao, maiz, granos, etc. Su capital inicial lo obtuvo por medio de ahorros propios que obtuvo a lo largo de su juventud.

La Sra. M. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace varios años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos y anhela obtener mayores cantidades de créditos para engrandecer su negocio y llamar la atención de nuevos clientes. Su actual necesidad es la compra de repuestos para el molino.

loans.use: To buy partsfor her  mill business

loans.name: Juana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
14 years ago in the city of Leon Mrs. Juana R. was working as a maid ironing, washing and making the tasks at different people's homes. Since this business did not generate enough income for her, she decided to invest $1000 Córdobas for the purchase of a sewing machine because she has great skills in this area

She started her business and did advertising in the area where she was located. People started to get to know her business little by little and realized that she had great skills in this field.

Currently she has the necessity to invest in the maintenance of the sewing machine and the acquisition of materials like threads, scissors, coils, fabrics, etc. She has made credits in Ceprodel to continue maintaining her tailor business and to improve the standard of life for her and her family. She has received a total of 20 credits

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 14 años en la ciudad de León la dama Juana R. se dedicaba al trabajo de empleada domestica planchando, lavando y realizando los quehaceres del hogar en diferentes lugares. Por la necesidad de subsistir ya que este negocio no le generaba ganancias decide de manera personal invertir la cantidad de Un mil córdobas netos para la compra de una maquina de coser ya que desde muy pequeña ha tenido destrezas en este ramo.

Comienza su negocio y para acaparar clientes realiza publicidad en el sector donde ella vive sin embargo, por ser el inicio no contaba con clientes en su negocio. Poco a poco al darse cuenta las personas de la existencia de un taller de costura fueron llegando los clientes hasta que se fueron convenciendo de que la señora Juana R. presentaba destrezas en este campo. Hoy en día, ella tiene la necesidad de invertir en el mantenimiento de maquinas y adquisición de materiales como hilos, tijeras, bobinas, telas, etc. Par esto ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para seguir manteniendo su taller y a la vez mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y su familia. Anteriormente ha realizado un total de 20 créditos

loans.use: Compra de los materiales utilizados en la costura

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
Jose G. works in the city of Leon and is affiliated with a cooperative where his job is to transport loads within Leon and the surrounding areas.. He transports loads of different natures, and this business is paid according to the distance of the route and the weight of the load.

The reason why he is asking for the loan in Ceprodel, is because the truck that he owns needs to be repaired and some parts need to be replaced.

It is necessary to emphasize that the money that he makes in this business is his only income. If the truck is not in good state, he will not be able to provide for his family. The benefits that he has obtained working with Ceprodel are satisfactory, it has allowed him to do maintenance to his truck so he can keep working and providing for his family. He is asking for a loan of $1200

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

José G. labora en la ciudad de León y está afiliado a una cooperativa donde su función es encomendarle viajes de transporte de cargas dentro de León y en las afueras. Las cargas que puede transportar en los camiones pueden ser de diferentes naturalezas, y este negocio le es pagado de acuerdo a la distancia de recorrido y a veces al peso de la carga.

El motivo por el cual solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es porque es dueño de un camión que necesita ser reparado y comprarle nuevos repuestos para su funcionamiento.

Es necesario destacar que este negocio es su único ingreso y si el camión no está en buen estado difícilmente podrá seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar que tanto lo necesita. Desde que ha estado trabajando con Ceprodel los beneficios que ha obtenido son satisfactorios debido a que le ha realizado inspecciones mas consecutivas a su camión y además ha llevado el pan diario a su mesa familiar.

loans.use: To repair his business truck

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Rut, Regina, and Norma have been part of the community bank “Imperio” for four months, fifteen years, and three years respectively. In the community bank they have learned how to educate their children, have good hygiene, and save. In addition, they enjoy celebrating the birthdays of all of the other associates.

Rut is 22 years old, the single mother of one son. Rut sells food from a cart at the Nery Garcia market in the city of Ayacucho.

Regina is 53 years old and has four children. She sells onions from a cart in the Nery Garcia market.

Meanwhile, Norma is 42 years old, and lives with her partner and three children. Norma makes desserts such as cookies and apple pie. She sells them to stores and cafes.

Rut, Regina, and Norma need loans of 600, 800 and 1400 soles, (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying rice, oil, sugar, firewood, flour, and butter. Rut, Regina, and Norma dream that their children will have a better life and find jobs as professionals, they will own a home, and that their businesses will continue to grow.

loans.use: Rut, Regina, and Norma need loans of 600, 800 and 1400 soles, (3 soles = $1) which they will invest in buying rice, oil, sugar, firewood, flour, and butter.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza O., like all Nicaraguan women, is very hardworking. She makes and sells delicious tortillas in the city of León for a living.

Amazingly, she has been operating this business out of her own home for 58 years, which allows her to earn both a steady income and a steady source of customers.

For the development of her business, CEPRODEL represents an important pillar for her and her family since the loans received from this institution have given her business the opportunity to grow, thus boosting her sales. With these loans, she has been able to purchase firewood, corn, and corn flour so that she can make her tortillas. Furthermore, these loans have helped her cover her numerous household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maritza O. como toda mujer nicaragüense es muy trabajadora y se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de deliciosas tortillas en la ciudad de León

Sorprendentemente, desde hace 58 años tiene su establecimiento en su casa de habitación lo que le permite un ingreso mas estable y atiende una clientela fija.

En el desarrollo de su negocio CEPRODEL representa un pilar importante para ella y su familia debido a que le ha brindado la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio por medio de los créditos y así salir adelante en su actividad económica. Con la entrega de estos créditos ha realizado compras de la leña, maíz y masa para hacer sus tortillas, además estos créditos le han servido para cubrir los altos gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Facunda's Group

texts.en:
Reynalda, Facunda, and Esperanza have been members of the community bank “Imperio” for three, four and four years respectively. In that time they have learned how to save money, manage their business, and educate their children.

Reynalda is 46 years old. She lives with her partner and seven children. Reynalda has a small tailor shop in her house. In addition, she sells cosmetics to her friends and family.

Facunda is 43 years old. She is married and has four children. Facunda sells food from a cart in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells cosmetics from a catalogue to her friends and family.

Meanwhile, Esperanza is 59 years old. Married with three children, she makes typical clothing and knits sweaters. She brings both products to various markets around the region. At the markets she buys cheeses which she then sells in Ayacucho. Reynalda, Facunda, and Esperanza need loans of 1000, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying fabrics, threads, and wool, repairing a sewing machine, and adding tables to their business.

An important part of the community bank is the fact that each associate has an interest earning savings account. Reynalda, Facunda, and Esperanza plan to use their savings to pay for their children’s education, build a house, and pay their son’s university graduation fee. Their dreams are to own a house, a store, and a restaurant, and to help their children become professionals.

loans.use: Reynalda, Facunda, and Esperanza need loans of 1000, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying fabrics, threads,and wool, repairing a sewing machine, and adding tables to their business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta has always tried to help her children get ahead. Her husband works in construction, but he does not earn enough income to cover all the household expenses. This is why 2 years ago, Julieta started to sell groceries out of her home. Little by little, she has been accumulating her clientele, and she currently counts on a big group of customers who request various items that she does not offer.

For this reason, Julieta is requesting a loan of $250.00 USD, which she promises to pay back in 6 months. With this loan, she will be able to buy new merchandise and offer a wider variety of products. With your support, Julieta will be able to help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Julieta siempre a tratado de sacar adelante a sus hijos. El esposo de ella, se dedica a la construcción, y lo que gana no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de su casa. Es por eso que Julieta hace 2 años, comenzó a vender abarrotes en su casa, y así poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes, actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo mayor de clientes, quienes le solicitan varios artículos con los que ella no cuenta.

Es por eso que Julieta está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Julieta podrá comprar mercancía nueva para poder tener mayor surtido en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Julieta podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Jesus' Group

texts.en:
Maria, Elizabeth, and Asenciona have been part of the community bank “Inti”, which means “sun” in Quechua, for six years.

Maria is 30 years old and lives with her partner and two children. She and her husband raise cattle on their farm in the town of Santiago de Pischa and sell them at the San Juan de Bautista cattle market. In addition, four months ago Maria began selling cosmetics from a catalogue.

Elizabeth is 37 years old., married and has two children. Elizabeth has a beauty salon in the city of Lima and also sells beauty products from a catalogue.

Meanwhile, Asenciona is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. Asenciona travels to the market in Huanta where she buys animals which she later butchers and sells in the town of Quinua. Maria, Elizabeth, and Asenciona need loans of 1000, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying cows, beauty creams, cosmetics, pork, guinea pigs (which are eaten in Peru), and chickens.

An important part of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Maria, Elizabeth, and Asenciona plan to use their savings to increase the capital available for their businesses and to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are to buy a car, study cosmetology, open a spa in their home, and give their children a good education.

loans.use: Maria, Elizabeth, and Asenciona need loans of 1000, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying cows, beauty creams, cosmetics, pork, guinea pigs (which are eaten in Peru), and chickens.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina lives in the district of Santiago D. Pischa, which is one hour outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. Marcelina is 67 years old. She is a widow and has eight children, five of whom still depend on her.

Marcelina is a member of the community bank “Inti”, which means "sun" in Quechua, where she learned to be punctual, responsible, and to save. With her savings she was able to buy a second car. Marcelina raises animals such as cows, pigs, and chickens. She sells them either directly from her farm or at different markets around the region. In addition, Marcelina has two cars that her children use to transport people between small towns in the area. Marcelina needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy cattle.

An important aspect of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Marcelina plans to use her savings to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to build a house for her children, buy a motorcycle taxi that one of her children can drive, and see her children become professionals.

loans.use: Marcelina needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy cattle.

loans.name: Eleuteria's Group

texts.en:
Carmen and Eleuteria have all been part of the community bank “Inti”, which means “sun” in Quechua, for a year or less. In that time they have learned how to develop their businesses and to save. In addition, they have learned how to care for their children, and how to avoid sicknesses.

Carmen is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and one son. Carmen and her partner make ice cream, yogurt, and milkshakes, which they have been selling at various markets in the area for one year. Carmen used to make ice cream as an employee, but prefers having her own business. During the rainy season Carmen and her husband have a car detailing business.

On the other hand, Eleuteria is 31 and lives with her partner and three children. She and her partner are artisan weavers who make beautiful tapestries and pillows. Eleuteria lives in the artisan neighborhood of Santa Ana. She sells her products in Cuzco, both in her home and to intermediaries. Carmen and Eleuteria need loans of 600 and 400 soles, which they will use to buy sugar, alpaca wool, weaving needles, and some replacement parts for the loom.

One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Carmen and Eleuteria plan to use their savings to buy a piece of property and later build a house on it. Their dreams are to own a house, see their children become professionals, and to continue developing their businesses.

loans.use: Carmen and Eleuteria need loans of 600 and 400 soles in order to buy sugar, alpaca wool,  weaving needles, and some replacement parts for the loom.

loans.name: Maria Angelica's Group

texts.en:
Anjanne, Maria, and Blanca have been part of the community bank Alianza for 4, 7, and 1 years respectively.

Anjanne is 40 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Anjanne sells a type of alcohol made from sugar cane in the northern coastal region of Peru. She sells her products from a rented stand in the local market of Ayacucho.

Maria is 36 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Maria owns a stand in one of the artisan markets of Ayacucho. She sells a variety of products typical of the region. In addition, she knits some products by hand and sells them from her stand.

Meanwhile, Blanca is 39 years old, married and has four children. Blanca grows vegetables in the Campañia valley. She sells her vegetables at the Nery Garcia market in the city of Ayacucho. Anjanne, Maria, and Blanca need loans of 1400, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy fertilizer, seeds, replacement parts for a car, and to pay for one of their children to go to the university.

In the community bank they have learned how to save, be punctual, and be responsible. In addition, they have learned how to work in solidarity with the other associates. One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Anjanne, Maria, and Blanca plan to use their savings to increase the capital available for their businesses and pay for their children’s education. Their goals are to have bigger businesses, buy a house, and enable their children to continue studying.

loans.use: Anjanne, Maria, and Blanca need loans of 1400, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1) in order to buy fertilizer, seeds, replacement parts for a car, and to pay for one of their children to go to the university.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy Castellon drives a bus in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. From the age of 24, he has worked in this business with his father. However, with his father now getting older, he has given the business to Eddy, who continues offering service along a well known route in Leon.

Today his biggest need is to invest in the repair and maintenance of the bus, which is already in poor condition. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to improve his business and offer a better service to his passengers.

Eddy Castellon es un caballero que se dedica al negocio de servicio de transporte en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde hace 24 años inició trabajando con su padre en este negocio, sin embargo, al apartarse del negocio (su padre) por la avanzada edad, le hereda el bus a su hijo quien hoy en día lo maneja realizando viajes ya que está afiliado a una ruta del sector transporte en León.
