Hoy en día la mayor necesidad que atraviesa el señor Castillo es que desea invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento del bus ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones y desperfectos mecánicos. Por tal motivo, acude a Ceprodel con el fin de que le proporcione crédito para mejorar su unidad de transporte y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED FOR REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE ON  HIS BUS.  THE BUS IS IN POOR CONDITION AND  HE NEEDS TO OFFER A BETTER SERVICE TO HIS PASSENGERS.

loans.name: Luz Marleny's Group

texts.en:
Juana and Luz have been part of the community bank “Alianza” for one year. In their bank they have learned how to be organized, to save, have improved their self-esteem. They mentioned that they look forward to the weekly meetings because it is an opportunity to share everything that is happening in their lives.

Juana is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. Juana has been selling food staples such as rice, sugar, and flour in the Nazarenas market for five years. Before this she had a small store in her home. Meanwhile Luz is 29 years old and single. She sells a variety of regional crafts in the artisan markets of Ayacucho. In addition, she makes and sells both necklaces and earrings. Juana and Luz need loans of 1000 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), with which they will buy lentils, mutton, beans, alabaster, a variety of other stones, and jewelry wire for their businesses.

Their dreams are to own a home, have a successful business, and to see their children become professionals.

loans.use: Juana and Luz need loans of 1000 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), with which they will buy lentils, mutton, beans, alabaster, a variety of other stones, and jewelry wire.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Moreno is a widow with one son at home to take care of. To support her home, she decided to open up a small stand in a main market of Leon and invested in products to sell. With the difficult economic situation and the need to take care of her young son, she has put a great deal of effort into this business, stocking different products to sell from her small general store.

Juana has worked with Ceprodel for one year and the loans have given her many opportunities to build her humble business.

Juana Moreno es una dama viuda y con un hijo a su responsabilidad. Ella decide poner una venta (pulpería) en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León. Para obtener el sustento de su hogar ya que es viuda, decidió invertir en la compra de productos para pulpería.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica y con la necesidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo decide con mucho esfuerzo comenzar a invertir en el negocio surtiendo su estante de diferentes productos para su debida comercialización.

La señora Moreno trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, ya que le han servido para salir adelante en su humilde negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THIS WIDOW NEEDS TO BUY MORE PRODUCTS TO SELL FROM HER SMALL STAND IN THE MARKET. THE MONEY FROM HER BUSINESS HELPS SUPPORT HER AND HER YOUNG SON.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria M. sells tortillas and food which she prepares by hand in her home, later taking them to the market in the main terminal to sell. She prepares many local dishes, the most popular is a dish called nacatamal and her tortillas.

She has had her business for 15 years, starting it with her small savings which she got from her mother. She began selling her food outside the market until she was able to secure a stand inside.

The most important thing she needs now is to purchase stock and materials for her business; corn, charcoal and ingredients to make her tortillas and other dishes. Ceprodel has lent a helping hand in growing this business, with a total of 8 loans which have had a great impact on her business.

La actividad de la sra. Maria M. es la venta de tortillas y comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado la Terminal preparando variedad de platillos siendo los mas demandados el nacatamal y las tortillas.

Tiene 15 años de tener su negocio y se inició con un monto inicial de C$2,000 producto de ahorros personales que almacenaba cuando su madre le regalaba. Ella inició vendiendo estos alimentos en las afueras del mercado al aire libre hasta que logro conseguir su local en el mercado la Terminal.

La mayor necesidad que atraviesa actualmente la señora M. es que debe de adquirir el maíz, carbón y leña para realizar las tortillas y los nacatamales. Por tal razón acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio con un total de 8 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS AND MATERIALS FOR HER SMALL STAND IN THE MARKET.  SHE NEEDS INGREDIENTS TO MAKE HER TORTILLAS AND OTHER LOCAL DISHES.

loans.name: Emilia's Group

texts.en:
Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes have been part of the community bank “Kausahun”, which means “alive” in Quechua, for 6, 2, and 1 years respectively. In that time they have learned to be punctual, to be leaders, to manage their businesses, and to live according to their values.

Emilia is 60 years old. She is a widow and has eight children, three of whom live with her. Emilia works with her daughters selling typical foods at the Americas market. Previously, she maD. and sold bread but was able to start her new business because she had the help of her daughters. On the other hand, Iliana is only 23. She has a small grocery store in her house. She has decided to move her store to the nearby jungle region where there is greater demand. Iliana is also studying at the university. Meanwhile, Mercedes is 56 years old. She has six children, three of whom live with her. Mercedes sells various grains in the Magdalena neighborhood of Ayacucho. Before this she sold food but did not have enough sales, so she decided to start this new venture Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, oil, potatoes, spices, sugar, vegetables, and grains.

An important part of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes plan to use their savings to build a house, pay for their children’s school, and have an emergency fund. In order to achieve these goals, they are striving to have a larger business, be professional, and maintain stable jobs.

loans.use: Emilia, Iliana, and Mercedes need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying rice, oil, potatoes, spices, sugar, vegetables, and grains.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
When Alicia married she thought it was going to be for her whole life. However, due to difficulties in her marraige, it ended. After the separation Alicio entered into a depression, but she still needed to move forward and find a way to support her children. That was the motivation for her to begin her small business. Fortunately, she has great strength, which animated her to start selling meals from her house. Little by little, and with the help of her friends, she began to gain the knowledge to build her business.

Now she counts on various customers, but she's not been able to increase her production because the costs of running her home and supporting her children take most of the profit. So Alicia is requesting a credit a loan of $475 which she will repay in 6 months. With the money she will be able to buy merchandise, increase her food production and grow her profits. With your help, Alicia will be able to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Alicia se casó pensando que este paso sería para toda la vida. Sin embargo por desacuerdos en su matrimonio, este se terminó. Después de la separación Alicia entró en una depresión. Sin embargo tenía que salir adelante para poder mantener a sus hijos. Fue así como se decidió poner un pequeño negocio. Afortunadamente Alicia cuenta con una sazón muy rica, lo cual la hizo animarse a poner su venta de comidas en la casa. Poco a poco y con la ayuda de sus amigos, Alicia se fue haciendo conocida.

Actualmente ya cuenta con varios clientes, sin embargo Alicia no a podido incrementar su producción puesto que los gastos de sus hijos absorben mucho dinero. Es por eso que Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Alicia podrá comprar mercancía para incrementar su producción de comida y así poder tener mayores ingresos. Con tu ayuda Alicia podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MORE INGREDIENTS FOR HER SMALL BUSINESS PREPARING AND SELLING MEALS FROM HER HOUSE, GROW HER PROFITS AND PROVIDE A BETTER LIFE FOR HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
A few years ago Perla found part time work as an assistant to a woman selling used clothing. Through this work, she learned all she needed to dedicate herself to this kind of work. After saving some money, she started a business of her own one year ago. Thanks to this effort, Perla is earning more than she did as an assistant, which was not enough to cover her household costs. As a single mother, she must provide for her young son.

Today she needs more merchandise to sell. Perla is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 6 months, so she can purchase more used clothing and offer a greater variety to her customers. With your help, Perla will be able to provide a better quality of life for her son.

Hace varios años que Perla consiguió un trabajo informal como ayudante de una vendedora de ropa usada. Con la cual aprendió todo lo necesario para dedicarse a este oficio. Fue así como después de ahorrar un poco de dinero, se independizó, hace un año, gracias a este esfuerzo Perla está adquiriendo un poco más de ingresos puesto que con lo que ganaba como ayudante, no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su casa. Puesto que ella es madre soltera del pequeñito con el que sale en la foto.

Actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía. Es por eso que Perla está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Perla podrá comprar una paca de ropa usada para poder tener más variedad en sus productos. Con tu ayuda Perla podrá salir adelante con este negocio y brindarle lo mejor a su hijo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE USED CLOTHING FOR HER BUSINESS AND OFFER HER CUSTOMERS A GREATER VARIETY.  HER BUSINESS PROVIDES THE INCOME SHE NEEDS TO SUPPORT HER YOUNG SON.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Two years ago, Maria Elena started offering used clothing to her friends and people she knew. Little by little, she became well known for this business. When she finished with the small amount of clothing she had purchased, she had to look for another way to obtain these products at a better price. She found a place where she could buy the clothing wholesale, and she took advantage of this type of business to set up a small shop in her home.

However, now she does not have enough merchandise to offer her customers, and much of what she has is from the previous season. For this reason Maria Elena is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to buy more merchandise. In this way, she will continue to grow her business and be able to help her family improve their quality of life.

María Elena, comenzó hace dos años a ofrecerle ropa a sus amistades y poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida entre sus amigas. Cuando se terminó la poca ropa que había comprado, tuvo que buscar otra manera para poder obtener este tipo de productos a un mejor precio y así encontró un lugar en el que se vende la ropa por mayoreo. María Elena aprovechó este tipo de negocio para ella hacer el suyo en un mercadito que está por su casa.

Sin embargo actualmente María Elena no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes, además de que la que tiene actualmente ya es la que le queda de la temporada. Es por eso que María Elena está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María Elena podrá sacar adelante su negocio además de que con el dinero que junte podrá ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE CLOTHING AT WHOLESALE PRICES,  GROW HER BUSINESS, AND  CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR HER FAMILY AND IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.

loans.name: Linda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a single mother with young children, whom she wishes to always provide with the best so they never lack anything. It was for that reason that 2 years ago she started selling shoes through a catalog, thanks to a recommendation from a friend. Since then, Elizabeth has made wise use of her free time to earn a higher income and be able to maintain her children.

However, Elizabeth currently does not count with sufficient resources to be able to restock her shoe inventory, which is why she is requesting a loan for $475 that she is willing to repay in a 6-month term. With that money, Elizabeth will be able to purchase more merchandise and expand her clientele. With your help, Elizabeth will help her children progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

S. T. es madre soltera de unos pequeños, a quien ella desea darles siempre lo mejor, y que no les haga falta nada. Fue por eso que hace 2 años comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, gracias a la recomendación de una amiga, y desde entonces Elizabeth a sabido aprovechar sus tiempos libres para así obtener mayores ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos.

Sin embargo Elizabeth actualmente no cuenta con recursos suficientes como para surtir nuevamente su repertorio de calzado, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elizabeth podrá comprar más mercancía para así tener más clientes. Con tu ayuda Elizabeth sacará adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more shoes to restock her inventory and expand her clientele.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco R. has been working in the printing services field for over 31 years. “This business, in which my wife and I work, is my family’s source of income. We need more materials for our printings services, and we have a lot of orders on hold due to the lack of materials. We are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy printing supplies.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Francisco tiene ya más de 31 años en el negocio de las impresiones. "Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabaja mi esposa y yo no esta haciendo falta mas material para las impresiones y tenemos barios pedido detenidos por la falta de material. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de materia prima para las impresiones."

loans.use: Purchase of printing supplies

loans.name: Arcelia

texts.es:
Ever since her husband lost his job, Arcelia started to look for a way to earn money to cover the household expenses. Her friend then suggested that she sell shoes by catalogue, which Arcelia thought was a good idea. This is why she started to sell these products 1 year ago, and little by little she has gained popularity in her residential area.

Fortunately, Arcelia counts on a considerable list of customers, which is of great benefit to her. Moreover, her husband was finally able to get a job. Nevertheless, she currently does not have enough resources to be able to buy the merchandise that her customers are requesting, given that she sells her products in installments. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $250.00 USD that she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this loan, Arcelia will be able to buy the merchandise she needs to be able to fill her customer’s orders; therefore she will not risk losing those customers that she has been able to keep thus far through many efforts. With your support, Arcelia will be able to move her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que el esposo de Arcelia se quedó sin trabajo, ella comenzó a buscar otra manera de poder sacar dinero para tener para pagar los gastos de su casa. En una ocasión una amiga de ella le recomendó vender zapatos por catálogo, lo cual a Arcelia le pareció muy buena idea. Fue así como hace 1 año que comenzó a vender estos productos y poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia.

Afortunadamente Arcelia cuenta actualmente con una lista considerable de clientes. Lo cual le ayuda mucho, además de que su esposo ya consiguió trabajo. Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con recursos suficientes para poder comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando sus clientes, puesto que ella les vende a ellos a plazos. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Arcelia podrá comprar la mercancía necesaria para poder surtir los pedidos que le hicieron y así no perder los clientes que con mucho esfuerzo a podido mantenerlos con ella. Con tu ayuda Arcelia podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Two years ago, María del Carmen began selling shoes through a catalog after a friend recommended it to her. María needed money to be able to cover all of her household’s expenses, being that her husband’s income as a mechanic was not enough. Little by little she built a customer base that goes to her to buy shoes since María lets them pay for her products by installments.

However, María currently does not have sufficient resources to buy more footwear. For that reason, she is requesting a loan for $300, which she is willing to repay in a 4-month term and which will allow her to buy more merchandise to offer her clients. With your help, María will be able to help her children progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 2 años que María del Carmen comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, lo cual lo hizo gracias a la recomendación de una amiga. Puesto que María necesitaba dinero para poder pagar todos los gastos de su casa. Ya que con lo que gana su esposo como mecánico no era suficiente. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes que la buscan para poder comprarle zapatos. Puesto que María les vende los productos a plazos.

Sin embargo María actualmente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para comprar más calzado. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Restock her shoe inventory.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
I have been selling new and used clothing for over 6 years. This business is my family’s sole source of income. I am a single mother of two children. I need new merchandise for my business, but I do not want to lose profits. I am requesting a loan of $600.00 USD to buy new merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya mas de 6 años que me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Este es mi negocio y la fuente de ingresos de mi familia soy madre soltera y tengo dos hijos. En el negocio me esta haciendo falta mercancía nueva pero no quiero descapitalízame. Solicito un préstamo de $600.00 Dlls. para la compra de mercancía nueva.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha Alicia has a family of her own, however, her mother gets sick frequently. For that reason, Alicia is working extra to make enough money to take her mother to a doctor and to cover her household’s expenses. Two years ago, she was offered a business with merchandise, and thanks to her persistence, they gave her the opportunity to pay for it in small installments. Little by little, Alicia, with her charisma and her desire for self-improvement, has been expanding her business and currently has many loyal customers.

However, the demands of the clientele are what should be tended to first in a business, and her clients are currently requesting a bigger variety in her merchandise. For that reason, Alicia is requesting a loan for $300. She is willing to repay it in a 4-month term, and she will be able to purchase more merchandise to earn a higher income. With your help, Alicia and her family, especially her mother, will receive a great benefit and she will be able to give them the best so that they are healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Alicia, ya tiene su propisa familia. Sin embargo su mamá se enferma constantemente. Es por eso que Alicia está trabajando extra para poder sacar dinero para poder llevarla a un doctor a su mamá y para sacar para los gastos en su casa. Hace dos años le traspasaron un local con mercancía, gracias a su insistencia le dieron la posibilidad de comprarla en pequeños pagos. Poco a poco Alicia con su buen carisma y sus ganas de salir adelante, ha ido creciendo su negocio actualmente tiene clientes frecuentes.

Sin embargo las exigencias de la clientela es lo que primeramente se debe de atender en un negocio. Y sus clientes actualmente están solicitándole más surtido en su mercancía. Es por eso que Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $300. Alicia está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para poder obtener mayores ingresos. Con tu ayuda Alicia, su familia, en especial su mamá podrán verse beneficiados para que ella pueda brindarles lo mejor para que estén sanos.

loans.use: Restock her business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mrs. Guadalupe G. has been selling housewares for over 5 years. “This business is my family’s source of income. I work in the business alongside my husband and one of my children. We need more merchandise to sell. We are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD to buy housewares.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar desde hace ya mas de 5 años. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajamos una de mis hijo y yo. Nos esta haciendo falta mas mercancía para vender. Solicitamos un prestamos de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la comprar de artículos para el hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of housewares and bedspreads

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
After Rita saw that her friends, who made a living selling footwear, made some extra money to help their husbands with what they earned, she started looking for a way to do the same as they did. For one year now, Rita has been selling footwear through catalogs respecting her friends’ clients and acquiring new ones. Rita has two children for whom she works since her husband’s income is not enough to cover her children’s expenses.

However, Rita currently does not have sufficient merchandise to offer her clients. That is why she is requesting a loan for $300, which she is willing to pay in a 6-month term. With that money, she will be able to purchase more merchandise to offer her clients. With your help, Rita will be able to make enough to cover her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de que Rita vio que a sus amigas, quienes se dedican a la venta de calzado, sacaban dinero extra para poder ayudar a sus esposos con lo que ganan fue como Rita buscó la manera para hacer este mismo oficio. Hace un año que Rita se dedica a vender zapatos por catálogo respetando los clientes de sus amigas y adquiriendo nuevos. Rita tiene dos hijos por quienes trabaja puesto que con lo que gana su esposo quien es albañil no le alcanza para poder pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

Sin embargo Rita actualmente no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Rita podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rita podrá sacar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Since she was very little, one of María Elena’s aunts, with whom she lived for a long time, owned a dressmaking and novelty business. Little by little, María learned the business and would help her aunt. Unfortunately, her aunt passed away sometime after that, leaving María responsible for the business, and that was how she made ends meet for her family with the help of her husband. Currently, her children are all grown up and married, and she has widowed, which caused her severe depression. However, this business is what has kept her desire to continue striving.

For that reason, María Elena does not want her business to fail. María Elena is requesting a loan for $375 that she is willing to pay in a 5-month term. With that money, María Elena will be able to buy clothing and merchandise to offer her clients a wider variety. With your help, María Elena will succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que era pequeña una tía de María Elena, con la que vivió mucho tiempo tenía un negocio de elaboración de ropa y venta de novedades. Poco a poco María fue aprendiendo este oficio y le ayudaba a su tía. Tiempo después desgraciadamente su tía falleció, quedando María Elena como responsable de este negocio. Y así fue como sacó a su familia adelante con la ayuda de su esposo. Actualmente sus hijos ya están grandes y casados y ella enviudó. Lo cual le trajo una depresión muy grande. Sin embargo este oficio e el que la a mantenido con ganas de seguir luchando por ella.

Es por eso que María Elena no quiere que su negocio se vaya decayendo. María Elena está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María Elena podrá comprar ropa y mercancía para poder tener más variedad para venderle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María Elena podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and merchandise to offer her clients a wider variety.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Eight years ago, Luis Manuel’s mother widowed, and her income was not enough to cover hers and Luis’s expenses. That was why Luis decided to start working to earn money to cover their expenses since he was in school at the time. He started selling clothing to his friends and relatives. Currently, he has his own space in a local market. Little by little and with much effort, his customer base has increased.

However, he currently does not have enough merchandise to offer his clients. That is why Luis Manuel is requesting a loan for $300, which he is willing to pay in a 4-month term. With it, Luis Manuel will be able to buy more clothing for him to sell and will be able to proviD. for his mother so that she no longer has to work.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 8 años que la mamá D. Luis Manuel enviudó, y con lo que ganaba ella no era suficiente ara pagar los gastos D. ella y D. Luis. Fue por eso que Luis decidió comenzar a trabajar para sacar dinero para los gastos D. su mamá y los D. él puesto que estaba estudiando. Comenzó por vender ropa a sus familiares y amigos. Actualmente ya cuenta con un local en un mercado. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo Luis ha ido incrementando su número D. clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que Luis Manuel está solicitando un crédito D. US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo D. 4 meses y así con este dinero Luis Manuel podrá comprar más ropa para vender. Además D. que con el dinero que obtendrá. Podrá darle dinero a su mamá para que ya no trabaje.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to offer his clients a greater variety.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Three years ago, Leonor began selling clothes to her relatives,since her income was not enough to cover her children’s expenses being that she is a single mother. That was how she got a taste of the business and was convinced that it left her sufficient revenue. Currently, she works in this business full-time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in her community.

However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Leonor is requesting a loan for $525, which she is willing to repay in a 4-month term. With this money, Leonor will be able to purchase more clothing and therefore give her business a boost. With your help, Leonor will be able to help her children prosper so that they may one day go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace tres años que Leonor comenzó a vender ropa a sus familiares. Puesto que con lo que ganaba como obrera no era suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Y fue así como probó un poco este negocio y se convenció que si dejaba ganancias suficientes. Actualmente ya se dedica por completo a este negocio y gracias a su entusiasmo a logrado darse a conocer en su comunidad.

Sin embargo sus clientes cada vez le van pidiendo más y más cosas. Es por eso que Leonor está solicitando un crédito de US $525 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Leonor podrá comprar más ropa para así darle más vida a su negocio. Con tu ayuda Leonor podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca's husband is a merchant, which means that his earnings are not stable. Sometimes they sell a lot, some other times they don't. This is one of the reasons why Francisca decided to start selling second-hand clothing. Additionally, she noticed that other people that were selling these type of products were doing very well. Slowly she started to make a name for herself at the market and currently she has customers that look for her to buy her merchandise.

Nevertheless, Francisca currently does not have enough merchandise to offer her clients. This is the reason she is asking for a loan in the amount of $200, which she is willing to pay back in 5 months. With this money Francisca would be able purchase a bundle of second-hand clothing of the season to offer to her customers. With your help Francisca will be able to get ahead and help her family with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Francisca es comerciante, y con un negocio no es constante la entrada de dinero. Puesto que en unas ocasiones venden mucho y en otras no. Fue por eso que Francisca decidió ponerse a vender ropa usada, puesto que se daba cuenta que otras personas que vendían este tipo de productos les iba muy bien. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer en el mercadito. Actualmente ya tiene clientas que la buscan para comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo actualmente Francisca no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Francisca podrá comprar una paca de ropa usada de la temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Francisca podrá sacar adelante a su familia con las ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Jero Melati

texts.id:
Jero Melati is a tenacious housewife who never feels desperate in her life. Besides her kiosk business, Jero Melati is also selling chicken in the market. Jero Melati and her husband, Gusti Ketut Widartayasa, really prioritize their 3 children's education. With her will power and hard work, Jero Melati managed to fund their children's education. 2 of the children already graduated from high school and now they are working in Denpasar. The other one is still studying in junior high school. Jero Melati has run the kiosk business for almost 15 years. Now Jero Melati really needs additional capital for the kiosk. Jero Melati gets a loan of Rp 2,500,000 from Dinari. The loan will be used to add more varieties of merchandise such as variety of soft drink, snacks and also staple merchandises. Every morning after selling local chickens in Melaya market, Jero Melati buys merchandices in the market to be re-sold. Her daily profit is Rp 25,000 to Rp 30,000. Jero Melati hopes that with the additional capital she can gain more profit and expand the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Jero Melati seorang ibu rumah tangga yang ulet yang tidak pernah berputus asa dalam menghadapi hidup. Selain membuka usaha warung Jero Melati juga disibukkan dengan berjualan ayam di pasar. Jero Melati dan suaminya, Gusti Ketut Widartayasa, sangat memperhatikan pendidikan 3 orang anaknya. Dengan semangat dan kerja keras Jero Melati bisa menyekolahkan anaknya . 2 anaknya sudah tamat SMU dan sekarang sudah bekerja di Denpasar. Satu lagi masih duduk di bangku SMP. Jero melati menekuni usaha warung sudah hampir 15 tahun. Dan saat ini Jero Melati benar- benar membutuhkan modal untuk usaha warungnya. Jero Melati mendapatkan pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 2.500.000,- Modal ini digunakan untuk menambah dagangan lebih banyak lagi seperti membeli beraneka macam minuman dan makanan ringan serta kebutuhan sehari –hari. Setiap pagi setelah selesai berjualan ayam kampung di pasar Melaya Jero Melati baru membeli dagangan dipasar untuk dijual kembali. Keuntungan yang diperoleh setiap hari Rp. 25.000,- s/d Rp.30.000,-. Dan Jero Melati berharap dengan bertambahnya modal yang dipergunakan dalam usaha ini keuntungannya pun bisa meningkat dan tetap berharap usaha ini nantinya akan berkembang.

loans.use: To purchase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Putu Merta

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha and her husband, Gusti Putu Ngurah Sutawan has been married for almost 25 years, but they don't have any children until now. To spend her spare time, Gusti Ayu started her business in pig farming. All the capital of Rp 3,000,000 that she got from Dinari is used to purchase 1 female pig that cost Rp 1,000,000 and the rest is used for purchasing the pig food and raising the piglets. Now Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha has 9 piglets. She spends Rp 10,000 daily for the pig food. The pig food mixtures consist of rice and wheat chaff. When the piglets reach the age of 2 months, they can be sold for about Rp 200,000 each as the pigs that she raises are local pigs that are cheaper than the superior type of pigs. Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha really enjoys running this business because it has become her hobby and also she can earn additional income for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha dan suaminya, Gusti Putu Ngurah Sutawan, sudah berkeluarga hampir 25 tahun. Tetapi sampai saat ini belum juga dikaruniai anak. Untuk mengisi waktu yang terluang Gusti Ayu menyibukkan diri dengan usahanya yaitu beternak induk babi. Semua modal yang dipakai didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,-. Modal ini dipakai untuk membeli 1 induk babi yang harganya Rp. 1.000.000,- sisanya untuk pakan dan pemeliharaan anaknya. Saat ini induk Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha memiliki anak 9 ekor. Untuk biaya pakan setiap hari menghabiskan modal Rp.10.000.- Adapun campuran pakannya yaitu dedak padi dan dedak gandum. Setelah berumur kurang lebih 2 bulan, 9 ekor anak babi ini baru bisa dijual dengan perkiraan harga perekor mencapai Rp. 200.000.- karena babi yang dipelihara adalah jenis lokal jadi harganya lebih murah dari babi jenis unggul. Gusti Ayu Putu Mertha sangat senang selain sebagai saluran hobinya, juga bisa menghasilkan pendapatan bagi keluarganya.

loans.use: To purchase female pig and pig food

loans.name: Ni Wayan Simpen

texts.id:
Hinduism in Bali cannot be separated from the religious ceremonies. Even every Sunday, there will be ceremonies. Therefore, Ni Wayan Simpen started her business to make Canang (Hindus' religious accessory). Besides Canang, she also sell Banten (Hindus' religious accessory) for Ngaben (cremation ceremony) or marriage ceremony. Ni Wayan Simpen received a loan of Rp 2,000,000 from Dinari for her business capital. She used the capital to purchase materials such as flower, pandan leaves, janur, and banana leaves. Everyday she gets help from her daughter-in-law, but when she gets orders for a Ngaben or marriage ceremony, she needs about 4 people to help her making the banten. She spends about Rp 25,000 for the materials and about Rp 5,000,000 for materials of a ngaben and marriage ceremony. Ni Wayan Simpen has about 50 families as her main customers who live in her neighborhood or come from the neighbour villages. She hopes that with the capital from Dinari, she can gain more profit in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Di Bali khususnya agama Hindu tidak lepas dari upacara keagamaan. Bahkan setiap minggu ada saja acara keagamaan. Oleh sebab itu Ni Wayan Simpen menekuni usaha membuat Canang ( Sarana persembahyangan untuk umat Hindu ). Disamping itu Ni Wayan Simpen juga menjual Banten ( Sarana persembahyangan untuk umat Hindu ) untuk Ngaben ( Upacara Bakar Mayat ) atau perkawinan. Ni Wayan Simpen mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 2.000.000,- yang dipergunakan untuk modal usaha. Dengan modal ini Ni Wayan Simpen membeli bahan – bahan yang berupa bunga, daun pandan, janur, dan daun pisang. Setiap hari Ni Wayan Simpen dibantu oleh menantunya, tetapi jika ada pesanan untuk upacara Ngaben atau perkawinan, barulah Simpen mencari kurang lebih 4 orang tenaga kerja untuk membantu membuat banten. Untuk pengeluaran bahan baku setiap hari menghabiskan modal Rp. 25.000,- dan kalau ada pesanan banten untuk upacara ngaben dan perkawinan bisa menghabiskan biaya hampir Rp. 5.000.000,-. Dan keuntungannya juga bisa lebih dari keuntungan biasanya. Yang Menjadi pelanggan utama Ni Wayan Simpen cukup banyak sekitar 50 kepala keluarga, baik yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya maupun yang datang dari desa tetangga. Harapan kedepan supaya dengan modal yang didapat dari Dinari bisa menambah keuntungan yang lebih banyak dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as janur, bamboo, banana leaves, etc

loans.name: Thi Hue

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hue is 40 years old. She has been selling stuff in a general store for many years. She has two good children. Her oldest one (male) is in college, and the other one (female) is helping her with her store. Her husband, Mr. Hiep is an electrician, and his wage is rather good. Everyday Mrs. Hue carries goods to sell at the market. Their family income is pretty stable. It would be easier for her to borrow from the microcredit program and have small repayment weekly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Huê năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị bán hàng tạp hoá ở chợ được nhiều năm nay. Hai con chị đều rất chăm ngoan, con trai thì học cao đẳng còn con gái đi chợ bán hàng phụ giúp mẹ. Chồng chị là anh HIệp làm nghề thợ điện nước, thu nhập cũng khá. Hàng ngày chị chở hàng ra chợ bán. Thu nhập của gia đình tương đối ổn định. Vì vậy, với chị, trả góp dần hàng tuần sẽ giúp chị trả vốn dễ hơn.

loans.use: Mua hàng

loans.name: Ni Nengah Ngalis

texts.id:
Nengah Ngalis is running a palm sugar production business now. She started the business since a long time ago because it is the only business she can do to support her family's life apart of her husband's unstable income from his work as a farmer. Her husband helps her to get the palm sugar's ingredient from the palm tree in their garden. In a day, Nengah Ngalis can produce 5 to 8 kgs palm sugar that can be sold at Rp 6,000 per kg so she can earn about Rp 40,000 to Rp 50,000 daily. She sells the palm sugar directly to her regular customers in the market. She has more customers now so that she needs an additional capital of Rp 5,000,000 to expand the business by purchasing palm sugar from her neighbour and then selling it to her regular customers. She hopes that she can gain more income to support her family's daily life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Nengah Ngalis saat ini sedang menekuni usaha membuat gula merah.Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak lama karena hanya inilah yang bisa dilakukan untuk dapat menopang hidup keluarganya, disamping pendapatan suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu. Bahan baku gula merah dicari oleh suaminya di pohon kelapa di kebunnya. Dalam sehari Nengah Ngalis bisa memproduksi 5 sampai 8 kg gula merah yang harga per kilonya saat ini mencapai Rp. 6.000.- jadi dalam sehari pendapatannya sekitar Rp 40.000.- sampai Rp. 50.000.- Gula hasil produksinya langsung diserahkan kepasar yang sudah menjadi langanan tetapnya. Kini pelanggan yang dimilikinya semakin banyak dipasar sehingga Nengah Ngalis membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- untuk memperbesar usahanya dengan cara membeli gula merah hasil buatan tetangganya kemudian menjualnya kembali dipasar yang sudah menjadi langganannya. Dengan harapan bahwa penghasilan yang diperolehnya bisa meningkat untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidup mereka.

loans.use: To purchase palm sugar as merchandise to be sold

loans.name: Ni Ketut Torki

texts.id:
Running a kiosk business is not that easy since it needs dilligence and patience due to the unstable income. Sometimes many customers come and sometimes only a few customers come. This always concerns Ni Ketut Torki who started the business since 3 years ago. Considering all merchandise prices are increasing recently, Ni Ketut Torki needs an additional capital of Rp 5,000,000 to purchase more merchandises with more varieties as she also has a competitor kiosk in her neighbourhood. She hopes that the more complete her merchandise is the more customers will come to shop at her place. The profit of the business is used to support her daily life and to fund her children's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Menjalankan usaha warung bukanlah hal yang mudah karena membutuhkan ketekunan dan kesabaran karena jumlah penghasilan yang didapat setiap hari tidak sama. Terkadang ramai pembeli dan terkadang sepi pembeli. Hal ini selalu mewarnai hari – hari Ni Ketut Torki yang sudah memulai usaha ini sejak 3 tahun yang lalu. Saat ini mengingat semua harga barang melonjak naik maka Ni Ketut Torki membutuhkan tambahan modal didalam usaha yang sedang dijalankannya sebesar Rp 5.000.000 untuk membeli barang dagangan yang lebih banyak lagi dengan jenis barang yang lebih bervariasi karena di sekitar tempat tinggalnya ada juga warung yang lain yang menjadi saingannya. Dengan harapan bahwa semakin lengkap barang yang dijualnya maka semakin banyak pula jumlah pelanggan yang datang untuk berbelanja ketempat Ni Ketut Torki. Karena dari hasil penjualan inilah nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya setiap hari dan juga untuk biaya sekolah anak –anaknya.

loans.use: To add more merchandise variety

loans.name: Sayu Kade Puspa

texts.id:
Sayu Kade Puspa's kiosk provides all kinds of staple merchandise. She has run this business since 5 years ago. Her daily net income is about Rp 50,000 - Rp 100,000. She uses the business profit to support her life and to fund her son's education. Her son, Putu Agus Wiadnyana is studying in high school. She work hard especially for the sake of funding her son's education. She hopes that her son can go to college so that he can improve the family's economic situation in the future. Now Sayu Kade Puspa needs an additional capital of Rp. 5,000,000 which will be used to expand the kiosk business and to add more merchandise variety so that she can gain more customers and more income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Semua barang kebutuhan pokok setiap hari tersedia di warung Sayu Kade Puspa.Usaha ini sudah dijalankan sejak 5 tahun yang lalu. Setiap hari penghasilan bersih yang didapat berkisar Rp. 50.000.- sampai Rp. 100.000.- Dari hasil usaha ini dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga dipergunakan untuk membiaya sekolah anaknya yaitu Putu Agus Wiadnyana yang saat ini masih duduk dibangku SMA. Semua kerja keras yang dilakukan oleh Sayu Kade Puspa semata-mata hanya untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya dan memiliki harapan yang besar agar anaknya bisa bersekolah sampai tingkat yang lebih tinggi lagi supaya nantinya bisa mengangkat perekonomian keluarganya. Dan saat ini Sayu Kade Puspa membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- yang akan dipergunakan untuk memperbesar usaha warungnya dan menambah barang dagangan agar jumlah pelangganya bisa lebih banyak lagi dan juga lebih banyak pendapatan yang didapat.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of merchandise

loans.name: Thi Ngan

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngân is 24, she has 2 school aged children. She operates a restaurant that caters to late night diners. Her restaurant's specialties are steamed escargots and grilled chicken leg. She requests a loan to buy new chairs for her restaurant and do some renovation work. She makes about 4-5 USD a day. She will be abL. to pay back the loan according to the loan term of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngân 44 tuổi, có hai con còn đang đi học. Chị bán hàng ốc luộc và chân gà nướng vào buổi tối, có khi đến tận đêm mới được nghỉ, vì đặc thù của khách hàng đi ăn món này chị vào buổi tối. Chị vay vốn mua bàn ghế để phục vụ, mở rộng quán. Thu nhập hàng ngày của chị mỗi buổi tối cũng được từ 60000-80000đ nên chị có thể hoàn trả nợ theo hình thức trả góp hàng tuần của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc.

loans.use: buy chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Thi Thom

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thơm, 25 years old, is young, industrious and creative. Her main occupation is wood sculptures. She also raises a herd of pigs for extra income. Her husband, Mr. Viên is a brick layer who works away from home. She singly raises two school age children. She joins the Binh Minh so she can apply for a loan to buy wood for her job.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Thơm, 25 tuổi, là một phụ nữ trẻ, rất chăm chỉ và khéo léo. Công việc thường ngày của chị là làm ra những sản phẩm đồ gỗ mỹ nghệ. Ngoài ra, chị còn chăn thêm đàn lợn thịt tại nhà để tăng thêm thu nhập. Anh Viên, chồng chị là một người thợ xây chăm chỉ, nhưng phải đi làm ở xa. Chị một mình chăm sóc và nuôi dạy 2 con còn nhỏ đang đi học. Chị tham gia chương trình để có thêm vốn mua một số công cụ phục vụ cho việc làm đồ mỹ nghệ. Với thu nhập khá ổn định của gia đình, chị sẽ tiết kiệm và trả góp dần.

loans.use: Buy wood for wood sculpturing

loans.name: Thi Nhat

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhât, 40 years old, is a quick and handy woman. She has two children. One is a wood sculptor and the other is still in school. Everyday she goes out to her neighborhood collecting scrap material then sells back to depots. Her husband, Mr. Thất, is a laborer. The family’s income is stabL.. She is applying for a loan of 150USD to use as capital for her scrap material business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nhât, năm nay 40 tuổi, là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, tháo vát. Chị có hai con: 1 còn đang đi học còn một thì đã đi làm đồ gỗ mỹ nghệ. Hàng ngày, chị đi thu mua phế liệu tại các vùng lân cận rồi đem bán cho các hộ thu mua tại thôn. Anh Thất, chồng chị thường đi làm thuê để phụ chị chăm sóc gia đình. Vì vậy, thu nhập gia đình chị khá thường xuyên và ổn định. Chị đã tham gia chương trình Tài chính vi mô binh minh cdc với mức vốn 2006000đ để bổ sung vốn đi chợ hàng ngày.

loans.use: Buy scrap material

loans.name: Thi Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs Nhung is 42 years old. She has 2 sons who work as carpenters for a local company. Her husband is a construction worker so he's often at the construction site, away from home. Mrs Nhung is a rustic peasant, she rarely has the occasion to interact with a bank. Usually she borrows money from her family. When she learned of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) opening a branch in her village, she was enthusiastic. So she applied for a loan to buy chicks to raise in her court yard. She also works as a laborer, she will be able to pay back the loan with the combined income of her husband and sons.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nhung, 42 tuổi, có hai con trai. Các con cô làm thợ mộc cho các chủ xưởng mộc trong làng. Chồng cô làm thợ xây, thường đi theo các công trình xây dựng. Cô là người nông dân chất phác, không tiếp xúc nhiều với dịch vụ ngân hàng. Bởi vậy, khi cần vốn, cô chỉ đi mượn bà con họ hàng. Khi thấy Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc về tới tận thôn cho vay, cô rất thích. Cô vay về để chăn nuôi thêm gà, cô chỉ nuôi gà thả vườn chứ không nuôi gà công nghiệp. Hàng ngày cô đi làm thuê, cộng thêm tiền công của chồng và con, cô trả góp hàng tuần sẽ dễ dàng hơn.

loans.use: raise poultry

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng S., age 36, is employed by a garment factory and makes on average around $2 each day in revenue. Her husband is a construction foreman earning typically about $2 per day. Their two children are employed by a nearby garment factory. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi, specifically when he is available from his construction work. This will increase the family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Cheng would like to purchase a motorbike to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um K., age 46, is the mother of two children and works selling vegetables at a busy market, making typically about $2 each day. Her husband is employed by a hospital making around $3 per day. Her children are enrolled in school. She would like to request this loan of $800 in oder to expand her inventory by adding more vegetables to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: Um would like to expand her inventory of vegetables to sell.

payments.comment:
Congratulation to Um Kan !!!!!!!!

Now She is able to pay off her loan very early. On behalf of Mrs Um Kan, we would like to say greatly thank to all the lenders who always support and help to our poor entrepreneurs. your loan can make different. 

we will provide the Journal update of Um Kan family as soon as we could so that you will understand what different your loan make on her and her family. 

Many Thanks again

loans.name: Van Minh

texts.vi:
Mr. Minh, 25 years old, is a plumber and his wife sells stuff at the market. Their income is about 6USD a day. He’s never taken out a loan before. Tết is coming so he is applying for a loan of 150USD to buy material for his jobs. They like the service at the Binh Minh.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Anh Minh, 25 tuổi, chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Anh là thợ xây lắp đường ống cho cả thôn, vợ anh thì đi chợ để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Thu nhập bình quân của hai vợ chồng là 100000đ/ngày. Với số tiền 2006000đ vay được theo Chương trình Tài chinh vi mô binhminh cdc, anh dùng để mua thêm đồ nghề phục vụ cho công việc của mình. Lại gần Tết nên người dân cũng sửa sang nhà cửa nhiều, anh có thêm nhiều việc để làm. Anh chị rất thích chương trình cho vay vốn này thì thấy thuận lợi trong việc hoàn trả.

loans.use: Plumbing material

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S., age 29, works as a farmer growing rice, making $2 each day. Her husband works raising poultry earning $3.70 each day. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fertilizer, seeds and gasoline to supply her cultivation and also purchase feed to breed her ducks.

loans.use: Pich would like to purchase more fertilizer, seeds and gasoline to supply her cultivation and feed to breed her ducks.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mrs. Moa M. S., age 47, works as a farmer growing rice, making about $2 each day in income. Her husband is a broker and he buys oxen and resells them for a profit, earning about $20 each day in revenue. She has six children. Two are employed at a garment factory, two work in construction, and the rest are married and live separately. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase two more cows to complete her livestock and breed more cows for a profit.

loans.use: Moa would like to purchase two more cows to complete her livestock.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Mrs. Korn M., age 30, works with her husband as a "middle man", purchasing rubber from the grower and reselling it for a profit, making collectively around $7/day of income. They have four children. Two are too young to attend school and two are students. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase more rubber to expand her inventory and to repair their house.

loans.use: Korn would like to purchase more rubber to expand her inventory and to repair her house.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., age, 29, works selling a variety of vegetables, making on average around $2.50 each day. Her husband is a construction worker making on average around $3 each day in revenue. Her children are too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase two more cows to plow their rice paddy, thereby increasing productivity and output.

loans.use: Sin would like to purchase two more cows to plow their rice paddy, thereby increasing productivity and output.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun M., age 38, works selling vegetables earning on average around $2.50 each day. Her husband works as a construction worker earning around $4 per day. Her seven children are unemployed and do occasional work. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase pigs to breed for additional income.

loans.use: Moeun would like to purchase pigs to breed for additional income.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak S., age 49, is a widow and works cooking Khmer food to sell to the people in her area, making on average around $5 each day. She has three children, one who is a student and the rest of whom are mechanics running a car repair shop, making collectively around $8 each day in revenue. She would like to request this loan of $1200 in order to purchase more spare parts and car paint to use for fixing and painting cars for their clients.

loans.use: Hak would like to purchase more spare parts and car paint to use for fixing and painting cars for their clients.

loans.name: Burhonjon

texts.en:
F. Burhonjon is 41 years old. He is married with three children. 

Burhonjon inherited his business and has already been involved in the confectionary business for 32 years.  He specialises in producing confectionary such as lump sugar, and the national sweets known as “nabot” which is made of sugar syrop and cooked in a huge cauldron for several hours and then left for hardening up to 2 weeks. People say it is very healthy. This business is the main source of income for Burhonjon’s family and provides him with a stable business in which to support his family.

Burhinjon has been working with IMON since 2005. For the entire period he has never had any problems managing his loans. This time Burhonjon requests 600.00 US Dollars in order to purchase the input materials for his production such as flour, sugar. Part of the loan will also be used to improve his working conditions. Burhonjon is confident that he will be able to pay the loan back in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials like flour, sugar and improving the conditions of work.

loans.name: Kabojja B2(A) Group

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old and married with one child. Her husband is a brick layer. Jackline currently owns a retail shop . With a KIVA loan, she intends to purchase pigs and begin a new business . Robinah sells crafts and wants to use the loan to buy more craft materials. Hasifah is a poultry farmer and intends to buy poultry feeds with the loan. Florence sells fish and would like to increase her inventory, while Annet sells used clothes and needs to add more selections for her customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, feed, craft materials and clothing for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kabojja B2(B) Group

texts.en:
Sefuloza is a single mother of two children. She has a local market stall and mainly sells raw foods. She wants to use the KIVA loan to re-invest in the food business. Rose N. has a brick laying business and wants to use the loan to produce more bricks for sale. Justine is a herbalist and wants to expand business with the loan. Rose N. sells new clothes and intends to use the loan to add to her inventory.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase business inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Kabojja B2(C) Group

texts.en:
Esther and Fatuma both have market stalls and sell fresh food. Esther wants to use the KIVA loan to buy goats for rearing. Betty sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to add more inventory for her store. Joyce has a brick laying business and would like to purchase additional equipment. Josephine has a clinic and wants to use the loan to buy a microscope.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase inventory, animals and equipment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. He has one child who was born two months ago. His elderly mother and father are living with him. He has a small store where he sells electric home supplies. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new electric supplies. He also wants to improve the store by painting it and make some advertising to increase his income and improve his project. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new electric supplies

loans.name: Kabojja A1(A) Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 30-years-old, married with four children. She currently has a retail shop business but wants to use the KIVA loan to start a livestock farm. Halima and Teddy both have hotel businesses and want to use the loan to buy hotel furniture and food warmers. Stella wants to complete the poultry house with the loan. Cissy has a restaurant business and wants to use the loan to buy more soft drinks and a refrigerator.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, hotel and restaurant furniture and equipment.

loans.name: Kabojja A1(A) Group

texts.en: Aisha is 30 years old and married wih four children. She has a retail shp business and usually earns shs 50.000 in profits each week. Aisha wants to use the extra business profits to start a livestock farm. Halima and Teddy both have hotel businesses and want to use the loan to buy hotel furniture and food warmers. Stella wants to complete the poultry house with the loan. Cissy has a restaurant business and wants to use the loan to buy more soft drinks and a fridge.

loans.use: To increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Kabojja A1(B) Group

texts.en:
Margret is a 30 year old widow with three children, all attend school. Margret is a tailor and mainly sews school uniforms. With the KIVA loan, she intends to buy a Baby Lock sewing machine. Agnes has a brick laying business and wants to use the loan to expand it. Rose offers catering services and wants to buy food warmers. Scovia sells African craft for a living and would like to expand her inventory of raw materials.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for making school uniforms.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Kabojja A1(C) Group

texts.en:
Florence is 45 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. Florence has a livestock business where she rears cows, goats, pigs and sheep. She wants to use the extra business profits to invest in the pig business. Solome, Norah, and Harriet are all poultry farmers and want to use the loan to purchase more poultry feed and also buy more chicks. Sarah sells charcoal and intends to increase stock with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a calf and pig feeed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kabojja A1(D) Group

texts.en:
Juss is 30 years old and a single mother of one boy. She has a bar business and sees an opportunity of opening up a beer depot where she can supply beer to other retail buyers in the viilage. With the extra business profits, Juss intends to buy a piece of land in the village. Rose and Sarah have poultry businesses and want to use the loan to buy more poultry feed and also buy more chicks. Aisha is a herbalist, while Margret has a hotel business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Kabojja A1(E) Group

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old. She sells matooke (a banana dish) for a living. She sees a business opportunity of bringing trucks of matooke from villages and supplying to retail sellers in the city. Mary wants to use the extra business profits to buy land in the village. Juliet sells clothes and wants to use the loan to add stock. Francis has a retail shop and intends to use the loan to add stock to her shop. Hadijah has a hardware shop and wants to use the loan to increase stock. Alice has a hotel business and intends to expand it with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her matooke (a banana dish) business

loans.name: Kabojja A1(F) Group

texts.en:
Norah is 35 years old and married with two children, all of whom go to school. Her husband works in a coffee factory. Norah and Justine both have poultry businesses. Norah usually earns SHS 70.000 in profit each week. With the extra business profit, she intends to construct another poultry house. Teddy sells spare parts and wants to increase her business with the loan. Jane sells clothes and wants to use the loan to increase stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Nabisaru V (A) Group

texts.en:
Milly is 45 years old and married with six children. She has a broiler poultry business. Milly wants to use the extra business profit to buy a plot of land. Alice has a stationery shop and wants to increase stock with the loan. Juliet has a retail shop where she mainly sells household items. Robinah has a commercial bicycle and intends to buy another one with the loan, while Eva sells silver fish.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ermina

texts.en:
Ermina was born in 1982 and she is married. She has one girl, 7 years old. Her wish is to buy more stock because she already has a cow and heifer. In this way she can earn 300 KM, while her husband can earn about 300 KM monthly as a taxi driver.

This is her first loan in the MCO WWI in the amount of 600 KM and she wants to expand business by buying more cows and heifers.

loans.use: To buy more livestock.

loans.name: Nabisaru V (B) Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is 42 years old and divorced with three children. She owns a small clinic and drug shop. Rebecca usually earns SHS 24.000 in profits each week. She wants to use the extra business profit to start up a grocery shop. Irene sells groceries and intends to use the loan to expand the business. Abusaji sells vegetables in the market, while Joselyn has a restaurant business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs and furniture.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Barracks Ii(A) Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 46 year old widow with seven children, all of whom go to school. She wants her children to have a good quality education. Florence has a poultry business and often earns SHS 50.000 in profit each week. She wants to use the extra business profit to start purchasing phones at wholesale. Eva and Mariam have charcoal selling businesses and want to use the loan to increase stock. Rehema sells new clothes, while Gladys sells used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. S., age 24, is a housewife. Her husband is a blacksmith making about $6 each day. They have one child. She would like to request this loan of $1200 in order to purchase more metals to increase the number of products the blacksmith shop can produce.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase more metals to increase a number of products the blacksmith shop can produce.

loans.name: Mukama Mwesigwa A Group

texts.en:
Christine M. - a wonderful 40-year-old widowed woman - has been running a matooke-selling business for 2 years. Matooke is unripened bananas, a typical Ugandan food. She has 5 children and takes care of 1 relative who is taking a course in hair dressing. Of her children, 2 are at the university while 3 are still in high school. She has been our client for 4 years as the chairperson of her group. Just like her previous loans, this loan will help her improve her business and enable her to pay school fees for her children as well as complete her houses for rent. Christine can never fail because she is hardworking. Her family depends on her for food. She is destined to serve.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Improve her business by buying more bunches of matooke.

loans.name: Barracks Ii(B) Group

texts.en:
Proscovia is 50 years old and married with ten children. Some of the children go to school while others are working. Her husband is a teacher. Proscovia has a broiler poultry business, and she can see an opportunity of becoming a poultry supplier to restaurants and hotels. With the extra profits, she intends to construct a water tank in her village and start selling and distrtibuting water in order to solve the water scarcity problem. Betty wants to use the loan to expand her shoe selling business. Jennifer has a retail shop and intends to increase stock with the loan. Hadijah sells charcoal, while Juliet is a layer poultry farmer.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand poultry business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tâm, 30 years old, lives with her husband, Thắng, and two small children in Nghiêm Xá village, Chờ township, Yên Phong county, Bắc Ninh province. She raises poultry and her husband is a laborer. The family’s economy is stable at their income of 9USD a day. This is the first time she takes out a loan. The plan at Binh Minh is very convenient.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tâm, 30 tuổi, ở thôn Nghiêm Xá thị trấn Chờ, huyện Yên Phong, tỉnh Bắc Ninh có 2 con còn nhỏ. Công việc tạo thu nhập chính của chị là chăn nuôi gà. Anh Thắng, chồng chị làm công nhân. Nói chung, cuộc sống của gia đình chị tương đối ổn định với mức thu nhập bình quân của hai vợ chồng là 150000đ/ngày. Anh chị chứ tham gia vay vốn ở đâu cả. Nay, anh chị tham gia vay vốn theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc vì việc vay vốn rất thuận tiện.

loans.use: Invest in poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run P., age 31, works selling various kinds of fruits at Phsar Suong market in Kampong Cham, making on average around $2.40 each day in revenue. Her husband is a blacksmith making around $6 per day in revenue. Her two children are too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to expand her inventory of fruit to meet her clients’ needs. The remainder of the loan is to buy blacksmith’s tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: Run would like to purchase fruit and blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Yea

texts.en: Mrs. Yea S., age 33, works selling gasoline and sugar cane juice on the road side of her community, making about $1 each day of profit. Her husband is a construction foreman earning $5 per day. She has three children who are too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase gasoline and a machine to produce sugar cane juice, which will be faster than squeezing sugar cane juice by hand.

loans.use: Yea would like to purchase gasoline and a machine to produce sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Ilduza

texts.en:
Ilduza was born in 1956 and she is married. She is a housewife, lives in Zenica and has 3 sons who are from 25-30 years old. One son lives with them and he is employed. Ilduza's husband works as a taxi driver and his monthly income is 400 KM.

This is her first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 600 KM and her wish is to invest the money in the current business and improve it. She wants to buy vehicles parts for the taxi in order to improve the quality of service that her husband offers to his clients.

loans.use: To buy vehicle parts.

loans.name: Mirembe I(A) Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 29 years old and married with three children. Two of the children go to school. Her husband sells used clothes. Lydia has a medical drug shop and usually earns SHS 50.000 in profit each week. She wants to use the extra profit to buy a plot of land and build a house. Jane sells new clothes for a living and intends to expand business with the loan. Lukiya and Norah sell used clothes while Betty sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mirembe I(B) Group

texts.en: Joan sells crafts for a living. With the extra business profits, she intends to buy a plot of land and build a house. Joyce and Christine both sell fresh foods and want to expand their businesses with the loan. Hadijah sells maize flour while Esther has a retail shop business.This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand craft selling business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mirembe I(B) Group

texts.en: Joan sells crafts for a living. With the extra business profits, she intends to buy a plot of land and build a house.Joyce and Christine both sell freahs foods and want to expand their businesses with the loan. Hadijah sells maize flour while Esther has a retail shop business.

loans.use: To expand craft selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in scrap material business

loans.name: Sabaheta

texts.en:
Sabaheta was born in 1969 and she is a housewife. She is married and has 2 children who are 18 and 17 years old. Her husband works in a coal mine earning 200 KM, but sometimes he works a full season and then he can earn 2000 KM. When her husband does not work they live from their savings.

Sabaheta works at the marketplace and sells different goods. She wants to expand the range of goods that she is selling in order to earn more money and thus improve living standard for her family.This is her first loan, in the amount of 1200 KM.

loans.use: Expand range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Đenana

texts.en:
Đenana is from Zenica and she was born in 1985. She is married and she has a child, one year old. Her husband works in a coal-mine and his income is 600 KM. They receive additional financial aid from her brother-in-law in the amount of 200 KM.

Đenana will use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM for buying a cow. Her wish is to expand business activity.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tinh, 41 years old, is living in Nghiem Xa village, Cho town, and has 3 children that are still going to school. Besides breeding animals, her other activity is to sell rice in the market. Her income is pretty stable, 6.875 USD/ day. She has never borrowed money from any agencies but now, she joins the Binh Minh Microeconomic Program because she can repay in small amount and it is also suitable with her activity.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tình năm nay 41 tuổi ở thôn Nghiêm Xá, thị trấn Chờ, có 3 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Ngoài chăn nuôi, công việc tạo thu nhập của chị là buôn bán gạo ở chợ. Thu nhập gia đình chị cũng ổn định, 110000đ/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu cả, nhưng giờ, chị tham gia Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì vốn vay ở đây được trả dần, nhỏ lẻ, phù hợp với công việc kinh doanh sản xuất của chị.

loans.use: breeding pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his spare-parts shop and buy a permanent container

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en: Mrs. Vanh S., age 44, works selling shell fish at an open air market, making on average around $5 each day of profit. Her husband is a fisherman earning around $2.50 each day. They have four children, three of whom are unemployed and another one is married and works as a fisherman. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a boat to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: Vanh would like to purchase a boat to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai N., age 37, works selling fish, making about $2 per day of profit. Her husband is a carpenter building houses, making around $8 per day in revenue. Their three children are unemployed. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to expand her inventory by adding in a large quantity of fish to meet her clients’ needs and purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work.

loans.use: Mai would like to buy fish and a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov S., age 26, is the mother of a child and works raising pigs, making on average around $2 each day in revenue. Her husband is self-employed as a welder making on average around $5 per day in revenue. She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation. This will save transportation costs for the family.

loans.use: Nov would like to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mirembe I(C) Group

texts.en: Margret is 40 years old and married with eight children. Her husband is a teacher in a secondary school. Margret sells new shoes for a living.
