She wants to use the extra profits to start a retail shop business. Jesca has a hardware shop and wants to increase stock with the loan. Oliver sells beverages, while Juliet makes and sells snacks.This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her business inventory and stock

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Mrs. Korng S. H., 47, is the mother of nine children and has lived in Kampong Cham province since 1979. She has a lot of experience in growing rice crops and various kinds of vegetables and typically earns on average $1 each day from selling her outputs. Her husband, 49, works as a construction foreman making around $3 per day and he started this job about five years ago. Moreover, to supplement more income, three of her children are employed by a garment factory; one is a construction worker making $3 per day and the others are students.

Mrs. Korng S. H. has requested a loan to enable her to purchase more seeds for her crop expansion and buy frame woods and other construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: Korng would like to purchase more seeds for her crop expansion and buy frame woods and other construction tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.name: Ngham

texts.en: Mrs. Ngham S., age 21, is married and still lives with her parents. She works with her husband cooking Khmer foods and rice and sells them near Pshar Pouk market in Siem Reap, earning on average around $10 each day in revenue. Her one child is too young to attend school. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to invest in her business by purchasing food supplies and using the leftovers to repair her house.

loans.use: Ngham would like to purchase food supplies for her food stall.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tinh, 50 years old, has 3 children that are working now. Her main activity is to sell rice. Besides, she also breeds pigs and chickens to increase her income. She has never borrowed money from any other agencies. She likes Binh Minh Microeconomic program because of its simple and convenient documentory process. She wants to borrow 150 USD to buy pig mash. With a daily income of 5 – 6.25 USD, she will be able to repay the money.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Tính, 50 tuổi, có 3 con đều đã đi làm. Công việc tạo thu nhập chủ yếu của cô là buôn gạo, ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi lợn, gà để tăng thêm nguồn thu. Cô chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nhưng cô lại thích vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminhcdc vì thủ tục đơn giản, thuận tiện và cô đã vay 2006000đ để mua cám cho lợn ăn. Với thu nhập bình quân ngày là 80000-100000đ/ngày, cô có thể dễ dàng trả được nợ.

loans.use: buy pig mash

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 21 year old woman and she is not married. Together with her sister she owns a little car wash. Their monthly incomes are 400 KM.

This is her first loan in the amount of 1200 KM. She intends to buy additional equipment for her car wash and her great wish is to build up her work because this job is their only source of income. She wants to ensure a safe future for her sister and herself.

loans.use: To buy additional car wash equipment.

loans.name: Choin

texts.en: Mrs. Choin S., 43, is married with four children and works on a piece of land growing vegetables and rice, making around $1 each day. Her husband (pictured) works collecting palm juice from the palm trees and produces it into palm sugar. With this business activity, he can typically make around $3 each day. Therefore, one of her children works at a garment factory and the rest are enrolled in school. Mrs. Choin S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more seeds to expand her crops as well as buy more farming tools to facilitate her husband's work.

loans.use: Choin would like to purchase more seeds to expand her crops as well as buy more farming tools to facilitate her husband's work.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon K., age 54, works cooking porridge and Chinese noodles to sell to the people in her area, making on average around $7.50 each day in revenue. Her husband is a farmer growing rice and vegetables, making only a small amount of money each day. They have five children. Two are married and three work with her selling porridge.

She would like to request this loan of $1200 in order to purchase a hand tractor to use for plowing her farmland to facilitate her husband farming’s work.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor to use for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru:
Safarbek C. is a driver by profession and currently works as a security guard at the “Safariyon” market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He has a big family: 5 children, a wife and elderly parents. Previously he drove trolleys and buses, but now that public transport no longer operates and taxis are the main mode of transportation, he has been working as a security guard for 7 years. Safarbek’s job involves guarding the products that are for sale. He gets his salary from the market administration.

Safarbek heard about MicroInvest and decided to ask for a loan to repair his house (this winter his roof leaked and a wall fell over, so he wants to rebuild everything). He has received good recommendations and has good character, which led the credit committee to place his loan on the KIVA site.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Чакалов Сафарбек,по профессии водитель,сейчас работает сторожем на базаре Сафариён,Душанбе,Таджикистан.У него большая семья:5 детей,жена и старые родители.Раньше он водил тролейбусы и автобусы,но сейчас когда обшественные транспорты не работают и преобладают маршрутное такси он работает сторожем уже 7 лет.Его работа заключается в охране товаров.Он получают зарплату у администрации базара.Услышав об Микроинвест он решил обратиться с запросом на потребительский займ на ремонт дома,(так как этой зимой крыша протекла и стена обвалилась,он хочет заново все пересроить ). Получив хорошие рекомендации и добросовестности этого клиента на кредитном комитете он был утвержден на размешении на сайт КИВА.

loans.use: Repairing house.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va M., age 39, works with her husband running a butchery shop in her area making on average around $10 each day. She has four children who are in school and help her sell when they are available from their school.

She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation. This will save on transportation costs and increase her efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more inventory

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C., 43, is married with five children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, whose soil is favorable for growing rubber trees.

Mrs. Sim C. and her husband benefit from the rubber by purchasing large quantities of rubbers and reselling them for a profit. They can collectively make around $7 each day. One of her children is employed by a garment factory located in the city and another one works in a rubber plantation as a laborer earning around $2 each day. The rest are unemployed.

Mrs. Sim C. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Truc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trúc, 40 years old, has two school age children. She sells scrap material. Every she goes around to collect scrap, brings home, categorizes then sells to scrap recycle plants. The work is hard and dirty but she does not mind with the daily income of 6USD. She is applying for a loan of 150USD from Binh Minh. She figures the Binh Minh’s repayment plan is convenient.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trúc, 40 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Công việc của chị là buôn bán phế liệu. Hàng ngày, chị đi thu mua của các hộ gia đình rồi về phân loại, bán lại cho các nhà máy tái chế. Công việc rất vất vả và bẩn thỉu, nhưng thu nhập cũng khá 100000đ/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu cả. Giờ chị vay 2006000đ theo chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị thích hình thức trả góp theo tuần.

loans.use: expand business

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In C., age 47, works making Khmer noodles and selling them wholesale for a profit, earning typically about $7 each day. Her husband works as a security guard and makes around $2.50 per day. They have four children. One is a security guard and the rest help her make noodles.

She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for business transportation. This will save on transportation costs and increase her efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her noodle business transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov K. S., age 41, works cooking porridge to sell to the people in her area. She is also a tailor making on average around $3 each day. Her husband runs a laundry shop earning, typically, around $2 per day. They have six children. One is married, one is a masseuse, and the rest are unemployed.

She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a sewing machine to make her tailoring business more efficient and to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ajida

texts.en:
Ajida is a 41 year old woman, married. She is from Vitez. Her husband is self-employed and they have 4 kids from 6-16 years old. They own a coffee shop and their monthly incomes are 1200 KM. That income is not enough for six family members.

Ajida will use this loan for purchasing additional equipment and supplies for her coffee shop. She is hoping that this will be a good investment and that she will increase monthly family incomes.

loans.use: Purchasing additional equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S., 42, is married with three children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have a lot of experience in producing mortars and pestles and reselling them for a profit, making collectively about $6 each day. They started this business in 1998.

Also, one of her children works with his parents producing mortars earning $3 per day. The other two children are students.

Mrs. Uch S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rock and other tools to make her work easier and more effective.

loans.use: To purchase more rock and other tools to make her work easier and more effective.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C., age 30, works as a cleaner at a market making about $1 each day. Her husband works as a security guard at a market earning about $2 each day. She has two children. One works selling souvenir products to a number of tourists passing by, and another one is at school.

She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to build a proper house for her family. This will raise the standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: To build a proper house for her family.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey R., age 56, is a widow and a mother of four children. She works selling porridge to the people in her area making on average around $2 each day. One of her children works as a construction worker, one is employed at the Angkor Cultural village, and the other two are married and live separately.

She would like to request this loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for family’s transportation. This will lower transportation expenses to work for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for family’s transportation.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Srey Roth start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en: Mrs. Muon Y., age 32, is an artist in a Traditional Cultural village and makes, typically, around $2 each day of income. Her husband is a barber making on average around $5 each day. She has two little children who are too young for school. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase musical instruments to rent to the people in her area.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments to rent to the people in her area.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Dinh Tinh

texts.vi:
Mr. Tính, 30 years old, is a skillful carpenter of his village. He has quite a lot of commissions due to his studious nature and fine workmanship. He builds his shop by borrowing money from relatives. The loans are almost paid off. He would like to apply for a loan of 150USD from Binh Minh to buy equipment.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Anh Tính, 30 tuôi, là một thợ mộc lành nghề nổi tiếng trong thôn. Là người cần cũ lại khéo tay hay làm nên anh được nhiều chủ xưởng thuê. Mong muốn có thể tự mình gây dựng được cơ nghiệp, anh đã đi vay vốn của họ hàng nhưng đã trả gần hết. Giờ, anh thích vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì thủ tục ở đây đơn giản lại thuận tiện. Số tiền 2006000đ anh dùng để mua máy làm nghề mộc.

loans.use: Buy woodworking tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business inventory

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly L., 58, works making beef soup and selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area, making an average of around $ 5 each day of profit. She started this business in 2000, the time her husband started a running a butchery shop in his area making on average about $3.30 of profit per day.

One of her children works at a garment factory, another one is employed at Thailand as a laborer, and the rest are students.

Mrs. Ly L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her growing business and use the leftover money to buy large quantities of cashew nuts from the growers for resale.

loans.use: To purchse more grocery products to expand her growing business and buy large quantities of cashew nuts from the growers.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Loan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Loan, 47 years old, still has a child in school. She sells pork at the market. Her daily income of 5USD is adequate for family expenses and providing education to her child. She has never borrowed money from anyone and she would like to start with Binh Minh which has a convenient repayment plan. She is applying for a loan of 150USD to buy more meat for her pork stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Loan, 47 tuổi, có một con còn đang đi học. Hàng ngày chị bán thịt lợn ở chợ. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị cũng từ 70000-80000đ/ngày, cũng đủ để trang trải cho cuộc sống gia đình và nuôi dạy con cái. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Được biết tới sự tiện ích của việc trả góp hàng tuần của Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc, chị đã vay 2006000đ để mua thêm thịt về bán.

loans.use: Buy more meat for her pork stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ties to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and add stock to his spare parts business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business inventory

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Kurbongul was born in 1962, is divorced and has 4 children. She has been selling clothing at the “Safariyon” market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan for 4 years. She brings her products herself from Bishkek. (Kurbongul is on the right in the photo and Baroat is on the left). Baroat is Kurbongul’s close friend and they often help each other on their trips from Bishkek. Kurbongul is an honest woman and has a strong character.

Kurbongul successfully pays back her loans and has a stable business with good profits. Her products are in demand among local customers. When she heard about KIVA, Kurbongul decided to apply for an additional loan to expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонгул,1962 года рождения,разведена,имеет 4 детей.Торгует одеждой уже 4 года на рынке"Сафариён",Душанбе,Таджикистан.Товары привозит сама из Бишкека вместе со своей подругой Бароат.(Курбонгул с права и Бароат слева)Она является её близкой подругой и часто они помогают друг другу в дороге из Бишкека.Курбонгул честная женьщина и сильная по характеру человек.Она успешно погашает свой займ и имеет стабильный бизнес с хорошей прибылью.Её товары имеют хороший спрос среди местных потребителей. Услышав о КИВЕ она захотела получить дополнительный займ на расширение ассортимента.

loans.use: Purchase of winter jackets and warm cardigans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business and add more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a bigger grocery shop and add more inventory

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(A) Group

texts.en:
Teopista is 44 year-old widow and married with seven children between the ages of 28 and 12. Five of the children go to school while two do casual work. She wants her children to have a good quality education and get employment in the future. Teopista offers tailoring services for a living and usually earns SHS 15.000 in profit each week. With the extra business profit, she intends to buy a plot of land and construct a house. Jamida sells cereals and wants to use the loan to expand her business. Jacent has a beauty salon and intends to buy more hair dryers with the loan. Norah wants to invest the loan in her beverage business while Fausta intends to use the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more cloth materials and fabrics

loans.name: Orosta

texts.ru:
Orosat is 46 years old, she is married and has 6 children. She owns a family bakery that makes Tajik bread. All members of her family work there and help to earn money for family needs. Orosta with her two daughters prepares dough for baking. One of her sons makes a fire in the tanur (oven). You can see Orosat's son Olim and the tanur in the photo. Her sons Olim and Tohir are responsible for baking bread in the tanur and her husband sells the bread in the food market in Dushanbe,Tajikistan.

Today Orosta's bread is in demand among customers and every day she gets a lot of orders from canteens and cafes. We can say that she is one of the successful clients of MicroInvest. Orosat would like to borrow $600 which she will pay back over 6 months via KIVA. She will spend this money to purchase the next batch of flour for her bakery.

Edited by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Orosat is women of 46,married and has 6 children.She has family bakery of national bread.All members of her family work here and help to earn money for family needs.Orosta with her two daughter prepare from flour bread for bake.One of her son makes fire in the tanur(where bread is processing to ready porduct,You can see tanur in the picture and Orosta's son Olim)Her sons Olim and Tohir are responsible for baking bread in tanur.And her husband sells bread in the food market,Dushanbe,Tajikistan. Today Orosta's bread is in good demand among popultion and every day she gets a lot of orders from many canteens and cafes.We can say that she is one of the success client of our organization. In KIVA she wishes to take part with request of 2000TJS for 6 months,which she wants to spend for buying next batch of flour and goal for bakery.

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(B) Group

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and married with six children, who all go to school. Her husband has a retail shop. Jane has a beauty salon business and earns about SHS 30.000 in profit each week. She wants to use the extra business profit to construct a residential house. Sarah has a restaurant business and wants to buy more kitchen utensils with the loan. Teddy sells vegetables and intends to use the loan to expand business. Halima sells and makes snacks. I. has a clothes selling business and wants to increase stock with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment like hair fibres and dryers.

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(C) Group

texts.en:
Harriet is 26 years old and married with three children aged 6, 3 and 1. Two of the children go to school. Her husband has a small bakery. Harriet owns a beauty salon and wants to use the extra business profit to construct a house. She sees a business opportunity of opening up another salon in the city suburbs of Kampala. Rehma has a restaurant business and wants to buy more saucepans with the loan. Manjeri is a millet grainer. Prossy sells new clothes and intends to expand business with the loan. Regina sells charcoal for a living and wants to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(C) Group

texts.en: Harriet is 26 years old and married with three children of ages 6, 3 and 1. Two fo the children go to school. Her husband has a small bakery. Harriet owns a beauty salon and wants to use the extra business profits to construc a house. She sees a business opportunity of opening up another salon in the city suburbs of Kampala. Rehema has a restaurant business and wants to buy more saucepans with the loan. Manjeri is a millet grainer. Porssy sells new clothes and intends to expand business with the loan. Regina sells charcoal for a living and wants to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add more inventory and lease a permanent place

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum K., 41, is a mother of five children and lives in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling seasonal fruits and makes on average around $1.50 each day of net income. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice and collecting palm juice to produce palm sugar. Two of her children are employed by a garment factory and the other three are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Prum K. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more fruits to meet her clients' needs and to use the remainder to buy a motorcycle for her business’ transportation.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more fruits to meet her clients' needs and to buy a motorcycle for her business’ transportation.

loans.name: Norng

texts.en:
Mrs. Norng S. M., 36, is married with two children and runs a stand at a busy market selling a variety of desserts, making on average around $2.50 each day of net income. Her husband, meanwhile, is employed as a policeman earning only $2 per day.

Mrs. Norng S. has requested a loan amount of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation, and to use the remainder of the money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation and to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn S., 39, is a mother six children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling fish and chickens at a busy market making on average $2.30 each day in profit. Her husband is a taxi-conductor making about $2 per day.

One of her children works driving a motor-taxi, another one is a construction worker, and the rest are enrolled in school.

Due to a growing customer demand, Vorn S. would like to request a loan to expand her inventory to meet her client’s needs. Moreover, because of her children are growing every day, she also needs part of the loan to expand her house.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to meet her client’s needs, and also to expand her house for her growing children.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fish business.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun S., 40, is a mother of two little children and works purchasing different types of paints to resell them for a profit, typically earning about $4 each day. Her husband works making chairs and tables, making about $5 each day. Mrs. Khun S. hopes to use this loan to build a painting stand so that she will have a good place to sell her products.

loans.use: To build a painting stand so that she will have a good place to sell her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START A CHARCOAL BUSINESS

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Mrs. Hak C., 35, is married with three children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works on her rice paddy growing rice and vegetables and making only meager money each day. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman, and typically makes on average around $5 per day. Two of her children are students and another one is too young to attend school.

Mrs. Hak C. has recently requested a loan to purchase a grinding mill. Not only will this help generate her rice outputs, but she can also make more profit by renting it out to plenty of the farmers in her area when they need grinding.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill to not only help generate her rice outputs, but also to make more profit by renting it to the farmers in her area when they need grinding.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mrs. Mat S., 60, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a tailoring business at home making on average around $4 each day in revenue. Her husband is employed as a village chef making around $5 per day. Two of her children are employed as security guards and the other two are employed by a garment factory.

Mrs. Mat S. would like to request for a loan amount of $1200 to purchase one more sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her when she is available from her work. This will raise her income generation.

(One of her daugthers is pictured because Mrs. Mat S. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase one more sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her when she is available from her work.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S., 41, works selling clothes in front of a garment factory to plenty of garment workers passing by. She can typically make on average around $5 each day of profit.

Her husband, meanwhile, is employed as a policeman and makes around $8 each day. She lives with her husband, four children and her elderly mother in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One of her children is employed as an accountant, another one is a teacher, and the rest stay at home.

Chea S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: to expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to meet her growing customer demand.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeung S., 40, is married with five school-aged children, and works as a housewife cooking food and looking after her children.

Her husband is the one who supplements the household by working as a tire-repairman, making on average $10 each day.

Mrs. Loeung S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more mechanic tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

loans.use: to purchase more mechanic tools to facilitate her husband’s work.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his beauty and barber salon business.

loans.name: Mirembe Ii(D) Group

texts.en:
Eva is 28 years old and married with two children, aged 8 and 4, who both go to school. Her husband is a driver. Eva has a restaurant business and usually earns about SHS 40,000 in profit each week. With the extra profit, Eva intends to start up a retail shop business. Robinah wants to add stock to her cosmetic shop. Zaina sells silver fish and intends to use the loan to expand business. Oliver sells confectioneries and wants to add stock with the loan. Fatumah wants to stock more charcoal for sale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge

loans.name: Jafrrey

texts.en: Jafrrey sells women’s clothing in her community in order to make a living. She is twenty-one years old, and she has a three-year-old boy. Jafrrey explains that her partner's income is not always enough to pay for all of her family's expenses so she works a lot to improve their living conditions. The entrepreneur also says that she wants to increase her income and to put aside money to pay for her unique son's school tuition. With this loan, Jafrrey would like buy additional clothing in bulk to increase her product line.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk in order to supply a small business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is twenty-eight years old and has three school-going children. She sells a wide selection of shoes, pants, and shirts to the men of her community. Rosa slowly started her business four years ago and had to work very hard just to maintain the business because she did not have much access to capital and was unsure about the future of her business. Fortunately, she received funds from FSMA and she invested the money to purchase many goods that her customers were looking for and subsequently purchased. Now, Rosa would like to expand her business. She is seeking a second loan to add an assortment of perfumes so as to diversify her product line and to attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of perfumes and other goods in order to expand the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Joselin

texts.en: Joselin is an eighteen-year-old, new mother. She sells new and used clothing to the men of her community. Joselin explains that she needs a lot of money to cover all of her household expenses. Each and every day, Joselin visits friends and neighbors to sell her goods. On weekends, she offers her products at the public market, where more people can see the garments and purchase her goods. Joselin hopes to have her own store in the near future so it would be easier for her customers to purchase her products. With this loan, she would buy more products to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to supply the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Ms. Aygun has very little income. She is 22 and lives with her parents in the village of Saatli in the central part of Azerbaijan Republic. Aygun started her business five years ago with one cow, and now she has a herd of five cows. Aygun has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500 to build an open shed for the cattle.

loans.use: To build open shed for herd of cows

loans.name: Ketifallawo B(2060) A Group

texts.en:
Joweria is 35 years old and married with five children. She offers tailoring services for a living, and she wants to use the extra business profit to buy a new sewing machine. Anita is a poultry farmer and intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for the new poultry house. Grace owns a clinic and drug shop and wants to purchase more medical drugs for sale. Sarah sells raw foods in the market and intends to expand business with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in tailoring business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en: Dionicia and her husband own and operate a tailor’s shop which they started more than ten years ago.  They run the shop within their house and they have many customers. Currently, they are using two old sewing machines, but Dionicia says that they will buy new ones when their business expands. Most of their clients are fathers of school-going children and band leaders. Dionicia explains that they have to buy a lot of materials to sew the clothing. With this loan, Dionicia would be able to purchase sewing thread, cloth, oil, and needles for the sewing machines and other goods to operate her shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a tailor's shop.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida is forty-four years old and she is a versatile entrepreneur.  She already has a great deal of experience in business because she has been a couturier and a shopkeeper.  Currently she runs a beauty salon in the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo, where she offers services in hair straightening, hair dying, hair styling, and so forth.  She also sells beauty products and fashionable hair accessories.  Loida wants to expand her business in order to attract new clients and to increase her income.  With this loan, she would like to buy products for her salon and to add new lines of hair products.  This would be the second loan that the entrepreneur would receive from FSMA. She wisely used the first loan she received from our organization and timely repaid that first loan.

loans.use: This second loan will be used to purchase a wide range of products to supply a beauty salon.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is thirty-eight years old and a mom of seven children. Rosa sells pants and shoes to men of the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo. Rosa started her business a few months ago with a loan she received from our organization.  Rosa cautiously used her loan and now her business is moving forward. Rosa doesn’t have the means to rent space to operate her business so she runs the business out of her house. Rosa hopes that her business’s success will help her continue to support her large family. She will invest her second loan to buy more clothing in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four more bicycles and start a food kiosk for his wife

loans.name: Alizaman

texts.en:
Mr. Alizaman has little income. He is 53, married with 4 children, and lives in the town of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. For 4 years, Alizaman has owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar in Saatli. The business is stable because Alizaman has many repeat customers.

But he doesn't have enough profit to purchase and sell a greater variety of goods, and thus increase his income so he can provide all the necessities of life for his children. Some commercial banks demand collateral for loans, but Alizaman has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500. This loan would let him to buy and sell more goods and so develop his .business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells to increase his business

loans.name: Ketifallawo B(2060) B Group

texts.en:
Zam is 37 years old and married with seven children. Zam and Aidah have charcoal selling businesses. Zam wants to use the extra business profits to pay school fees for the children and buy a plot of land. Edith sells raw foods in the market and wants to expand the business with the loan. Gladys wants to use the loan to increase stock in her grocery store. Justin wants to expand her brick making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the charcoal business and become a wholesaler

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Ms. Rena is 47-year-old local resident of Saatli town. For more than 10 years, she has been breeding cattle in her yard. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products.

Rena wants to develop this business by increasing the number of cows. She has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Ms. Sevil has very little income. She is 56, married with five children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Sevil owns a small herd of milk cows, and she sells the milk in the Saatli bazaar.

Sevil's family expenses are increasing as her children grow up. Sevil plans to increase the number of cows she has, so she can increase her income. To do this, Sevil has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $500. She hopes this loan will let her change her family's life for the better.

loans.use: To buy more milk cows to increase income

loans.name: Ketifallawo B(2060) C Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 36 years old and divorced with five children, age 14, 11, 9, 7, and 4. Fatumah, Zaituni, Prossy and Margret all have retail shop businesses and mainly sell home product items. Fatumah wants to use the extra business profit to construct rental houses. Aisha has a grocery store and wants to use the loan to add stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop business

loans.name: Nazenan

texts.en:
Ms. Nazenan is a 54-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. She and her husband have been breeding cattle in their yard since 1988. They now are quite experienced in this business. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries.

Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where it is the only source of income. You can earn a good income in this business. Nazenan wants to develop her business and increase the number of calves. She wants to buy two more calves, so she has applied for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more calves to increase income

loans.name: Kawala A 2021(I) Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old and married with three children, age 18, 17 and 14. She sells fruit and vegetables. With the extra business profits, she intends to re-invest in the business and also pay school fees for the children. Grace makes and sells sponges and wants to use the loan to add stock. Yudaya has a retail shop, while Zawujja sells fruits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the vegetable business

loans.name: Kawala A 2021(Ii) Group

texts.en: Shamim is 27 years old and a single mother of four children of ages 10, 6, 3 and 2.5. She has a beauty parlour. She intends to buy a plot of land and build a house for her children with the extra business profits. Annet makes and sells sponges and wants to expand business with the loan. Sarah offers catering services and wants to buy food warmers with the loan. Takiya sells second-hand clothes while Gladys sells new clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Kawala A 2021(Iii) Group

texts.en: Nalongo is 42 years old and married with four children. Nalongo, Sylvia, and Mary all make and sell sponges for a living. Nalongo  intends to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land and build a house. Lukia and Lena both have retail shop businesses and want to increase their stock with the loan.

loans.use: To expand the sponge-making business.

loans.name: Tebuyoleka A(2028)A Group

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old and divorced with three children of ages 22, 18, and 15. She sells new clothes for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to expand her business and buy a plot of land for her children. Victo wants to purchase more used clothes for sale. Ruth has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to increase stock. Betty sells herbal medicine while Joyce offers laundry services.

loans.use: To rent a shop for displaying clothes on sale.

loans.name: Tebuyoleka A(2028)B Group

texts.en: Jennifer is 47 years old and married with six children. She offers tailoring services for a living. With the extra profits, Jennifer intends to buy another sewing machine. Florence runs a beauty salon and wants to buy a hair steamer with the loan. Fatuma wants to use the loan to buy more used clothes for sale. Edith has a retail shop business and intends to add to her stock with the loan while Hanifa offers dry cleaning services.

loans.use: To expand the tailoring business by buying more cloth.

loans.name: Bukasa B (2026)A Group

texts.en: Agnes is 46 years old and married with two children. She sells fruit and vegetables for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to renovate her residential house. Margret sells soft drinks and intends to use the loan to buy a refrigerator. J. wants to increase stock in her grocery store. Edith plaits hair while Saidat has a beauty parlour and wants to buy more cosmetics with the loan.

loans.use: To expand the vegetable business

loans.name: Bukasa B (2026)B Group

texts.en: Lukia is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells cold soft drinks for a living. She intends to construct a personal business with the extra profits. She believes this will reduce costs since she will not have to pay rent anymore. Prossy and Teopista want to use the loan to increase the stock in her grocery stores. Fatuma offers catering services and intends to buy more kitchen utensils and food warmers. Sophia sells fruits and vegetables in the market and wants to expand the business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Telnaz

texts.en:
Telnaz is a very active woman and has good entrepreneurial skills. She is 47 years old and has been running her cattle breeding business for 18 years now. She is married and has 4 children. The whole family helps her with the business. Her eldest son is in the picture. Telnaz lives in the Soltanabad village in the Saatli region in Azerbaijan.

Recently, Telnaz realised that she can make more money if she acquires more livestock. So she decided to buy new calves, and has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $700 USD.

loans.use: to buy more calves to earn more money

loans.name: Mahira

texts.en:
Mahira lives in the Saatli region in the village of Mammadabad. She is 38 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter. Mahira started her cattle breeding business in 1995, and has been successfully managing it with her husband (pictured here). They breed the cows and then sell them to the local butcher.

Mahira wants to buy more cows so she can expand her business. She has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $1000 USD.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Ruhangiz

texts.en:
Ruhangiz lives in the Saatli region in the village of Soltanabad in Azerbaijan. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Ruhangiz established her cattle breeding business in 1992. Since then, she has been successfully managing it with help from her husband and children (her daughter is pictured here). They breed cows and then sell them in the local cattle market.

Ruhangiz wants to buy more cows because she plans to expand her business. Ruhangiz applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $600 USD.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Shargiya

texts.en:
Shargiya lives in the Saatli region in the village of Soltanabad, in Azerbaijan. She is 52 years old. Shargiya is married and has a 5 children. Shargiya established her cattle breeding business in 1995. Since then, she has been successfully managing it with her husband and her son (pictured here). They breed cows and then sell them to the local cattle market.

Shargiya wants to buy more cows to expand her business. She has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of $600 USD.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for breeding

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is fifty years old and the mother of five young women, all of whom have married and left their childhood home.  Maria’s husband is no longer physically able to work for a living, so her business is the couple’s primary source of income.

Maria sells women’s personal care products from her home in Yamasa, Dominican Republic.  She also visits friends and neighbors with her assortment of shampoos, conditioners, hair-styling products, and nail polishes.  With her loan, Maria plans to purchase a wider selection of hair care and beauty products that she says her customers have requested.  With a smile, Maria explains that she is hesitant to share her hopes for the future because “they might not come true,” but she hopes her business will grow to include more in-demand beauty products and to support her family’s well being.

loans.use: To purchase new hair care and beauty products.

loans.name: Fazilya

texts.en:
Fazilya Hasimova, a 41-year-old mother of six, has bred cows for more than two decades. She raises calves and sells them to the local butcher.

With a loan of $700, Fazilya will buy more cows to expand her business. Because meat is a staple of the Azerbaijan diet, she's certain that she'll be able to breed more cattle and repay her loan.

loans.use: To acquire new calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is twenty-six years old and a single mom raising her five-year-old son alone.  Alexandra owns and operates a salon in her parents’ home.  Every afternoon, the family’s living room is overtaken by the neighborhood women and their chatter, laughter, and hair rollers.  

With her loan Alexandra plans to buy a new hairdryer, more rollers, and new hair care and styling products.  In the future, Alexandra hopes not only to move into her own salon space, but also to hire a full-time staff.

loans.use: To purchase a new hairdryer, and new hair care and styling products.

loans.name: Marie-Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. D. S. was born on April 7, 1964 in Cotonou in the county of Littoral in the south of Benin, she is married and the mother of 4 children.  She sells ready to eat meals in Akpakpa Dodomè a shantytown of Cotonou.  She lives with her husband who is a taxi moto driver. She is  financially responsible for 4 children who are in school. She has good ethical values, a passion for her business and is anxious for her children's education. She is requesting a loan to develop her business and to meet the ever increasing demand of her customers who appreciate the quality of her meals.
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 07 Avril 1964 à Cotonou dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, Madame D. S. est mariée et mère D. 04 enfants. Elle vend des repas prêts à manger à Akpakpa Dodomè un bidonville D. Cotonou. Elle vit avec son mari qui est conducteur D. taxi moto. Elle a à sa charge ses 04 enfants qui sont scolarisés. D. très bonne moralité, elle a D. la passion pour son activité et le souci D. l'éducation D. ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour développer son activité et satisfaire la demanD. sans cesse croissante D. sa clientèle qui apprécie la qualité D. son repas.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn of 50kg each, 3 bags of beans of 50kg each, 12 baskets of tomatoes, other spices.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
MarieL. is twenty-eight years old and a budding entrepreneur.  She sells silver jewelry to the women in her neighborhood, and happily says her products are sold just as quickly as she can stock them.  MarieL. operates her business predominantly from her childhood home, but also visits regular customers at their homes.  

MarieL. plans on buying new and exclusive items – more expensive necklaces, bracelets, and earrings – that she believes will sell at a greater profit than her current inventory.  MarieL. explains that with her business’s continued growth, she hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy her own home.

loans.use: To purchase new necklaces, bracelets, earrings, and other jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
For the past six years, Reyna E. has dedicated herself to the sale of vegetables at the central market of the city of Chinandega. She has her own stand at the market which, over time, she has tried to remodel when her small income has allowed. She is a single mother caring for one child. Her wish to provide for him is her motivation to continue to struggle each day.

Reyna E. has worked with Ceprodel for two years, and the loans they have granted her have helped her immensely in her efforts to grow her business. Her sales have increased and, likewise, her expenses related to the business. For this reason, she again turns to Ceprodel for loan assistance so she can purchase more vegetables from her providers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años la señora Reyna E. se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se desempeña en un tramo propio que a través del tiempo ha venido remodelando de acuerdo a sus bajos ingresos que percibe. Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, según cuenta él es el motivo por el cual ella se esfuerza día a día para llevarle el sustento.

Reyna E. ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel desde hace dos años y le han sido de mucho beneficio para su negocio ya que han incrementado sus ventas y por ende sus utilidades se han visto incrementadas. Por tal motivo acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con estos créditos y así adquirir las verduras de sus proveedores.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
Leoncia P. is a hardworking woman who sells a variety of products (general store) at the central market in the Chinandega department of Nicaragua. She decided to invest her small savings to start her business 25 years ago, as a result of being without employment and finding herself in a difficult financial situation.

Mrs. P. keeps a busy schedule, particularly given that she also has four school-aged children to take care of. She is responsible for supplying all the necessities for their home, as she plays the role of both mother and father to them.

For the reasons above, Mrs. P. was granted loans from Ceprodel which have helped her greatly in the purchase of merchandise with which to stock her store. Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Leoncia P. es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de productos varios (pulpería) en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Desde hace 25 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Para la señora P., su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que es madre de 4 hijos en la edad escolar y por quien velar, también es responsable de suplir las necesidades de su hogar de habitación ya que ella misma hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Por las razones descritas anteriormente es que la señora P. realiza créditos en Ceprodel que le han beneficiado para la compra de los productos a sus proveedores siendo esta la mayor necesidad que atraviesa dicha dama.

loans.use: Purchase products/merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Jewelry repair, sales, and cleaning of silver pieces is the business to which Silvio M. has dedicated himself over the past five years. More specifically, he carries out his activities at the central market in the city of Chinandega. From a young age, he has had a knack for fixing jewelry. Finding himself in a difficult financial situation, he has decided to invest in the purchase of tools such as pliers and a magnifying loop for his repairs.

To conduct this activity, any jeweler has to make use of gold and tools in order to complete fillings, additions, and polishing of the pieces. For this reason, Silvio M. requests a loan from Ceprodel because he needs to purchase these items in order to continue with his daily work. He has worked previously with Ceprodel and the loans granted him with positive results.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La reparacion de las joyas, venta de oro y limpieza de piezas de plata es el negocio que se dedica don Silvio M. desde hace 5 años en la ciudad de Chinandega para ser específicos en el mercado central de este departamento. Desde muy joven, ha tenido la habilidad para manipular y reparar joyas, hoy en día, debido a la difícil realidad económica que ha estado envuelto por mucho tiempo. Decide invertir en la compra de herramientas como pinzas y lupa para la reparación de estos artículos.

Para realizar esta actividad, todo joyero debe de hacer uso de oro y herramientas para realizar rellenos, adiciones, pruebas y pulidos a las prendas. Por esta razón es que Silvio M. solicita crédito en Ceprodel ya que necesita adquirir estos artículos para continuar con su labor diaria de trabajo. Actualmente ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo buenos resultados con la adquisición de estos créditos.

loans.use: Purchase gold and tools for jewelry/jewelry repairs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca’s husband is a merchant, however the business does not provide steady income as sales can be high or low at any given time. Noticing that local vendors seemed to do well at it, Francisca began to sell used clothing. Little by little, she began to be noticed at the market. Currently, she has clients that seek her out to buy her merchandise.

Regardless, Francisca does not currently have enough merchandise to offer her customers. For this reason, she asks for a loan of $375USD to be repaid over a period of five months. With these funds, Francisca would be able to buy more seasonal used clothing for her customers. With your support, Francisca will be able to help her family get ahead financially.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Francisca es comerciante, y con un negocio no es constante la entrada de dinero. Puesto que en unas ocasiones venden mucho y en otras no. Fue por eso que Francisca decidió ponerse a vender ropa usada, puesto que se daba cuenta que otras personas que vendían este tipo de productos les iba muy bien. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer en el mercadito. Actualmente ya tiene clientas que la buscan para comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo actualmente Francisca no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Francisca podrá comprar una paca de ropa usada de la temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Francisca podrá sacar adelante a su familia con las ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
It’s been four years since Francisca began making traditional candies, which are very successful in her locale as there are many tourists who like her product. Since she started, her production has grown which is very gratifying to Francisca given that she can use her earnings toward her children’s education.

Francisca believes now is a key time to attempt to increase her production. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a period of six months. With these funds, she will be able to buy nuts and other ingredients necessary for her to make her confections. With your help, Francisca will be able to grow her business so that her children can complete a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 4 años que Francisca se dedica a elaborar dulces tradicionales los cuales tienen éxito en su localidad, puesto que muchos turistas que pasan por su localidad les gusta mucho este producto. Desde que comenzó su producción ha ido incrementando y esto es muy grato para Francisca puesto que con el dinero que saca puede pagar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos.

Francisca considera que este momento es el más pertinente para incrementar su producción, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Francisca podrá comprar nueces, piloncillo y todo lo necesario para elaborar estos dulces. Con tu ayuda Francisca podrá crecer para que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making traditional candies/sweets.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Wardrobes, beds, cribs, ledges, chairs, hangers, hats and traditional articles of Nicaragua are the articles made of wood that Reyna P. has sold over the past 15 years at the central market of Chinandega. The business functions as follows: the suppliers request the orders, based on those orders they manufacture the product, and after they are made they are delivered to the market where Mrs. L. has her site in the section of wood items.

Being a single mother, and having the need to support her school-aged son, she has made it her homework to dedicate herself to this task and to seek financing to purchase her merchandise. It is here where the friendly hand of Ceprodel comes in, granting her loans that she uses to buy the products that she markets.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Roperos, camas, cunas, repisas, sillas, perchas, sombreros y artículos típicos de Nicaragua son los artículos de madera que desde hace 15 años comercializa la señora Reyna P. en el mercado Central de Chinandega. La política de su negocio funciona de la manera siguiente: Los proveedores solicitan los pedidos, de acuerdo a esos pedidos elaboran los artículos, luego que estos artículos son elaborados son enviados al mercado central donde tiene su localidad la señora L. en el sector de la venta de la madera.

Por ser madre soltera y por la necesidad de mantener a su hijo en edad escolar, se ha visto a la tarea de dedicarse a esta labor y buscar financiamiento para la adquisición de estos productos de madera. Es allí donde aparece la mano amiga de Ceprodel que le financia con créditos que los utiliza para la adquisición de los productos para su debida comercialización.

loans.use: Purchase of products made of wood.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Bình, 51 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. She, a retired cadre, possesses an economic mind and is very persistent. Her every day task is taking care of a pig farm of more than 100 pigs. Her husband is a brick layer and two children are still in school so she singly handles the farm. Hard work but rewarded no doubt, she reminds to herself. If the price is right as now, 50 pigs will get her 1000USD easily. That would cover all family expenses of this Tết celebration. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to replenish her pig stock.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Bình, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Là một cán bộ về hưu nhưng chị Bình là một người làm kinh tế giỏi, quyết đoán. Công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi đàn lợn hơn 100 con. Chồng đi làm thợ nề, 2 con còn đi học, một mình chị xoay xở với dự án chăn nuôi. Nhiều lúc cảm thấy thật vất vả nhưng chị Bình nghĩ có cần cù, chịu khó đầu tư mới có thể thu được thành quả lớn. Những công sức chị Bình bỏ ra đã không uổng phí. Vào thời điểm hiện nay giá cả tăng lên chị xuất chuồng 50 con lợn mang lại lợi nhuận hơn 1000USD. Khoản thu trên đáp ứng nhu cầu sắm sửa của gia đình trong dịp Tết này. Chị Bình quyết định vay thêm 950USD mua thêm lợn giống về bổ sung cho lứa lợn vừa bán.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe knew that she had a knack for making friends and for talking with people. For this reason, she determined that sales would be the best way to augment her husband’s income as a driver. She started to obtain beauty product catalogs, to slowly grow a customer base, and to start including in her catalog product line other items such as shoes and some clothing. Currently, she has an established book of clients.

Regardless, she needs to increase the products she currently carries for her customers. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $325USD to be repaid over a period of five months, to use to enhance her product line. With your support, María will be able to save money to pay for her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe, sabía que tiene la capacidad para hacer amistades, así como de hablar con personas. Fue por eso que se dio cuenta que las ventas sería la mejor opción para obtener ingresos extras a los de su esposo puesto que el es chofer. Fue así como comenzó a conseguir catálogos de cosméticos, poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes y comenzó a incluir en su repertorio catálogos de zapatos, y un poco de ropa. Actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes.

Sin embargo los productos con los que cuenta actualmente, no son suficientes para poder llegar con un cliente para ofrecérselos. Es por eso que María Guadalupe está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá juntar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana T. has dedicated herself to the sale of clothing at the city of Chinandega’s central market for the past 37 years. She has led a difficult life, particularly when she became a widow and was unable to find work to replace her husband’s income and support herself. As a result, she decided to invest the small amount of savings that her and her husband were able to collect over many years.

She started her business with a small investment in merchandise. However, due to high competition, she has been acquiring greater amounts of clothing which has helped increase her earnings, albeit very slowly.

Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional product to sell. She has worked with CEPRODEL for loans over the past year and, despite the competition, she is starting to see better results from her endeavors. She proposes to continue with the loans which have so benefited her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 37 años la señora Juana T. se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado central de la bella ciudad de Chinandega. La vida que la señora T. ha llevado es bastante difícil debido a que primeramente recibía ingresos de su esposo pero al fallecer este y quedando viuda ella busca empleo pero no lo encuentra hasta que decide utilizar los pocos ahorros que junto con su esposo logró recaudar por largo tiempo.

Comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa con una pequeña inversión en mercadería sin embargo por la gran competencia de este negocio ha ido adquiriendo mayores cantidades de ropa lo que le ha provocado una mejora en sus ingresos pero lentamente.

Los planes de la señora Juana son invertir mas en su negocio para adquirir mercadería para comercializarla. No debemos obviar que con CEPRODEL ha realizado préstamos desde hace un año y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos que le han traído mucho beneficio a su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to supply inventory.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Lịch, 57 years old, is a fifth year member of the TYM Fund, branch 14. All her five children are grown up and left home. Now is just her and her husband. Her activities are farming pigs and brewing rice liquor. The combination is a norm for members of this branch. Money from selling liquor is used to pay weekly repayments, byproduct from the brewer is to feed pigs. All are neat and nice. The monthly income is hefty at 200USD. Demands increase as Tết is coming. She would like to apply for a loan of 775USD to buy more rice and few more piglets.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Lịch, 57 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 14 Quảng Xương. 5 người con của chị đều đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, trong nhà chỉ có hai vợ chồng. Công việc chính của chị Lịch là nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Đây là một hình thức mà rất nhiều thành viên vay vốn Quỹ Tình thương áp dụng. Bán rượu để có tiền trả tuần và thu nhập hàng ngày, bã rượu làm thức ăn cho lợn. Hoạt động làm ăn rất có hiệu quả, thu nhập của chị Lịch ở mức 200USD/tháng. Sắp đến Tết âm lịch, nhu cầu của các quán rượu trong vùng tăng cao, chị Lịch bàn với gia đình vay mức vốn 775USD vừa để mua gạo nấu rượu vừa để mua thêm lợn đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs and rice to brew rice wine

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Ngân, 49 years old, joins the TYM Fund on 2002. She lives by herself. Her house is also her general store. The store has a good location, near by the market. The prices are usually very reasonable and customers are plenty. She is very disciplinary. In all 5 years with the Fund she has never had a single late payment. Her monthly income is 200USD. Tết is around the corner and she needs more goods to sells. She would like to apply for a loan of 650USD to get more beer, drink, cakes, candy for Tết.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Ngân, 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2002. Chị sống một mình, công việc chủ yếu là bán hàng tạp hóa. Có địa điểm đẹp, gần chợ vì vậy việc buôn bán của chị rất thuận lợi. Giá cả các mặt hàng hợp lý nên rất nhiều khách hàng đến với chị. Trong 5 năm tham gia Quỹ chị luôn tuân thủ đúng kỷ luật của Quỹ, chưa bao giờ chậm trả. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Ngân là 200USD. Vào thời điểm Tết, cần có nhiều hàng phục vụ Tết nên chị quyết định vay mức vốn 650USD để lấy thêm hàng bia rượu, bánh kẹo.

loans.use: Buy beer, wine, cakes, candy for her grocery store

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
For the past four years, Mrs. Evangelina A. has run an office/school supply store at the central market of Chinandega. The bookstore started with a small display case where she placed her products. Over time, she acquired another, larger, display case of much higher quality.

It’s important to emphasize that Mrs. A. is a single mother with one child to support. For this reason, she has decided to ask for loans through Ceprodel which have greatly helped her to buy the office and school supplies for her enterprise. Her goal is to continue with these valuable loans, and to become the best merchant in her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Evangelina A. desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos de librería en el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega. La librería la inicia con una pequeña vitrina vidrio donde colocaba los productos pero por medio el tiempo transcurrió, adquirió otra vitrina con mucho mas espacio y además de mejor calidad.

Es necesario destacar que la señora A. es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener. Por este motivo es que ella decide realizar préstamos en Ceprodel el cual le han beneficiado para la compra de productos de oficina y escolares para su debida comercialización. Su meta es continuar con estos valiosos créditos y convertirse en la mejor comerciante de su local.

loans.use: Purchase school and office supplies.

loans.name: Safija

texts.en: Safija is a 60-year-old woman from Živinice. She has a husband who is retired. His monthly pension is about US$ 300. They are doing agricultural work and Safija sews. In that way she can earn about US$ 375 monthly. This is her second  loan through MCO WWI, this time in the amount of  US$ 925. She intends to buy a sewing machine. She thinks that she will be able to improve her services and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị V., 46 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She lives with her husband and 3 children in Quảng Xương, Việt Nam. She has a grocery store. Income from the store is used for loan payments. Her husband operates a motorbike taxi also helps her in his spare time. They work hard but have good income and their lives are stable. The monthly income of about 320USD is sufficient for their three children’s education expenses. The store is always busier in the Tết season. This year, she would like to take out a loan of 950USD to replenish her store.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị V., 46 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Chị sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Việt Nam. Công việc chính của chị là bán hàng tạp hóa. Nguồn hoàn trả hàng tháng được lấy chính từ hoạt động này. Ngoài ra anh Phương chồng chị chạy xe ôm cũng hỗ trợ tích cực cho vợ. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng ổn định. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả 2 anh chị là 320USD/tháng. Mức thu nhập đủ để trang trải chi phí sinh hoạt và cho 3 con ăn học. Hàng năm vào dịp Tết, cửa hàng của chị V. thường thu được lợi nhuận khá cao từ việc bán hàng. Năm nay chị V. quyết định vay mức 950USD đầu tư vào hàng Tết

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
For the past 20 years, Claudia Z. H. has dedicated herself to the sale of wood products such as beds, wardrobes, and chairs. She also sells ledges, hats, and traditional Nicaraguan items at the central market of Chinandega. She started her business at this market, where she is located to this day. All beginnings are challenging, and she felt that she was not generating enough income and had few clients. For this reason, she decided to turn to Ceprodel which has granted her loans that have helped immensely in the purchase of her products from suppliers.

It’s important to emphasize that since Mrs. Z. has been granted loans in Ceprodel, they have been repaid on time and as agreed upon. For this reason, she is today seeking to grow her business of selling products made from wood.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Claudia Z. H., se dedica desde hace 20 años a la comercialización de muebles de madera como camas, roperos y sillas. También vende perchas, sombreros y artículos típicos Nicaragüenses en el mercado central de Chinandega. Comienza su negocio en este mercado donde se ha mantenido hasta hoy en día. Como todo inicio es duro, empezó vendiendo los productos, sin embargo percibía que no le generaba suficientes ingresos porque sus clientes eran pocos. Por esta razón es que se decide acudir a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado créditos que le han beneficiado grandemente en al compra de los productos a los proveedores.

Es importante destacar que desde que la señora Z. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel, los ha pagado en tiempo y forma y por tal motivo es que hoy en día se va contemplando el crecimiento de su negocio de venta de productos de madera.

loans.use: Purchase wood products.

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Nancy, Teresa, and Josefina have been part of the community bank Imperio for four, two, and two years, respectively. In that time they have learned how to be punctual and responsible, educate their children, and avoid getting sick.

Nancy is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and two children. Nancy has a seafood restaurant located in the main square of the city of Ayacucho.

Teresa is 38 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two children. Teresa buys grains from a variety of markets in the region. She then grinds them into flour and sells them at the markets in Ayacucho.

Meanwhile, Josefina is 24 and lives with her partner and one son. She has had a small grocery store located in her home for two years.

Nancy, Teresa, and Josefina need loans of 1600, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = about $1), which they will invest in buying corn, wheat, barley, quinoa, kiwicha, rice, sugar, oil, milk, and tables for the restaurant. Nancy will use part of her loan to build her house.

They plan to use their savings to educate their children and pay for any emergency or unexpected costs. Nancy, Teresa, and Josefina have many dreams, such as having bigger businesses, owning a store, building a home, and getting married.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses by buying corn, wheat, barley quinoa, kiwicha, rice, sugar, oil, milk, and tables for the restaurant

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Straw mattress weaving is popular among families in Quảng Xương. It’s Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L. main occupation. She is a fifth year member of the TYM Fund. Her children are still too young so she has to singly handle all household chores. Every week she sells few mattresses to make the payment. It is convenient. The monthly income from mattress selling is from 125 – 150USD. Her husband’s brick laying gets home about 80USD a month. The price of straw is low now that she discusses with her husband to take out a L. of 950USD to build her straw inventory. Also a small part of the L. will be used for raising few life stock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Làm chiếu là một công việc khá phổ biến với nhiều gia đình ở huyện Quảng Xương. Đây cũng là công việc chính của chị Nguyễn Thị L., 29 tuổi, thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ. Con cái còn nhỏ nên phải dành thời gian cho các cháu học, một mình chị L. chăm lo mọi việc. Để có tiền trả tuần, chị chỉ cần bán đi vài chiếc chiếu, nên việc vay vốn từ Quỹ hoàn toàn thuận lợi với gia đình. Thu nhập từ dệt chiếu hàng tháng của chị L. khoảng 125-150USD. Chồng chị đi làm thợ xây cũng khoảng 80USD/tháng. Hiện nay khi giá lác (nguyên liệu dệt chiếu) đang rẻ, chị bàn với chồng vay 950USD để mua lác dự trữ, ngoài ra chị còn đầu tư một phần vào chăn nuôi, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình

loans.use: Buy sedge to weave mat

loans.name: Mercedes Abigail

texts.es:
For over 15 years Mercedes P. has sold clothing in the central market in the city of Chinandega. She sells clothing of all sizes and for all ages. Mercedes own her own portion of the market which has required a great deal of investment to obtain. These proved especially difficult because she is a single mother with one child to care for. Still, she has managed to stock the business with a large quantity of clothing.

Five yeas ago Mercedes began as a traveling saleswoman, selling clothing throughout the market, exposing herself to the sun and expending great physical energy walking all day. Slowly Mercedes began to save for the purchase of a stall inside the market, and finally purchased one. Since then she has begun to take loans from CEPRODEL. These loans have greatly helped her and allowed her to purchase large quantities of clothing to sell. Additionally, she has been able to better support her small family as a single mother with a young child.
