She is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little shop

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati, 36, was selling vegetables for a living but this business was not growing very well because she had run out of capital. Now she and her husband, P., produce bamboo matting and earn about $6 a day; their income depends on the amount of orders they can fill. She is asking for a loan of $75 to continue her vegetable business and bamboo matting. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
Since María and her husband have six children (ages 13, 11, 9, 5, 3 and 1 respectively), María decided to begin her own business. After thinking about how to make money without neglecting her children, she came to the conclusion that selling catalog cosmetics was the best option. Gradually, she found the time to go out and offer her products and now she is known in her community.

Nevertheless, María believes that it is time to establish a business within her home so that she doesn’t have to leave so much. As a result, she is requesting a loan of US $575 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, María will be able to purchase material so that she can establish a stationery store. With your help, María can make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Puesto que María y su esposo tienen 6 hijos D.; 13, 11, 9, 5, 3 y 1 respectivamente, fue como María decidió comenzar su propio negocio. Después D. pensar L. manera D. obtener dinero sin perderle atención a sus hijos llegó a L. conclusión D. que L. venta D. cosméticos por catálogo era L. mejor opción. Poco a poco se daba un tiempo para poder ir a ofrecer sus productos y actualmente ya es conocida en su comunidad.

Sin embargo María considera que ya es momento D. establecer un negocio dentro D. su casa, para no tener que moverse tanto. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito D. US $575 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar material para poner su papelería. Con tu ayuda lograrás que María pueda hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nurlelah

texts.en: Nurlelah, 22, sells clothing on credit door-to-door around the villages, earning around $15 a week. Her husband, A., does not have a fixed job. She joined MBK to get a loan so she could expand her business to support her family needs and provide her children's education. She is asking for a loan of $75 and willing repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little clothing sales business

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida, 28, is the mother of 2 children. She sells household necessities on credit such as powder, soap, toothpaste, shampoo, etc., door-to-door around the villages. From this business she can earn up to $7 a week. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to expand her little household necessities sales

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Since she was very young Martha dedicated herself to the sale of food together with her parents before she was married and bit by bit she learned tricks of the business. After getting married she began her own business selling food. Together with what her husband earns, as a newspaper salesman, it is not enough to pay for the expenses of her and her two children. Martha has learned how to take advantage of the good flavor that her foods have, and because of this she has become known in her community. Nowadays Martha is requesting $475 USD that is arranged to be paid off over a term of 3 months and with this money Martha will be able to purchase more raw materials so that she can expand her business and be able to have more clients. With your help Martha will be able to further her children and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

DesD. muy joven Martha se dedicó a vender comidas junto con sus papás antes D. casarse y poco a poco aprendió los trucos D. este negocio. Después D. casarse comenzó su propio negocio D. ventas D. comidas. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo, como vendedor D. periódico no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos D. elL. y sus dos hijos. Martha a sabido aprovechar el buen sabor que tiene en sus comidas, por lo que a podido darse a conocer en su comunidad.

Actualmente Martha está solicitando un crédito D. US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 3 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar más materia prima para poder crecer su negocio y con esto poder tener más clientes. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase her business

loans.name: Enuy

texts.en: Enuy, 20, is the mother of 3 sons. She sells home-made ice cream at her house and earns $5 a day, while her husband, J., sells the ice cream door-to-door on his wagon around the villages and earns $7 a day. As a member of MBK she is requesting a loan of $75 to buy supplies and expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business expansion

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati, 33, is the mother of 3 children. Her husband, D., has no fixed job so she has to work to earn income for the family by selling foods such doughnuts, cakes, etc., earning $5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little food business

loans.name: Enung

texts.en: Enung, 46, and her husband, P., plant banana trees in their garden. They sell the bananas at the market and earn $7 a day. Enung is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of their little banana-growing business

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.es:
Doña Gualberta is 36 years old, her activity is craftwork producing accessories for clothing and she also has a grocery store at her home. Her family consists of the parents and 4 children, the older daughter works while she is on vacation. Gualberta keeps her mini workshop in her bedroom where she has been manufacturing the fabrics which later are turned into wallets, bags, and purses for the past 4 years.

Gualberta is a partner of a group of craftswomen and they work sales taking shifts as guests at craftwork fairs. In her activity area there are three groups of partners, this specific group is very united and therefore more competitive as they cover a larger group of clients. The present application for a loan will be used to expand the variety of products offered at her grocery store which keeps in stock different kinds of merchandise at different prices and quality. Doña Gualberta’s credit history is very good as few late payments have been reported.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Gualberta es una señora de 36 años de edad que realiza artesanías de accesorios de prendas de vestir y también cuenta con una venta de abarrotes en su domicilio. Su familia consta de los 2 padres y 4 hijos, la hija mayor trabaja cuando está de vacaciones. Gualberta tiene su mini taller en su cuarto, allí realiza los tejidos que posteriormente los convierte en carteras, bolsones y monederos. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad alrededor de 4 años.

Gualberta es socia de un grupo artesanal de mujeres donde se realizan las ventas de forma intercalada, son invitadas a ferias para este efecto, en su área de actividad existen tres grupos de socias, este grupo es bastante unido y es así que pueden competir de mejor manera porque cubren a mayor parte de los demandantes por este tipo de productos. La presente solicitud es para ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda de abarrotes, que tiene diferentes tipos de precios dependiendo del artículo y su calidad. El historial crediticio de Gualberta es muy bueno ya que mantiene niveles muy bajos de mora.

loans.use: Purchase more and varied merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira works to make money to pay for the studies of her three young children. Every day she leaves her house to sell tender corn. All this began because in the jobs that she had, Elvira didn’t receive the money that she needed to help her husband with the expenses. It was because of this that she began to look for a better way of making the money she needed. Furthermore, she wanted to be her own boss. Nowadays she has various clients that look for her to buy the corn, and even cosmetics that she sells. However, these days she wants to add the sale of steamed tacos and sufficient material to be able to provide the tacos. With your support she can further her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvira trabaja para poder sacar dinero para poder pagar los estudios de sus tres pequeños. Todos los días sale de su casa a vender elotes en un carretón. Todo comenzó porque en los trabajos que estuvo Elvira no recibía el dinero que necesitaba para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos. Fue por eso que comenzó a buscar la mejor manera de obtener el dinero que necesitaba. Además de que le gusta ser su propia dueña. Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que la buscan para comprarle elotes, además de cosméticos que vende.

Sin embargo actualmente quiere agregar la venta de tacos al vapor para poder obtener mayores ganancias. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Elvira podrá comprar una vaporera y material suficiente para poder elaborar los tacos. Con tu ayuda podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Baldemar

texts.es:
Baldemar has 4 children whom he wishes will study at the University level. However, his dream has been broken due to the fact that his business, a butcher shop, burnt down, but he couldn’t get rid of his interest in selling meat so he began to sell dried, grilled and sausage meat among other things. Thanks to his strength this business has been prospering bit by bit. Nowadays they are offering two pigs at a good price. Because of this he is requesting a loan of $475 USD that is arranged to be paid in one term of 6 months and with this money Baldemar could further his family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Baldemar tiene 4 hijos a quienes desea darles estudios universitarios. Sin embargo su sueño se había visto roto debido a que su negocio anterior, una carnicería, quebró, sin embargo el gusto por la venta de carne no se le quitó sin embargo comenzó a vender carne seca, chorizo, asado entre otras cosas. Gracias a su esfuerzo este negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco.

Actualmente le están ofreciendo dos puercos a un muy buen precio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $ 475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Baldemar podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy two pigs that are being offered at a good price.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
From a young age Raul has worked managing a hardware store. Step by step he learned what is necessary to manage the hardware store. After leaving his job he decided to make his own hardware store outside his house. Bit by bit he began to establish his business and it became well known in the area. However, nowadays he doesn't have enough merchandise to offer his clients. Because of this Raul is requesting a credit of $1150 USD that is arranged to be paid in a term of 6 months so that he can amplify the collection of products. With your help Raul will be able to better his hardware store and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy joven Raúl trabajó administrando una ferretería. Y poco a poco aprendió lo necesario para poder administrar una ferretería. Después de que lo corrieron de su trabajo decidió poner su propia ferretería fuera de su casa. Poco a poco comenzó a establecer su negocio y a darse a conocer en su localidad.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que Raúl está solicitando un crédito de US $1150 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses para poder ampliar el repertorio de productos. Con tu ayuda Raúl podrá sacar adelante a su ferretería y a su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gladias Melania

texts.es:
Mrs. Gladias L. is in the business of clothing sales, which she sells from her own stall in the market at the terminal in the beautiful city of León, Nicaragua. Mrs. L. has 22 years of experience in the business, which she has worked very hard to maintain.

She started the business out in the open air from a small basket, and then got her own section where she could place her products.

Ceprodel has been providing her with financial assistance for six years, with a total of 10 credits that have allowed her to increase the amount of merchandise and achieve subsistence for her children she is raising, thanks to the business that generates the income to allow her to live a dignified life. She currently needs to acquire more merchandise (clothing) to sell, and for this reason she is requesting help from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Gladias L. se refiere a la venta de ropa en un local propio dentro del mercado la terminal en la bella ciudad de León Nicaragua. La señora L. tiene 22 años de dedicarse a este negocio que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego obtiene su tramo propio donde colocar sus productos.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero por un periodo de seis años con un total de 10 créditos que le han impactado de manera que ha incrementado su mercadería y logrado la subsistencia para sus hijos que los está formando gracias al negocio que le genera utilidad para poder vivir dignamente. Su necesidad actual es la urgencia de adquirir mas mercadería (ropa) para comercializarla, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel buscando este apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo is 29 years old and runs his own locksmith business on Juan Pablo II Avenue. He is single and is now living in his uncle's house. He has two years experience with his trade. The shop is located in his own home. The loan he is requesting will be destined for the purchase of work materials, specifically the purchase of pipes. He has a good credit history. This is his third credit loan and his payments have always been on time.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Teofilo es una persona de 29 años de edad, cuenta con una cerrajería propia en la avenida Juan Pablo II, es soltero y actualmente vive en la casa de su tío. Cuenta con una actividad de cerrajería donde tiene dos años de experiencia, este negocio de encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. El destino de la presente solicitud es para la compra de material de trabajo, específicamente para tubos. Cuenta con un buen historial crediticio, el presente es su tercer crédito y sus pagos simepre fueron puntuales y anticipados. Cuenta con 0 días de retraso.

loans.use: Purchase of work materials, pipes

loans.name: Isabel Virginia

texts.es:
The transportation business is a very profitable one, especially when it involves transportation from one department to another. This is the business of Mrs. Isabel N., who has her own minibus to transport passengers both within León and from León to Managua. Mrs. Isabel N. is a single mother who has a son to take care of, so she is looking for a way to survive in order to provide her humble home with some stability.

Currently the minibus is broken and she needs to buy the parts for the repairs. Mrs. Isabel N. turns confidently to Ceprodel, who for six years has provided financial support to her. She currently has a record of six credits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de transporte es un negocio muy rentable especialmente cuando se trata de traslado de un departamento a otro. Esta actividad es la de la señora Isabel N. quien tiene a su cargo un microbús propio para traslado de personal tanto a lo interno de León como de León a Managua. La señora Isabel N. es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener por lo que busca la manera de sobrevivir para lograr la estabilidad de su humilde hogar.

Actualmente la situación que atraviesa es que el microbús esta dañado y por tal razón es necesario la compra de los repuestos para su debida reparación. Por esta razón es que ella muy confiadamente acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace seis años le ha brindado apoyo financiero para su sustento. Actualmente tiene un record de 6 créditos.

loans.use: Repair minibus

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a skilled entrepreneur from the city of Zaporozhye in central Ukraine. She operates a small grocery business that she has been gradually developing and expanding. Her business is located at the busy Angolenko market in Zaporozhye. She has a good spot in an open-air section of the market, where she sells a variety of fish, vegetables and canned goods. In a major business expansion, Vera recently opened a second sales location directly across from her first location in the market. This arrangement allows her to easily monitor the activities at both locations. Vera is married and has a sixteen-year-old daughter. She started her business six years ago in order to help support her family.

Vera has requested a loan of $700 to help get her new sales location fully up and running and supplying it with grocery inventory. She has benefited in the past from loans received through Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for another opportunity to help this dedicated entrepreneur advance her business and continue her success.

loans.use: Purchase grocery inventory for new market location

loans.name: Perla Marisol

texts.es:
Perla was married, however she had problems with her partner and decided to divorce and she is now in charge of her son. Because of this she began to make her own business, after not being able to find work. She began with very little merchandise and bit by bit it is growing and adding more merchandise to sell. Nowadays Perla is requesting a loan of $375 USD that is arranged to be paid over a term of 4 months. With this money Perla will be able to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell cold meats in her business. With your help Perla will be able to further her business so that she can provide her son with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Perla estaba casada, sin embargo tuvo unos problemas con su pareja por eso se divorció y ella se quedó a cargo de su hijo. Es por eso que comenzó a hacer su propio negocio, ya que no podía conseguir trabajo. Comenzó con muy poca mercancía y poco a poco fue creciendo y agregando un poco más de mercancía para vender.

Actualmente Perla está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses. Y con este dinero Perla podrá comprar un refrigerador para poder vender carnes frías en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Perla podrá sacar adelante su negocio para así poder darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for cold meats.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one daughter. He and his family live in Melitopol. Alexander runs a small business selling warm, colorful blankets. He has been in this trade for 4 years and his business has proven to be competitive in this commercial sector. Presently, Alexander has about $4000 in inventory. His gross income is about $2000 a month and his net profit is usually about $500 each month.

Alexander has an enterprising spirit. The success he has achieved is a direct result of his hard work and commitment to his business. Today Alexander would like to receive a loan of $1000 to increase his assortment of merchandise so that he can provide more items and better service to his customers. We believe that all the effort Alexander is willing to invest in the improvement of his business and services will help him achieve continued success and enable him to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Silvia Martha

texts.es:
10 years ago Silvia began to work as a seamstress to be able to help her husband with the expenses of their 3 children for whom she wishes to provide a university education so that they have a better future than she has. First she bought a sewing machine and began to repair clothing for her neighbors. Little by little they said that Silvia’s work was good, and this is how they started ordering full outfits. Nowadays she already has various clients that order clothes. However she has orders that she cannot finish because she does not have enough merchandise to make them. Because of this, Silvia is requesting a credit of $200 USD that is arranged to be repaid in one term of 5 months. With your help Silvia will be able to better her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 10 años que Silvia comenzó a trabajar como costurera. Para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus 3 hijos a quienes desea brindarles educación universitaria para que tengan un mejor futuro que el de ella. Primero compró una máquina de coser y así comenzó a arreglar ropa de sus vecinas. Poco a poco se fueron dando cuenta que el trabajo que Silvia era bueno, así que le comenzaron a pedir trajes completos.

Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes que le piden ropa. Sin embargo tiene varios pedidos que no a podido realizar puesto que no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder hacerla. Es por eso que Silvia está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Con tu ayuda Silvia podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase thread and fabrics, among other things.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with an 18-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter. She and her family live in Uzhgorod. Oksana is a small entrepreneur with a business in a local market called “Belochka," where she sells socks, umbrellas and other items. She has been in this business for 4 years. Oksana currently has about $3000 in inventory.

Oksana is very focused and determined. She is grateful for the loans she has previously received from “Nadiya Ukraine,” which have helped her expand her business. At this time, Oksana would like to receive a loan of $900 to purchase socks at wholesale prices, which she believes will promote solid growth in her sales.

Oksana has a very optimistic spirit. She never gives up and always cheers her fellow entrepreneurs. We believe her friendliness and persistence will help Oksana gain even more customers and keep her business competitive.

loans.use: Puchase a supply of socks from wholesaler

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
For Oscar Danilo G., his own home represents a business, as two years ago he converted his home into a hostel or mini-hotel for those who need the service. The idea for the business came to him when he thought about the many visitors that come to the beautiful city of León who need a place to stay while visiting.

Mr. Oscar Danilo needs to invest in the renovation of his mini-hotel, as the bathrooms, beds and floors have deteriorated over time and it is not in good taste to allow hotel guests to find themselves in these conditions. For this reason, Oscar has very wisely turned to Ceprodel to receive support in the form of credits (currently a total of 6 credits) to invest in the remodeling of his home and business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Para Oscar Danilo G., su propio hogar representa su negocio, debido a que desde hace 2 años convirtió su casa de habitación en un hospedaje o mini hotel para los que necesitan este servicio. Surge la idea del negocio por contemplar que son muchos los visitantes a la bella ciudad de León y por tal razón buscan la manera de cómo hospedarse en dicha localidad.

La necesidad que atraviesa el señor Oscar Danilo es que es de urgencia invertir en la remodelación del local tanto como baños, camas y pisos debido a que a través del tiempo se ha venido deteriorando y no es de buen gusto para los clientes encontrarse con tales condiciones. Por esta razón es que muy sabiamente el señor Oscar acude a Ceprodel para recibir apoyo por medio de Créditos (Actualmente un total de 6 créditos) para invertirlos en la remodelación de su hogar y negocio.

loans.use: Repair/remodel bedrooms

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a widow with two grown children. She lives in Berdyansk, Ukraine. Ludmila sells coffee, tea and spices in the central city market. Her business is well known in the city for quality products, reasonable prices and for Ludmila’s integrity and individual approach to each client. Presently, Ludmila has about $900 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1500 and her monthly net profit is about $500.

Ludmila’s business has benefited considerably from micro-lending services since the time she received her first loan through Nadiya Ukraine. Today she is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her assortment of inventory and add to her turnover capital. Ludmila is hoping to generate better profits and eventually fix the roof on her house, which was damaged in a storm. One of her long-term plans is to open a new business location in the market. Ludmila has strong character. We believe her ability to handle challenges will help her achieve the ultimate business success.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory and add to working capital

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
Maria Olga has been selling cosmetics by catalog for 4 years she began this because one of her 3 children is studying at the university and she wants to pay for his studies so that he can finish school. To be able to pay for her studies, Maria needs more merchandise. It is for this that Maria is requesting a loan of $700 that is arranged to be paid in one term of 6 months and with this money she will purchase merchandise so that she will have a better variety of products and thus have more clients to be able to pay for the education of her children and especially her oldest son.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

María Olga tiene 4 años vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo esto lo comenzó puesto que uno de sus 3 hijos está estudiando la universidad y ella desea poder pagarle la carrera para que pueda terminar de estudiar.

Para poder pagarle los estudios María necesita más mercancía. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad en sus productos y así tener más clientes para poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos en especial del hijo mayor.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a 5-year-old son. She lives in Uzhgorod and sells women’s lingerie in the local market called “Belochka.” She always offers only the best quality, trendy merchandise. Her inventory is always in high demand among women customers. Nataliya is very enterprising and confident. She has been in this business for 2 years. Currently, her turnover captial is about $2400.

Nataliya rarely uses lending services, and she normally uses her own capital to make wholesale purchases of inventory to sell in the market. This time, however, she is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase new, more expensive lingerie before the spring season. We believe Nataliya’s willingness to offer her customers greater value and a wider choice of merchandise, combined with her excellent service, will secure the successful growth of her trade and guarantee good profits from sales. She hopes one day to have enough savings to fulfill her desire to open her own larger lingerie store in the city of Uzhgorod.

loans.use: Purchase new, more expensive inventory

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga María B. is a hard-working woman who is in the business of selling medications. She has her own pharmacy in her home in León, in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

She began the pharmacy on her own three years ago after being widowed, with a son in her care. Despite this difficult situation, she has been developing her business to the point where she has been able to stock a greater quantity of medications, pills, and lotions that are very popular with her customers. Currently Mrs. B. needs to purchase more medications, and for this reason she has turned to Ceprodel, who for a year has given her financial support in order to purchase medications for the pharmacy and in this way keep making progress with the maintenance of her home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Olga Maria B. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica al negocio de venta de medicamentos, teniendo una farmacia propia en su hogar de habitación en León de la bella nación de Nicaragua.

La farmacia la inicia por cuenta propia desde hace 3 años al quedar viuda y con un hijo a su cargo. A pesar de esta dura situación, ha venido desarrollando su negocio hasta lograr surtirlo con mayores cantidades de medicamentos, pastillas y pomadas muy demandados por los clientes.

Hoy en día la necesidad que atraviesa la señora B. es la urgencia de surtir sus productos con los medicamentos, para esto acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace un año le brinda apoyo financiero para surtir la farmacia de medicamentos y así salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase medications

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago Avedaño is a young man worthy of imitation because of his ability to perform carpentry work from a young age. His business is located on the patio of his home, which has the advantage of being located in a busy area.

The responsibility of this young man is to continue maintaining his humble home and elderly parents, which requires him to invest in the purchase of wood and tools in a better state in order to continue providing his clients with good service. For this reason he has requested credits from Ceprodel which would allow him to buy tools and wood of excellent quality. His record is 12 credits with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago A. es un joven digno de imitar debido a que desde muy pequeño ha tenido la habilidad de trabajar en la carpintería. El negocio lo ubica en el patio de su casa teniendo la ventaja de estar ubicado en un lugar muy transitado.

La necesidad que atraviesa este joven es que para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar y a sus ancianos padres requiere invertir en la compra de la madera y de herramientas en mejor estado para continuar brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por tal motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de las herramientas y madera de excelente calidad. Su record crediticio es de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio R. is a married man and with 2 children he dedicates himself to the business of selling liquors that are properly legalized and authorized by the authorities of the region of Leon where his home is located. He began this business on account of the necessity of his family and after not finding employment anywhere; he decided to invest his small savings in this business. Nowadays the necessity that affects Mr. R. is that he needs to invest in the purchase of his products (drinks) and for this he makes use of Ceprodel who has supplied him over the last 5 years with the credits to purchase his products. His record is of 9 credits with Ceprodel paid on time and by the manner established.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco Antonio R. es un caballero casado y con dos hijos que se dedica al negocio de la venta de licores debidamente legalizado y autorizado por las autoridades del departamento de León que es su lugar de habitación. Este negocio lo inicia por la necesidad que atraviesa con su familia y al no encontrar empleo en ningún lado, decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en el negocio.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa el señor R. es que necesita invertir en la compra de sus productos (bebidas) y para esto hace uso de Ceprodel quien desde hace 5 años le ha proporcionado estos créditos para la compra de sus productos. Su record es de 9 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido.

loans.use: The purchase of drinks.

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es:
Making and selling homemade tortillas is a very common business in Nicaragua, specifically in the city of León, and because of this Mrs. Juana G. has been making tortillas for ten years, since she was very young. She began the business in the market at the terminal in León where, beginning early in the morning, every day she makes these delicious tortillas that are very popular with her customers. One problem that Juanita G. has is that, as a single mother caring for two children, she has to be the breadwinner for her family.

Ceprodel has given her financial support for one year. With the credits she’s obtained, she has invested in the purchase of raw materials to make her delicious tortillas with which she maintains her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La elaboración y venta de tortillas es un negocio muy común en Nicaragua específicamente en la ciudad de León, es por eso que la señora Juana G. se dedica a elaborar las tortillas desde muy jovencita teniendo 10 años de dedicación constante a esta labor. Inició este negocio en el mercado la Terminal en León donde desde muy de mañanita todos los días elabora estas deliciosas tortillas que son muy demandadas por sus clientes. Una problemática que atraviesa la señora Juanita Garcia es que por ser soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo tiene el deber de llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

Ceprodel le ha brindado apoyo financiero desde hace un año con créditos a su favor los cuales los ha sabido invertir en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar sus deliciosas tortillas con las que mantiene su negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Amparo Maritza's Group

texts.en:
Amparo and Herlinda have been members of the Kausachun community bank for four months. In that time they have learned to be punctual and to save.

Amparo is 36 and has four young children. Her cousin encouraged her to join the community bank. Amparo owns a car, which she uses as a taxi, but with her loan she will begin selling auto parts.

Herlinda is 25 and has two children. She runs a small but very well stocked store. She has had this business for almost one year. Before that she sold clothing, but prefers her new business.

Amparo and Herlinda need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their selections of auto parts and candy.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Herlinda and Amparo plan to use their savings to improve their businesses and repair their homes. Their dreams are to continue improving their lives and see their children become professionals.

loans.use: Amparo and Herlinda need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their selections of auto parts and candy.

loans.name: Xiomara Argentina

texts.es:
Xiomara M. is a hardworking woman that has been devoted to food sales at home, in the city of León, for the past 10 years. She is married and mother of two children, who are her dependents.

She started her business when, as a homemaker, she noticed the needs of her family and the inadequacy of her husband's income to cover the household expenses. She thus decided to invest her savings (100 dollars) in the purchase of ingredients for food production.

She has requested loans to Ceprodel, which have been beneficial for the refurbishing of her store. She needed to invest in the purchase of plastic chairs and a table, so that her clients could enjoy their meals there.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Xiomara M. es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de comida en su hogar de habitación en León. Es madre casada y con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad.

Su negocio nace cuando se dedicaba a la labor de ama de casa. Al ver la necesidad de su familia y que los ingresos de su esposo no cubrían con los gastos del hogar, decide invertir sus ahorros (100 dólares) en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos.

Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos a Ceprodel, que le han beneficiado para la remodelación de su local, ya que era necesario que invirtiera en la compra de sillas plásticas y una mesa plástica para ubicarlas en su local, para que los clientes puedan disfrutar sus alimentos allí.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food elaboration.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
María Candelaria is a mother of two daughters who are 14 and 17 years of age and one son who is 18 years old, to whom she always wishes to give the best. Currently, her eldest is studying and María wishes that he complete a university degree. As a result, two years ago, upon realizing that her husband’s salary was not enough to pay for her son’s university education, María began to sew for her friends and neighbors. Gradually, she has built a good reputation and now she has customers who ask her for all kinds of items, including costumes. Right now, she has an order for the Carnival celebrations and it requires an investment in fabric.

Nevertheless, she does not have enough material to fulfill this order. Consequently, María is soliciting a loan of US $200 which she will repay in 6 months. This will allow her to purchase the material she needs and deliver the costumes and earn more income. With your help, María will be able to advance her career and save some money for her children’s future expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

María Candelaria es madre de dos niñas de 14 y 7 años y de un niño de 18 años, a quienes desea darles siempre lo mejor. Actualmente tiene al más grande estudiando, y María desea que termine una carrera universitaria. Fue por eso que hace 2 años al ver que con el sueldo de su esposo no podrían pagar la universidad de su hijo que María comenzó a coser para sus amigos y vecinos, poco a poco se ha ido haciendo conocida, ahora ya tiene clientes que le solicitan todo tipo de confección, incluso disfraces, precisamente ahora tiene un pedido para las fiestas de carnaval, y requiere invertir en tela para confeccionarlas.

Sin embargo no cuenta con material suficiente como para hacer ese pedido. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar el material que necesita y así entregar los disfraces para que pueda recibir mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante este trabajo, además de que con este dinero podrá ahorrar un poco para futuros gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for her products.

loans.name: Rita Aracelli

texts.es:
Rita dedicates herself to the sale of tamales, which are typical in her community. She has been a widow for five years. She began this business because she needed to have a steady income in order to pay her bills and her 13-year old child’s school expenses. Currently, she sells from her house, but in the mornings, she goes out into the street to offer her products and she sells from her house in the afternoons.

Rita wishes to increase her sales. As a result, she is soliciting a credit of US $200 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy more of the ingredients needed to make her products and, in this way, earn more money. With your help, Rita will be able to grow her business and raise her child and provide him with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Rita es una persona que se dedica a la venta de tamales típicos de la comunidad, ella es viuda desde hace cinco años y comenzó este negocio porque necesitaba tener un ingreso fijo para pagar los gastos de la casa y los estudios de su hijo de 13 años. Actualmente vende en su domicilio, pero por las mañanas sale a la calle a ofrecer sus productos y en las tardes vende en su casa.

Rita desea incrementar su venta, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar el material necesario para poder elaborar más productos y así poder obtener mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda Rita podrá hacer crecer su negocio para así poder mantener a su hijo y brindarle educación.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Ivette Del Rosario

texts.es:
The manufacture of blouses and shirts requires a skill that not everyone possesses, as it requires great interest and ability. Ms. Ivette G. has been devoted to her work as seamstress for the past three years, at her home in the city of León.

She went through great difficulties as she started her business, with no clients and the pressing need to support her little child. She has improved her business with the years, by means of loans she has requested to Ceprodel. Today, thanks to these loans, she has been able to acquire sewing tools and materials and has invested in a new and better sewing machine. Her greatest wish is to win more clients, in order to keep providing for her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La elaboración de blusas y camisas es una destreza que no todas las personas poseen, por ser una labor que necesita de mucho interés y sobre todo mucha habilidad para su elaboración. En la ciudad de León, la señora Ivette G. se dedica al trabajo de costurería, teniendo este negocio desde hace 3 años en su casa de habitación.

Comenzó el negocio con mucha problemática ya que no poseía clientes y además tenia urgentemente que mantener a su pequeño hijo. A través de los años, ha venido desarrollando su negocio por medio de créditos que ha solicitado en Ceprodel para el mejoramiento de su negocio. Hoy en día, gracias a estos créditos otorgados ha adquirido sus productos de costurera y además ha invertido en la compra de una nueva máquina con mejores condiciones que la anterior. Su mayor anhelo es captar más clientes para seguir manteniendo su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials.

loans.name: María Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita worked in a factory, but tired of the maltreatment and low wages, she decided to start her own business. With the support of her husband, she began to sell snacks from a tricycle outside schools near her home and gradually she has become recognized at the schools. With the money she earns, María Teresita helps her husband pay for housing expenses and schooling for her 9-year-old child.

Nevertheless, Teresita currently desires to expand her business so that she may earn more and start a store in the future. As a result, she is soliciting a credit of US $200, which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy ingredients to make more Yucateco snacks, as well as buy fried foods. With your help, María Teresita will be able to help her family get ahead and provide a better future for them.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Teresita Trabajaba en empresas de maquila, pero cansada de los malos tratos y sueldos bajos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y con el apoyo de su esposo empezó a vender antojitos en un triciclo en las afueras de las escuelas cercanas a su casa, poco a poco se ha ido haciendo conocida en las escuelas. Y con este dinero, María Teresita ayuda a su esposo a pagar los gastos de la casa y de los estudios de su hijo de 9 años.

Sin embargo actualmente Teresita, desea incrementar su negocio para así poder obtener mayores ganancias y en un futuro poder establecerse en un local. Es por es oque está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar materia prima para elaborar más antojitos Yucatecos. Así como para comprar frituras. Con tu ayuda María Teresita podrá sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
For the past three years, Ms. Rosa G. has been dedicated to her grocery store, located at home in the León region. She is a widow and mother of a school-age child. For that reason, she makes a great effort to support her household, so that her children are well and healthy.

Since she started her business, Ms. Rosa has obtained loans from Ceprodel, and used them to stock up on merchandise for her store. Today, she once more needs to invest to buy merchandise, so she is turning to Ceprodel, knowing it won’t let her down. Ms. Rosa G. has a record of two loans with the institution, both of which have been repaid timely by her.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 3 años atrás, la señora Rosa G. se dedica al negocio de pulpería en su hogar de habitación en el departamento de León. Es madre viuda y con un hijo en edad escolar. Por tal motivo es que ella se esfuerza grandemente por llevar el sustento a su hogar y que sus hijos puedan gozar de salud y bienestar.

Desde que inició su negocio, la señora Rosa ha obtenido créditos con Ceprodel, los cuales ha utilizado para la compra de productos para surtir su pulpería. Hoy en día, una vez más necesita la inversión en su negocio para la adquisición de estos productos y por ello es que solicita crédito en CEPRODEL sabiendo que no le fallará. Su record es de dos créditos con esta institución. Cabe señalar que todos estos créditos han sido pagados en tiempo y forma por la señora Rosa G..

loans.use: Purchase of grocery store merchandise.

loans.name: Virginia J

texts.es:
Ms. Virginia A. has run a grocery store at home, in the city of León, for the past two years. She sells basic needs products, food and personal items, as well as house-made products. From the beginning, she has worked very hard and has invested in her business, in order to improve her difficult financial situation as the sole provider for her family.

Previous to having her business, she was a homemaker. Realizing she didn’t have adequate resources, she turned to Ceprodel, obtaining two loans, which she has invested on the purchase of merchandise for her store. This has resulted in greater sales volumes and better costumer service.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace dos años, en la ciudad de León, la señora Virginia A. se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, comestibles, personales y caseros, teniendo su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación. Desde que inició su negocio, ha sido una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora la cual ha invertido en su negocio para el mejoramiento de su situación económica, la cual según cuenta ha estado muy difícil por el hecho de que ella es el único sostén en el hogar.

Antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba al trabajo de ama de casa pero al darse cuenta que no obtenía los recursos necesarios, acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado un total de dos créditos, invertidos en la compra de mercadería, lo que ha resultado en mayores volúmenes de venta y una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es:
Karla is a hardworking woman, who runs a grocery store at home, in the city of León. Five years ago, as she was not able to find employment and was going through a difficult financial situation, she decided to invest her meager savings (4000 córdobas, aproximately 215 US dollars) in the purchase of products for sale.

As every working woman, she opens the doors of her business very early to serve her faithful clientele. It is important to point out that she has been a good Ceprodel client for two years, requesting loans that she has used to stock up on merchandise and, in this way, support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de León, específicamente en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 5 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros (cuatro mil córdobas) en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Como toda mujer trabajadora, ella desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para atender a su fiel clientela. Es necesario destacar que desde hace dos años ha sido una fiel cliente de Ceprodel, solicitando créditos que los utilizado para surtir su tienda y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Aida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Aida S. has four children for whom she has worked hard, along with her husband, in order to provide them with adequate education, proper nutrition and other basic needs. Located at her home in León, Ms. S.’s grocery store has been in business since her young age. She started with it at the time of a severe economic crisis. At the time, she had no idea how to support her children and decided to invest in this business.

With the experience acquired with time, the business has become stronger, and she has been able to cover her household expenses. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and is very satisfied with the loans, as they have been granted timely, when she was in need of money to buy merchandise and stock up her store. She has a record of two loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Aida S. es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales, junto con su esposo, lucha por brindarles educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio de la señora S. es una pulpería, que desde muy joven ha venido desarrollando en su casa de habitación en León. El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviezan una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro, ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. Ella trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados, pues le han sido brindados cuando más lo necesitaba para la compra de todos los productos para su pulpería. Su record es de dos créditos con CEPRODEL.

loans.use: Stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.en:
Lidia, Delia, and Yesica are part of the Cielo community bank. Lidia has been a member for one year while Delia and Yesica joined four months ago. In the community bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save. They have also learned how to avoid sickness, avoid domestic violence, and how to use contraceptives. They mentioned that they really like their bank organizer, who is dynamic and happy.

Lidia is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and three year old daughter. Lidia has been raising cattle for two years. She raises her cattle in the town of Sacsmarca in the district of Huascahura. In addition, during the week, Lidia travels to different markets buying fruits, vegetables and grains and then selling them in the city of Ayacuho.

Delia is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. By profession she is a teacher but currently is running a business selling cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics to her friends and families for one and a half years.

Meanwhile, Yesica is 30 years old. She also lives with her partner and two young children. Yesica transports clothing from the city of Lima and then sells it to friends, families, and different institutions. Together with her husband, Yesica travels to the city of Andahuaylas to buy different grains and then sells them in Ayacucho. She learned this business from her in-laws.

Lidia, Delia, and Yesica need loans of 200, 400, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pork, colognes, perfumes, cosmetics, pants, and shirts.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 44 years old. She has been part of the Cielo community bank for two years. In the community bank Justina has learned to be punctual, manage her business efficiently, and to save.

Two years ago Justina decided to start selling cosmetics to her friends, family, and neighbors. She later added clothing to her business, and two months ago she started selling food staples such as flour, sugar, and milk. Now, she would like to take advantage of the beginning of the school season by offering school supplies.

Justina needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she will invest in buying clothing, pencils, pens, folders, paper, rulers, and other merchandise in Lima and then bringing it to Ayacucho.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the savings account each associate has. Justina plans to use her savings to increase the capital available to her business, and for her future needs. Her dream is to see her business prosper, and to have good health.

loans.use: Justina needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she will invest in buying clothing, pencils, pens, folders, paper, rulers, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Fortunata's Group

texts.en:
Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela belong to the community bank “Cielo”. Fortunata and Gudelia have been members for six years; Pamela joined four months ago. In that time they have learned about saving, punctuality, and responsibility.

Fortunata is forty and has three children. She transports children to school. She started this business two years ago. Previously, she sold shoes and clothing at the market. A few years ago Fortunata had a very difficult pregnancy and was unable to work for an extended period of time. She decided to start the transportation business with a loan from the community bank because it gave her an opportunity to work without putting too much stress in her body.

Gudelia is 62 years old. She has four children all of whom are successful. One child is a police officer, one is an engineer, another is a secretary, and the oldest is an administrator for the regional government. Gudelia has owned a small grocery store for many years. In the past she traveled to different markets buying and selling her products, but now she has been able to open a store in an established location.

Pamela is 24 years old and has two young children. She makes and sells a variety of breads. The most popular is the regional specialty chapla, which is similar to pita bread. She is planning to open a fast food cart where she would sell salchipapa - potatoes topped with meat and egg.

Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela need loans of 400, 1200, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy auto parts, flour, sugar, fruits, pasta, milk, and a food cart.

An important aspect of the community bank is that each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela plan to use their savings to buy furniture for their homes, in case of an emergency of unexpected cost, and to buy a van that would be used to transport bread to different regions respectively.

Their dreams are to move to Lima, continue to develop their business, get married, to own a car, and a house. Gudelia smiled and said what she would really like to do is own an airplane.

loans.use: Fortunata, Gudelia, and Pamela need loans of 400, 1200, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy auto parts, flour, sugar, fruits, pasta, milk, and a food cart.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario M. is single and, for the past 10 years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of cheese. She tells us that from a young age she enjoyed the business and liked the work and, at thirteen years of age, she began working for someone else. She later decided to start her own business of selling cheese at the market in León.

She tells us that her business has always done well, due to the fact that she is in a good location and has been able to build a customer base. Rosario has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years, and is very satisfied with the loans that have been granted her at very opportune times. These have helped her supply her business, and to satisfy her customers on a daily basis. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario M. es una dama soltera que se dedica al negocio de venta de queso teniendo 10 años de tener este negocio, nos cuenta que desde joven le ha gustado el negocio, siempre le gusto el trabajo y por esto comenzó a la edad de trece a trabajar en la venta del queso, pero esta venta era de una señora a quien ella le trabajaba, hasta que decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de queso en el mercado la Terminal de León.

Nos cuenta que en el negocio siempre le ha ido bien ya que la ubicación es muy buena y además ha logrado captar clientes. Por este motivo es que la señora Rosario trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese.

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es:
Rosa Perez, known as “Rosita”, dedicates herself to the sale of items such as oil, soap, detergent, brooms, shampoo, etc., from her grocery store located at the market in the city of León.

She has four children, for whom she has to provide an education, protection, and sustenance. She started her business at the market 12 years ago, with some borrowed funds obtained from a moneylender. Once she bought her first batch of products, she made a great effort to sell them and to find a way to repay her debt.

One of Rosa’s needs is to invest in the purchase of more products for her store, the reason why she has turned to Ceprodel for loan assistance. She currently has a favorable history of 13 loans, which she invests directly into her business, that have allowed her to continue supporting her home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Perez conocida comúnmente como rosita se dedica a vender productos de abarrotaría como aceite, jabón, pastes, detergentes, escobas, shampoo, etc.) en fin su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en la ciudad de León específicamente en el mercado la Terminal.

Posee cuatro hijos que tiene el deber de educar y brindar protección y alimentación. Su negocio da inicio desde hace 12 años en el mercado la Terminal de León, con un capital propio que lo obtuvo por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Una vez que compró los primeros productos, muy esforzadamente los comercializó y busco la manera de cómo salir de esta deuda hasta acabarla.

Una necesidad que posee la señora Rosa P. es que necesita invertir en la compra de los productos para la pulpería y por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos (Actualmente 13 créditos a su favor) que los invierte directamente en su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase grocery store merchandise.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Pineapples, oranges, mandarins, bananas, etc., are the products that Norma M. has sold with much effort over the past three years in the market in León. Prior to dedicating herself to this activity she was a housewife but, seeing how difficult it was to cover daily living expenses, she decided to invest a small amount of capital to purchase fruits to offer for sale.

We can’t ignore the fact that it is very beneficial to invest in the infrastructure of her business, which currently lacks a roof and walls. Instead, she uses a few pieces of lumber to support plastic to provide some shade as well as protection from rain.

Wisely, Mrs. M. has fulfilled loans with Ceprodel in order to supply her business with more products. Her biggest wish is to build her own stand so she can provide better service to her customers. Currently, she has a record of 18 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Piñas, naranjas , mandarinas, bananos, etc. son los productos que muy esforzadamente vende la señora Norma M. en el mercado la Terminal de León desde hace 3 años. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad su labor era desempeñarse como ama de casa, pero al contemplar que difícilmente cubría los gastos de su hogar decide invertir su poco capital en la compra de frutas para luego comercializarlas.

No podemos pasar por alto que le es de mucha utilidad invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio ya que actualmente no posee techo ni paredes, sino que utiliza algunos trozos de madera que sostienen plásticos para cubrirla del sol y de igual manera de la lluvia.

Muy sabiamente, la señora M. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio con mayores volúmenes de productos, su mayor anhelo es construir su propio tramo para brindar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes. Actualmente su record es de 18 creditos.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, and investment in business infrastructure.

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
Matilde G. is a hardworking lady who, from a very young age, has dedicated herself to the sale of all types of seafood. More specifically, she carries out her business in the market of the city of León. She began selling these types of products because, as a single mother supporting four children, she did not have a stable source of income.

With the experience she gained over time, her business grew stronger. Currently, she is located in the market -- a busy site visited by many people looking to make purchases.

Matilde has worked with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels very satisfied with the loans she has been granted for the purchase of her seafood. Her immediate need is to purchase more such product to offer for sale. She has a record of 12 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde G. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de mariscos de todo tipo vendidos en la ciudad de Leon específicamente en el mercado la terminal. Inicia con la venta de estos productos debido a que no percibía ingresos estables ya que es madre soltera y con la necesidad de mantener a sus 4 pequeños. Por esta razón es que comercializa estos productos.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, actualmente el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado la Terminal donde es muy visitado por muchas personas que llegan a realizar sus compras a este local.

Matilde trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados para la compra de sus mariscos. Su necesidad actual es la compra de los productos para su respectiva venta. Ella tiene un record de 12 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Martha del Socorro is a lady who, for the past 15 years, has dedicated herself to the sale of vegetables at the market in León, Nicaragua. From a young age, she has been known to be very hardworking as well as the caring mother of three children for whom she must provide healthcare, education, and a safe place to live.

She started her activities with a small sum received from spousal support, and has been able to bring about an improvement in her financial situation. Despite this, she still needs to invest in her business and has turned to Ceprodel for loan assistance (39 loans). These, she tells us, have greatly helped her in the purchase of her products as well as meeting her family's needs. Her immediate goal is to purchase more vegetables to sell, so she can continue caring for her three children and help them complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha del Socorro es una dama que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el sector del mercado la Terminal en León Nicaragua. Desde muy joven se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y además, es madre de tres pequeños que tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles salud, educación y un techo digno donde habitar.

Inició su actividad con un bajo monto obtenido por aporte de sus esposo, hoy en día, ha logrado mejorar su situación económica pero aun necesita invertir mas en su negocio y para esto ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel (39 créditos) y según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la adquisición de los productos y además en la manutención de su núcleo familiar. Su necesidad actual es la adquisición de las verduras para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar y permitir así que sus tres hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena R. is a married mother of two children for whose educations she is responsible. She is a hardworking woman, evidenced by the fact that she has 20 years' experience selling plastic items such as hair ties, bracelets, earrings, etc. More specifically, she conducts her business at the market in the city of León. She started her enterprise at a young age, using her own savings. Despite having been through difficult economic times, she has continued to support her home.

Maria Elena, despite the challenging financial situation that she is going through, has fulfilled loans in Ceprodel that have greatly benefited her by allowing her to slowly remodel her site at the market. In addition, she has been able to re-supply the products she offers for sale. She has a record of 6 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena R. es madre casada y con 2 hijos de los cuales tiene la obligación de mantener sus estudios por su corta edad. Es una mujer muy trabajadora por el hecho de que actualmente tiene 20 años de tener su venta de prendas de plásticos como colas, pulseras, aretes, etc. En la ciudad de León específicamente en el mercado la Terminal. Inició su negocio con ahorros propios que realizó desde su juventud, sin embargo ha pasado circunstancias difíciles en su situación económica pero siempre ha llevado el sustento a su hogar.

Hoy en día la señora Maria Elena a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa, ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel lo cual según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente ya que ha ido remodelando su tramo poco a poco y además ha surtido sus productos para su respectiva venta. Su record es de 6 creditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase bracelets and hair ties.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
I am Florentina Quirán. In my community I people know me as a very hardworking woman. I sell food everyday of the week. On Saturdays I make and sell tamales, fried pork skins, and also pork. On Sundays I sell atoles (beverages made from corn flour).

My dream is to get this loan so that I can have a place to put a small restaurant, buy stoves, kitchen utensils, chairs, tables, and everything I need in order to get this business going. Currently, my customers come to me often, saying to me “Doña Lola, we want to order several lunches from you.” It would be easier if I had a fixed location and a more modern kitchen, in order to improve my business and take better care of my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Florentina Quiràn, en mi comunidad me conocen por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, me dedico a la venta de comida durante toda la semana, y los fines de sábados elaboro y vendo tamales, chicharrones y también carne de marrano, los domingos vendo atoles. Mi deseo, es poder obtener este crédito para tener un local donde poner un comedor, comprar estufas, utensilios de cocina, sillas, mesas y todo lo necesario para poner en pie este negocio ya que el monto de capital para hacerlo es grande. Actualmente mis clientes me buscan mucho y me dicen doña Lola, queremos hacerle varios pedidos de almuerzos, pero sería más fácil para mí si tuviera un local fijo y una cocina más moderna, para mejorar mi negocio y atender mejor a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy stoves, chairs, tables, and utensils for a kitchen and small restaurant

loans.name: Erika Magali

texts.es:
I am Erika C.. I sell shoes and women’s clothing from catalogs. I am a single mother and my son is 6 years old. I have worked very hard to expand my business. When I began it, I sold my products by going door to door. As the years passed, I was able to rent a small store location near the San Raymundo park, near where I live.

Now that I have a store, I see my customer’s needs, which is why I need capital to bring them the variety of products that they request from me. I now sell not only women’s clothing, but also men’s and children’s clothing and also clothing for special occasions. I also sell phone cards. I now have a good number of people who order things from me. Because of this, I have had to hire two people in order to distribute the orders and tend to my store, since I have to go to the capital to buy.

Through much hard work, I have been able to buy the store that I used to rent. I want to continue investing in and improving my business so that I can give my son the opportunity to have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Erika C., me dedico a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y de ropa para damas. Soy madre soltera, mi hijo tiene 6 años de edad, me he esforzado mucho en poder ir incrementado mi negocio, ya que cuando inicie lo hacía ofreciendo mis productos de casa en casa, pero conforme han ido pasando los años pude alquilar un pequeño local cerca del parque de San Raymundo, donde vivo. Ya contando con un local vì las necesidades mis clientes por lo que necesito capital para poder llevar variedad de productos que los mismos clientes me piden, por eso ahora no únicamente vendo ropa para dama, sino también cara caballeros, para niños y para diferentes ocasiones especiales, también venta de tarjetas telefónicas, ya cuento con buen número de personas que me hacen pedidos, por tal motivo tuve que contratar la ayuda de dos personas para distribuir los pedidos y atender mi local, mientras yo tenga que viajar a la capital para comprar. Con mucho esfuerzo he logrado que el local que antes era alquilado, ahora sea propio, por lo que deseo seguir invirtiendo y mejorando mi negocio y dar oportunidad a que mi hijo tenga una buena educaciòn.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing for resale

loans.name: Sirenas (Grupo I) Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Las Sirenas (“The Mermaids”) is made up of a group of women who are very cheerful. The members of Las Sirenas meet every three weeks with a representative of Friendship Bridge, beneath an avocado tree, to protect themselves from the sun. The image really is touching because, despite the fact that they don’t have the necessary infrastructure, the ladies fulfill their obligations as best they can, and with a smile on their faces.

The clients that make up the group are from Cerro de Oro, an area in the Atitlán region where most of the habitants are Tzu’tujil Maya, and that is widely recognized for beautiful weavings. The eighteen members are successful weavers of huipiles (a type of decorated blouse), the traditional dress of Guatemala, belts, and skirts, among other types of clothing.

he success of these clients is reflected in the fact that more than half of them have one or more people weaving for them. One of the ladies has up to five people weaving for her during the periods of greatest demand. The other the ladies all work for themselves. Additionally, some of them have parallel businesses, such as the selling fish and crab in the market, raising animals, or a small grocery store.

These entrepreneurial achievements are impressive, given that previously these same ladies only worked as laborers for a fabric factory. Now you could say that many of them are the owners of their destinies. Due to the resounding success of their businesses and to the money generated, they are no longer exposed to the obstacles that life can present.

The clients will use their loan mostly to buy threads in different colors for making their weavings. They will also use it to buy products for their stores and animals to raise.

The ladies associate their happiness with the prosperity of their future generations. They dream of a better future for their children. In other words, they hope that their children will be able to eat what they themselves couldn’t and that they will finish high school, which they themselves were never able to attend. Others said they would like to build a house. One client made the others think when she said that she would like to buy a car for work and, why not, to drive around for fun in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El banco comunal Las Sirenas está conformado por un grupo de mujeres muy alegres. Las Sirenas se juntan cada tres semanas debajo de un árbol de aguacate durante sus reuniones, con la representante de Friendship Bridge, para que las proteja del sol. La imagen es realmente tierna, ya que, a pesar de que ellas no tienen la infraestructura necesaria, las señoras cumplen con sus compromisos de la mejor manera, con una sonrisa en la cara.

Las clientas que conforman el grupo provienen de Cerro de Oro, un área habitada mayormente por los Mayas Tzu´tujiles, donde el tejido es muy reconocido en la región de Atitlán por su belleza. Las diez y ocho integrantes son tejedoras exitosas de huipiles, traje tradicional de Guatemala, fajas, faldas entre otras prendas de ropa.

El éxito de estas clientas se refleja en que más de la mitad tienen una o más personas tejiendo para ellas. Una de las señoras tiene hasta cinco artesanas tejiendo para ella durante las épocas de mayor demanda. El resto de señoras trabajan para si mismas. Además, algunas clientas tienen un negocio paralelo como la venta de pescados y cangrejos en el mercado, crianza de animales y tienen una tienda de consumo diario.

Este logro empresarial es impresionante, debido a que antes estas mismas señoras solo trabajaban como mano de obra para una comercializadora de tejidos. Ahora se puede decir que muchas de ellas son las dueñas de sus destinos. Debido al éxito rotundo de sus negocios y al dinero generado, ellas ya no están tan expuestas a las trabas que le puede presentar la vida.

Las clientas van a utilizar su préstamo principalmente para comprar hilos de distintos colores para la elaboración de sus tejidos. También, lo van a utilizar para comprar productos para sus tiendas y animales para su respectiva crianza.

Las señoras asocian su felicidad con la prosperidad de sus futuras generaciones. Ellas sueñan con un futuro mejor para sus hijos. En otras palabras, que sus hijos puedan comer lo que ellas no pudieron y que terminen el colegio que ellas nunca pudieron asistir. Otras dijeron que les gustaría construir una casita. Mientras que una clienta despertó la conciencia del grupo al decir que a ella le gustaría comprar un carro para trabajar y porque no para pasear en sus ratos libres.

loans.use: To buy a variety of colored threads for making thier weavings; to buy products for thier stores; to buy livestock animals.

loans.name: Sirenas (Grupo Ii) Group

texts.es:
Every three weeks, if you’re passing through the town of Cerro de Oro, you can find the dedicated and driven women of the communal bank Las Sirenas (The Mermaids) gathered for their meeting. Just look for the avocado tree and you’ll find the eighteen women, shading themselves beneath the tree's protective branches, discussing their loans and supporting each other with helpful advice.

The women, though they have no building in which to meet, are determined to better their lives and those of their families. They do so through the art of their beautiful weavings, something their region in Atitlán is widely known for. The women are successful weavers, producing huipiles (intricately woven traditional blouses), skirts, belts, and other traditional clothing items.

Before becoming successful weavers, the majority of these women worked as laborers in a fabric factory. Now, however, they are their own factories, their own bosses, many employing as many as five people to help them meet their demand. To supplement their income as weavers, some of the women have additional businesses, selling fish and crab in the local markets, raising animals, and one woman has a small grocery store.

Ten women of Las Sirenas are asking for a loan of $4,000, with which they will purchase a variety of colorful threads used for weavings. Some of the women will also use part of their loans to invest in feed for their animals and to restock the inventory in their grocery store. The women, seated under the shade of the avocado tree, still reflect the sun in their hope for the future. They are determined to provide education for their children, giving them the future they’ve only dreamed of.

loans.use: To buy threads in a variety of colors, for making thier weavings; To buy products for thier small grocery stores; and to buy livestock animals.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
In my house I have a room that I use as a warehouse for my business. My business consists of the sale of sweets, toilet paper, groceries and other odds and ends. I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise so that I can have a greater variety of products and thus generate greater income. My parents, brothers and myself all depend on this business. I am asking for a loan of $1,200 to invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo en mi casa un cuarto que utilizo como bodega para mi negocio que es L. venta a mayoreo D. dulces, papel sanitario, abarrotes y algunas cosas más, me gustaría invertir en L. compra D. más mercancía para tener variedad D. productos y así obtener más ganancias, ya que D. este negocio vivimos mis papas, mis hermanos y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en L. compra D. mercancía para mi negocio

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business

loans.name: María Clemencia

texts.es:
María Clemencia began a freight service as an extra form of income since her principle way of earning money was through a grocery store. Over time, recommendations increased and demand for her freight services grew in greater numbers. This led her to decide to dedicate herself completely to this activity.

Nevertheless, the vehicle she uses to carry out her service currently needs repairs. As a result, María is soliciting a credit of US $375 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, María will be able to get the repairs and earn money to help with the housing and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.
