Maria Clemencia, inicio el servicio de fletes como un extra, ya que su principal giro era una tienda de abarrotes, con el paso del tiempo las recomendaciones aumentaron y los servicios de fletes fueron creciendo en un numero mayo, lo que la llevo a tomar la decisión de dedicarse solo a esa actividad, misma que a la fecha es la que ahora realiza.

Sin embargo actualmente el transporte en el que hace los fletes ya necesita un mantenimiento. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero María podrá darle el mantenimiento y así poder sacar dinero para ayudar con los gastos de la casa y de sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Repair vehicle.

loans.name: Lourdes Maria Mine

texts.es:
Lourdes is the mother of four children: one boy and three girls, of whom only one still lives at home because she is disabled. Lourdes is divorced and, in order to avoid being a burden for her other children, she began a business selling chicken. Little by little, her customer base has grown, and her treatment and knack with customers has helped build her list of clients. Today, she would like to expand her product selection and sell fruit, vegetables, and some groceries so she may improve her sales and quality of life.

As a result, Lourdes is soliciting a credit of US $925 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Lourdes will be able to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and build an inheritance for her daughter. With your help, Lourdes can help her daughter get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Lourdes, es madre de 4 hijos un varón y 3 hijas, de las cuales ya solamente le queda una , que tiene problemas de discapacidad, es divorciada, y para no ser una carga para sus otros hijos inicio el negocio de la venta de pollos, poco a poco su clientela ha crecido, su trato y algunas facilidades con ciertos clientes ha hecho crecer su clientela, hoy día quiere ampliar su giro y vender frutas, verduras y algunos abarrotes, para así mejorar sus ventas y calidad de vida.

Es por eso que Lourdes está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Lourdes podrá comprar más mercancía para incrementar sus ventas. Y así poder formar un patrimonio para su hija. Con tu ayuda Lourdes podrá sacar a su hija adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Alejandra began her business selling groceries from her house and, little by little, she stocked more items. At first, she only had sweets and now she has more products to sell. Thanks to this, she has more customers, who are in general children who buy candy.

“It is important that our customers always see that we are well stocked and that they do not have to look for another shop that is farther away from their home,” commented Alejandra. It is due to this that Alejandra is soliciting a credit of US $1,125 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Alejandra may move her business and family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 7 años que Alejandra comenzó con el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco le fue metiendo más cosas. En un inicio sólo tenía dulces y ahora ya tiene más productos que vender. Gracias a esto ya tiene más clientela que en general son niños los que más compran por las golosinas.

“Es importante que nuestros clientes siempre vean que esta bien surtido y que no tengan que ir a buscar a otras tienda que están mas lejos D. sus casas” comentó Alejandra. Es por eso que Alejandra está solicitando un crédito D. US $1,125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Alejandra podrá sacar adelante a su negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
When her 5 children were very young, their father abandoned them. This is why she had to care for all of them. With a lot of effort, she began her own business. On several occasions when her children were growing up, they helped her go to offer the products she had to her clients. The products that she offered most were electronics for the home.

Now all of Amparo's children are married. Nevertheless, she likes to be very independent, so she keeps working to earn money to pay her bills. Amparo is requesting a loan of $300, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, Amparo will be able to purchase more merchandise to keep selling and not have to depend on her children. With your help, Amparo will be able to progress her business and save for when she can no longer work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde que sus 5 hijos eran muy pequeños. El papá de ellos la dejó. Es por eso que ella se tuvo que hacer cargo de cada uno. Con mucho esfuerzo poco a poco comenzaba a tener su propio negocio. En varias ocasiones cuando sus hijos ya estaban creciendo, le ayudaban a ir a ofrecerle los productos que ella tenía a sus clientes. Los productos que más ofrecía eran electrónicos y para el hogar.

Actualmente todos los hijos de Amparo ya están casado. Sin embargo a ella le gusta ser muy independiente es por eso que continua trabajando para sacar dinero para sus gastos. Amparo está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Amparo podrá comprar más mercancía para poder seguir vendiendo y así no depender de sus hijos. Con tu ayuda Amparo podrá sacar su negocio adelante y poder ahorrar para cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Dalias (Grupo 1) Group

texts.es:
The ladies that make up the communal bank Las Dalias are an example for the world on the topic of respect. In this group we can find clients who speak Kachikel Maya, Tzu’tujil Maya, and Spanish. They are respectful of each other, and when one doesn’t understand the language of another, they continue in Spanish. The communication and organization of this group is also outstanding. They appear to be an organized and accomplished communal bank. This harmony has been achieved over a period of almost six years, during which they have solicited eleven loans.

These clients have also developed as businesswomen. Many of them are successful raisers of livestock. Most of them raise and sell pigs, cows, and chickens.

A considerable number of the group’s clients usually decide to buy one or two bulls, between four and six pigs, and twenty or forty chickens. For example, María C. is going use her loan to buy four pigs and twenty chickens. The ladies feel this is what is most advisable for them and that this is what is in highest demand in the market.

Las Dalias is a group that, through the years, has formed an unbeatable friendship. One lady commented that one of the many benefits of working in the methodology of communal banks is that all the participants know each other like family. Josefina C. commented that if one of the participants falls ill, the rest get foodstuffs together to take to the family of the sick person.

This communal bank is a good example of the success of micro credit and the methodology of communal banks because the members developed ties of friendship and have become successful entrepreneurs. Because of this we need to continue supporting them so that they can continue advancing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras que conforman el banco comunal Las Dalias son un ejemplo para el mundo en lo que respecta tolerancia. En este grupo podemos encontrar clientas que hablan Maya-Kachikel, Maya-Tzu´tujil y español. Las señoras se respetan mutuamente y cuando una no entiende la lengua de la otra proceden a hablar en español. La comunicación y organización de este grupo también es resaltante. Se ve un banco comunal ordenado y cumplido. Esta armonía se ha logrado a lo largo de casi seis años, en los cuales ellas han solicitado once préstamos.

Estas clientas también se han desarrollado empresarialmente, muchas de ellas son muy exitosas en lo que respecta crianza de animales. La gran mayoría trabaja criando y vendiendo marranos, vacas y pollos.

Una porción considerable de las clientas del grupo con su préstamo usualmente deciden comprar de uno a dos toros, de cuatro a seis marranos y de veinte a cuarenta pollos. Por ejemplo, María C. va a comprar con su préstamo dos toros, seis marranos más comida concentrado. Mientras que Marta L. va a comprar cuatro marranos y veinte pollos. Las señoras miran que es lo más conveniente para ellas y que es lo que se está demandando más en el mercado.

Las Dalias es un grupo que a lo largo de los años han formado una amistad inigualable. Una señora comentó que uno de los tantos beneficios de trabajar en la metodología de bancos comunales es que todas las integrantes se conocen como familia. Mientras que Josefina C. comentó que si una de las participantes se enferma, todas juntaban víveres para llevarlos a la casa de la enferma.

Este banco comunal es un buen ejemplo del éxito del microcrédito y la metodología de bancos comunales porque las integrantes desarrollaron lazos de amistad y encima se han vuelto empresarias exitosas. Es por eso que las tenemos que seguir apoyando para que sigan saliendo adelante.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed; to buy and sell clothing; to buy food products

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
When Gabriela got married, she hadn't yet finished her studies to become an accountant. This is why she started a grocery store in 2001 to earn extra money to pay her home's expenses. What her husband earns as an electrician isn't enough to pay their home's expenses or those of their son who was just born.

Gabriela now has more clients who come to her to buy merchandise. In addition, several neighbors come to her so she can do the accounting for their businesses, and she earns a little more money this way. Nevertheless, Gabriela hopes to grow her business, and this is why she is requesting a loan of $475, which she is willing to repay in 5 months. With this money, Gabriela will be able to buy more merchandise like fruits and vegetables to grow her business. With your help, Gabriela will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Cuando se casó Gabriela todavía no había terminado su carrera de Contador. Y fue por eso que en el 2001 comenzó con un negocio de abarrotes para poder sacar dinero extra para pagar los gastos de la casa. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo como electricista no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de su casa y tampoco los de su hijo que acaba de nacer.

Gabriela Actualmente ya cuenta con más clientes que la buscan para comprarle mercancía. Además de que les lleva la contabilidad a varios vecinos de sus negocio y con esto saca un poco más de dinero. Sin embargo Gabriela desea establecer más su negocio es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Y con este dinero Gabriela podrá comprar más mercancía como frutas y verduras para poder consolidar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Gabriela podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen is a woman who doesn't like not having anything to do. This is why she has a tamale stand in her house to keep herself busy. Additionally, with this business, she can earn money that she needs so much to be able to pay the expenses of her home.

Nevertheless, María hopes to increase the production of her tamales. This is why she is requesting a loan of $475 that she is willing to repay in 5 months. With this money, she will buy more merchandise like dough, meat, spices, and other items to make more tamales and increase her sales. With your help, María will be able to get ahead and pay her home's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María del Carmen es una mujer a la que no le gusta estar sin hacer nada. Es por eso que actualmente tiene un puesto de tamales en su casa para poder mantenerse ocupada. Además de que con este negocio puede adquirir dinero que tanto le hace falta para poder pagar los gastos de su casa.

Sin embargo María desea crecer su producción de tamales. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía como, masa, carne, especies, entre otras cosas para poder elaborar más tamales y así incrementar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir adelante para poder pagar los gastos de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Five years ago, Andrea started her business of selling rotisserie chicken and barbecue on Sundays. When her husband lost his job, she started selling rotisserie chicken in a small restaurant, and with her profits, she helped with her family's expenses. She later noticed that no one sold barbecue in her area, and with the goal of satisfying Sunday tradition, she bought a better assortment of meat, studied the process of making barbecue, and learned it. Now she sells rotisserie chicken during the week and barbecue on Sundays. Everyone in the area has tried her exquisite and delicious barbecue.

Nevertheless, this is the moment for Andrea's business to grow. This is why she is requesting a credit of $475, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. She will purchase a new large rotisserie, chairs and tables, and pots and pans for her kitchen so she can make her products more quickly and sell them in less time. With your help, Andrea will be able to progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Andrea empezó hace 5 años con el negocio de venta de pollos asados y Barbacoa los domingos, cuando su esposo se quedó sin empleo, comenzó con la venta de pollo asado en un asador pequeño y con las ganancias ayudaba al gasto familiar. Después se dio cuenta que nadie vendía barbacoa en su colonia con el fin de satisfacer esta tradición de los domingos, se surtió de carne e investigó el proceso para elaborar barbacoa y aprendió. Actualmente entre semana vende pollo asado y barbacoa los domingos, en su colonia todos han probado su exquisita y riquísima barbacoa.

Sin embargo es momento de que el negocio de Andrea crezca. Es por eso que actualmente está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, para comprar asador nuevo grande, comprar sillas y mesas, además de una batería de cocina, para así poder elaborar los productos más rápido y vender más en menos tiempo. Con tu ayuda Andrea podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and pots and pans for her kitchen

loans.name: Saraí

texts.es:
Three years ago, Saraí began to sell fruit in her parents' home because the money her husband earns isn't enough to pay their bills. Saraí decided to sell fruit in her parents' home because more people pass by it than her own house. Little by little, she made a name for herself, and now she is well-known in her area.

Nevertheless, on occasions, people ask Saraí for items that she doesn't have. This is why she is requesting a loan of $200, which she is willing to pay back in 3 months. With this money, Saraí will be able to buy more seasonal fruit so her clients don't go to her competition. She will also buy some shelves on which she will put her vegetables. This will enable her to help her husband with their home's expenses. With your help, Saraí will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 3 años que Saraí comenzó a vender frutas en la casa de sus papás yas que con lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa. Saraí decidió vender las frutas en casa de sus papás puesto que en esta el tránsito de gente es mayor que ne la de ella y su esposo. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer en el rumbo y actualmente ya es reconocida en su colonia.

Sin embargo en ocasiones le piden a Saraí cosas que ella no tiene. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Saraí podrá comprar más fruta de la temporada para que sus clientes no se vayan con la competencia además de comprar unos estantes para poder poner la verdura y así poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Con tu ayuda Saraí podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy shelves

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juana Guadalupe is a single mother of three small children, whom she hopes to always give the best. Unfortunately, Juana didn't have enough resources to be able to have a location for her business, so she began to sell shoes by catalog, and little by little, she acquired clients. Now she makes sales demonstrations every week. Nevertheless, Juana hopes to grow her business.

This is why she is requesting a credit of $475, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, Juana will be able to buy some display cabinets to make a small store in her home, so her clients can locate her easily. With your help, Juana will be able to make her dream a reality and at the same time help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana Guadalupe es madre soltera D. tres pequeños. A quienes elL. desea darles siempre lo mejor. Desgraciadamente Juana no contaba con recursos suficientes como para poder un local. Fue por eso que comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo y así poco a poco se fue haciendo D. clientes. Actualmente hace demostraciones D. productos cada semana. Sin embargo Juana desea consolidar más su negocio.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito D. US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Juana podrá comprar unos aparadores para poder hacer un local pequeño en su casa y así sus clientas L. puedan localizar fácilmente. Con tu ayuda Juana podrá hacer su sueño realidad. Y al mismo tiempo ayudar a que sus hijos salgan adelante.

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago, Julia was expecting her son. Since she is a single mother, she decided to start her own business to be able to support him. With the help of a family member, she started with very little merchandise, and little by little began to grow and sell more products. Now that her son is 15-years-old, Julia hopes that he will continue his education, but these costs are more and more every day.

Julia is requesting a credit of $475 that she is willing to pay back in 5 months. With this money, Julia will be able to buy a copy machine, office supplies, and grocery merchandise to be able to offer more variety to her clients. With your help, Julia will be able to help her son get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 15 años que Julia esperaba a su hijo. Debido a que Julia es madre soltera decidió comenzar su propio negocio para poder pagar los gastos del mismo. Con la ayuda de un familiar comenzó con muy poca mercancía y poco a poco fue creciendo y vendiendo más productos. Ahora que su hijo tiene 15 años, Julia desea que continúe estudiando, sin embargo los gastos cada día se hacen mayores.

Julia está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Julia podrá comprar una copiadora, material de papelería y mercancía de abarrotes para así poderle brindar más variedad a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Julia podrá sacar a su hijo adelante.

loans.use: To buy office supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
For 4 years, Fernando has been unemployed. Since he could not find any work, he started to sell the tools he owned and saw that people were buying them. He saved money to buy a van and then, he went from house to house to buy merchandise off them and resell the goods at the marketplace. Little by little, Fernando started to become familiar with this business.

However, the van that is used to move his merchandise does not serve its purpose well because it's an old vehicle. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $475 which will be paid back in installments over 6 months. This loan will be used to repair his van as well as buy merchandise for resale. And with this money, he will be able to pay for his two children's education. With your help, Fernando will be able to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Hace 4 años que Fernando quedó desempleado, y al no encontrar trabajo comenzó a vender las herramientas que tenía, al ver que la gente le compraba la mercancía. Ahorró un poco para poder comprar una camioneta y así poder pasar por las casas para comprarles mercancía y revenderlas en un mercado. Poco a poco el señor se está dando a conocer en este negocio.

Sin embargo la camioneta que lo mueve para buscar sus productos ya no sirve puesto que es antigua. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero podrá reparar su camioneta, además de poder seguir comprando mercancía para la reventa. Y así con este dinero podrá pagar los estudios de sus dos hijos que están estudiando. Con tu ayuda la familia de Felipe podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: repair his van and buy merchandise

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús has been devoted to selling steamed tacos for more than 19 years. Given that his parents did the same thing, he knew some things about tacos and how to make them since a young age. After he separated from his wife and was left to take care of three children, this is how he started this business to keep his family going and to provide for his three children. In the beginning, he sold tacos outside his home. But now, he has an eatery where more people can come to buy his food.

However, Jesús thinks that the place needs a better look. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of $925 which will be paid back in installments over 6 months. With this loan, Jesús will be able to buy tables, chairs for the customers who sit to eat more comfortably. With your help, Jesús will be able to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Jesús se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de tacos al vapor hace más de 19 años. Puesto que sus padres se dedican a lo mismo y desde pequeño ha conocido los trucos para prepararlos. Después de que se separó y quedó a cargo de sus tres hijos. Fue cuando comenzó a luchar más por sacar adelante este negocio para poder brindarles estudio a los tres. En un inicio vendía los tacos fuera de su casa. Pero ahora está en un local en donde hay más gente que le pueda comprar.

Sin embargo Jesús considera que a el local le hace falta una mejor vista. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está seguro los podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Jesús podrá comprar mesas, sillas para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos. Con tu ayuda Jesús podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen separated from her husband and was left to take care of 4 children. To support them, she worked as a chef in a restaurant that made tacos and gorditas ( like a taco, but with thicker shell). This is where she learned to make these dishes. While she worked at the restaurant during the day, in the evenings and weekends, she sold these dishes from her home. All of this was done to support her 4 children. Fortunately, all of her children have turned out well: two of them are already married and the other two are single but have jobs. Maria has been running her gordita business full-time for three years since she no longer works at the restaurant and one of her daughters-in-law help her.

However, the business is located outside of their home. When it is cold, they do not have any means to cover their food stand. Maria is requesting a loan of $325 will be paid back in installments over 6 months. This loan will be used to place a wall or covering of some sort, so she and her customers will not be cold in this weather. With your help, Maria will be able to continue her business for her well-being especially with no further responsibility of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

María del Carmen se separó de su esposo, quedando ella a cargo de sus cuatro hijos. Y para mantenerlos trabajó como cocinera en un restaurante en dónde hacía gorditas y tacos. Ahí fue donde aprendió a elaborar este tipo de productos. Y mientras trabajaba en el día en el restaurante por las noches y los fines de semana vendía en su casa. Para poder sacar dinero para pagar los gastos de sus cuatro hijos. Afortunadamente todos sus hijos lograron salir adelante, dos de ellos ya están casados y los otros dos solteros pero cada quien trabaja. Hace tres años que María comenzó el negocio de venta de gorditas de tiempo completo, puesto que ya no trabaja en el restaurante, y una de sus nueras le ayuda con el local.

Sin embargo el negocio se encuentra fuera de su casa. Es por eso que en el tiempo de frío no tiene con que taparse. María está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está segura lo podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá ponerle unas paredes para que ellas y sus clientes no pasen frío en esta temporada. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante su negocio para poder sentirse bien de que a trabajado para salir adelante y no ser una carga para sus hijos.

loans.use: to place walls or covering over her food stand

loans.name: Airam Guadalupe

texts.es:
Airam Guadalupe has been operating a beauty salon for 3 years. She started after she completed a beauty course because the salary her husband was earning as a construction worker was not sufficient to meet their living expenses and provide for their two sons, ages 7 and 4. She wishes that they attend college so they can have a better future than she. After gathering a bit of her savings, she was able to start her business.

However, Airam believes it is important to remodel her salon and buy some tools since the tools that she has are not enough for haircutting. For this reason, Airam is requesting a loan of $475 which will be paid off in the course of 6 months. This money will be used to buy furniture, paint her store, and buy tools to provide better service to her customers. With your help, Airam will be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Airam Guadalupe tiene una estética desde hace 3 años. Comenzó con ella después de que terminó un curso de belleza ya que con lo que gana su esposo como obrero no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos de 7 y 4 años a quienes tiene estudiando y desea que puedan terminar una carrera universitaria para que ellos puedan tener un mejor futuro que el de ella. Y con unos pocos ahorros logró poner su local.

Sin embargo Airam considera que es momento de remodelar su local y comprar utensilios necesarios puesto que con los que tiene ya no es suficiente para poder cortar el pelo. Es por eso que Airam está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Airam podrá comprar muebles, pintar su local y comprar utensilios para poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Airam podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi

texts.id:
As a Balinese woman, especially the one who is Hindu, Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi is expert in producing Hindu prayer materials. She uses the skill to earn money that help her husband, I Putu Ariyasa, in supporting their daily necessity. With Rp 500.000,- as her initial investment, Ni Luh Ratnadi purchases raw materials such as young coconut leaves and various flowers to be bunched into Hindu prayer materials. Ratnadi also acts as buyer of Hindu prayer materials from other producer around her home and sell them to the customers in the market. She is able to earn Rp 50.000,- income a day which is used to support her family living and to support their two children, one is a kindergarten student, and the other one is a two years old toddler. With the loan Ratnadi wishes to earn from Dinari, she plans to increase her capital, either to purchase raw materials or finished Hindu prayer materials products.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai wanita Bali, khususnya beragama Hindu, membuat Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi pandai dalam membuat berbagai macam sarana persembahyangan untuk umat Hindu. Keterampilannya ini ditekuninya untuk menghasilkan uang dan bisa membantu suaminya, I Putu Ariyasa, dalam memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.00,- Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi membeli bahan-bahan untuk sarana tersebut seperti daun kelapa muda dan aneka jenis bunga untuk membuat sarana sesaji. Ratnadi juga sebagai pembeli, yang setiap hari mengambil sarana persembahyangan yang sudah jadi dari para tetangganya kemudian di jual kembali kepada langganan Ratnadi di Pasar. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk kebutuhan 2 anaknya. Yang paling besar masih TK dan adiknya baru berumur 2 tahun. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Ratnadi akan mempergunakannya untuk menambah modal usaha baik untuk membeli bahan baku atau untuk membeli sarana persembahyangan yang sudah jadi.

loans.use: To increase business capital so that be able to purchase more raw materials and finished Hindu prayer materials products from other producers and sell it to the consumer

loans.name: Elva Alicia

texts.es:
Elva Alicia has been running a convenience store for 3 years. She started this business because the salary her husband was earning as a newspaper deliverer was insufficient to meet their living expenses and provide for their 6 year old daughter. Moreover, they just bought their own home and needed to make payments. The convenience store is located in their house; they have increased the amount of items they sell at the store but it is not enough.

For this reason, Elva Alicia requests a loan of $325 which will be paid off in installments over the course of 6 months. This loan will be used to buy merchandise so they can have more variety of items for sale in their store. With your help, Elva will be able to help her husband pay for the house and provide for their little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Elva Alicia tiene desde hace 3 años un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este negocio lo comenzó puesto que lo que gana su esposo como repartidor de periódicos no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos que genera su pequeña hija de 6 años. Además de que acaban de sacar su propia casa y necesitan para pagarla. El negocio de abarrotes lo tienen en su casa y poco a poco han ido incrementando la mercancía sin embargo no es suficiente.

Es por eso que Elva Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elva podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su tienda. Con tu ayuda Elva podrá ayudarle a su esposo a pagar la casa y a pagar los gastos de su pequeña para poder dejarle un patrimonio a su hija.

loans.use: Comprar más mercancía

loans.name: Ni Ketut Narti

texts.id:
Ketut Narti is a hardworking housewife. She works to help her husband, Nengah Nandra who is a labor. Narti runs a small stand in front of her house with Rp 1.000.000,- for the initial investment. Narti sells various traditional cakes that cooked by her or bought from the market. The business has been running quite long, i.e. since she got married. Narti is not only selling in front of the house, but sometimes when there is a special occasion in village government office, like meeting or other event, she moves to sell near the event is held, for there are many people there, that Narti wish what she sells could be sold faster. She earns Rp.50.000,- as income, and use it to pay her two children tuition fee. Narti hopes that the loan she wishes to earn from Dinari could help her to increase the capital of her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketut Narti seorang ibu rumah tangga yang rajin bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya, Nengah Nandra, yang bekerja sebagai buruh. Narti membuka warung yang kecil dan sangat sederhana di depan rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Narti melengkapi warungnya dengan beraneka ragam jajanan tradisional baik yang dibuat sendiri maupun yang dibelinya dari pasar. Usaha ini sudah dijalankan sejak lama, sejak menikah dengan suaminya.Tetapi Narti tidakhanya berjualan di rumah saja, terkadang jika ada kegiatan di kantor desa seperti rapat dan juga kegiatan yang lainnya maka Narti akan berpindah tempat berjualan yaitu disekitar balai Desa karena banyak orang yang datang kesana, dengan harapan barang dagangannya cepat habis terjual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perhari bisa mencapai Rp.50.000,-Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membiayai kedua anaknya yang masih sekolah. Narti berharap pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari diharapkan dapat menambah modal usahanya.

loans.use: To increase business capital to renovate the stand and add offer more products to be sold

loans.name: Thi Men

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mến, 28 years old, is married with two school age children. She and her husband both are carpenters. Their income is about 4USD a day. They have never had a loan with anyone and this is their first time. Having a loan with Binh Minh is convenient for them because they don’t have to travel far to get and pay money.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mến, 28 tuổi, có 2 con còn đang đi học. Hai vợ chồng đều làm nghề mộc. Thu nhập hàng ngày của hai vợ chồng từ 50000-70000đ. Nói chung cuộc sống hơi vất vả, tuy vậy hai vợ chồng chưa đi vay vốn ở đâu cả. Nay, anh chị mạnh dạn vay 2006000đ của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì thủ tục thuận tiện, anh chị lại không phải đi xa để nhận và trả tiền.

loans.use: Expand the wood shop

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
A friend of Brenda Elizabeth invited her to help sell toys at the marketplace and Brenda jumped at the offer. This is how she learned the vitals skills needed to manage a store in the marketplace. She decided to open her own business. She put some money together and bought a bulk of used clothing and started her business with these items. Brenda has been able to help her husband with living expenses and to provide for her young 2 year old daughter.

However, Brenda thinks it is imperative to buy new bulk of used clothing and products to have more variety of items, which in turn will attract more customers. Brenda is requesting a loan of $600 which will be paid off in installments over the course of 6 months. With this loan, Brenda will be able to buy the necessary merchandise. Brenda will be able to support her family with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Una amiga de Brenda Elizabeth la invitó a que le ayudara a vender juguetes en un mercado y a Brenda le gustó mucho el oficio. Fue así como aprendió lo necesario para poder mantener un local en un mercado. Y decidió abrir su propio local. Juntó un poco de dinero y compró una paca de ropa usada y con esto comenzó. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando otro tipo de productos hasta los que ofrece hoy. Gracias a este negocio Brenda ha podido ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de su pequeña de 2 años.

Sin embargo Brenda considera que es necesario comprar una nueva paca de ropa y productos para poder tener más variedad en sus productos y así tener más clientes. Brenda está solicitando un crédito de US $600 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Brenda podrá comprar la mercancía necesaria. Con tu ayuda Brenda logrará sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: to buy package of clothing and toys

loans.name: Ni Komang Dwi Astuti

texts.id:
Living with parents in law did not allow Komang Dwi Astuti to be relax and did nothing. With the skill she had, Dwi opened a tailor that provides clothes sewing service. The business was initiated by her mother in law. Dwi is able to sew and produce various clothes such as kebaya, uniform, etc. Dwi sews everyday from early in the morning until afternoon, and sometimes she should work until late in the night when she gets more orders. It usually happens before school holidays ends or before the Hindu festivals. At fist Dwi was only a helper to her mother in law to sew, but now she has many customers. She invested Rp 1.000.000 to buy a sewing machine to help her working faster. She earns Rp.50.000,- as income, and use it to support her family living, for they have had a 6 moths old baby. Dwi’s husband, I Putu Wiartika who works as a construction worker, is very supportive to her in running the business. With the loan that she wish to get from Dinari, Dwi hopes to be able to develop her business into a bigger one, and to have more workers so that able to receive more orders.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Tinggal menumpang di rumah mertua membuat Komang Dwi Astuti tidak bisa hanya tinggal diam dan berpangku tangan saja, dengan ketrampilan yang dimilikinya Dwi membuka usaha menjahit baju yang awalnya usaha ini dirintis oleh mertunya. Bermacam-macam baju bisa dijahitnya seperti kebaya, baju seragam sekolah dan lain-lain. Dwi mulai menjahit dari pagi sampai sore hari, kalau orderannya banyak Dwi bisa lembur sampai malam hari. Biasanya hal ini terjadi pada saat akan memasuki tahun ajaran sekolah yang baru atau menjelang hari raya. Awalnya hanya sekedar membantu mertuanya tetapi sekarang berkembang karena pelangganya semakin banyak. Jadi dengan modal awal Rp 1.000.000 Dwi membeli mesin jahit agar pekerjaanya bisa lebih cepat selesai. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya karena Dwi sudah punya anak yang baru berumur 6 bulan. Suaminya, I Putu Wiartika, yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan sangat mendukung pekerjaan istrinya. Harapan Dwi dari pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari bisa mengembangkan usahanya menjadi lebih besar lagi dan memiliki keinginan untuk menambah jumlah tenaga kerja dan bisa menerima orderan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine to enable receiving more orders and having more workers

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hằng, 32 years old, is married with 3 school age children. She has a general stand at the market and also tends her vegetable garden. Her husband is a laborer. Their income is about 6USD a day. They have never taken out loan from anyone. They will use funds from their first loan of 150USD with Binh Minh to increase production of her vegetable garden to get ready for the Tết.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hằng, 32 tuổi, có 3 con còn đang đi học. Công việc tạo thu nhập chính của chị là làm nghề đi chợ bán hàng tạp hoá. Bên cạnh đó, chị còn trồng rau để tăng thu nhập. Chồng chị làm công nhân. Thu nhập trung bình hai vợ chồng là 100000đ/ngày. Anh chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay anh chị tham gia Chương trình tài chính vi mô vì thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần lại không phải thế chấp. Với số tiền 2006000đ vay được, anh chị sẽ trồng hoa màu để bán, đặc biệt phục vụ cho dịp Tết năm nay.

loans.use: Increase production of the vegetable garden

loans.name: Ni Putu Suwitri

texts.id:
Putu Suwitri is a hardworking housewife; she works to help her husband, Kade Wiriyana, who is only a field hand. Suwitri provides materials needed for Hindu prayers. In running the business, Suwitri has never joined formal course. She learned it by herself because preparing material for praying is a routine daily home activity. It began when Suwitri was still young, she saw her parents prepared praying materials and started learning to prepare it by herself that finally it could be an income source for her family. Suwitri started her business with Rp.500.000,- as the initial capital. During Hindu holydays, Suwitri got more orders that bring her higher income. She earns Rp 50.000,- a day and uses it to pay her children tuition fee. Her children are studying in grade VI and I of elementary school. Suwitri built their own semi-permanent house on her parents’ land. She wish to improve her business by increasing the capital so that she would be able to pool Hindu prayer materials products in her village and sell it.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Putu Suwitri seorang ibu rumah tangga yang rajin bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya, Kade Wiriyana, yang hanya sebagai buruh tani. Suwitri membuat sarana persembahyangan untuk umat Hindu. Dalam menjalankan usaha ini Suwitri tidak pernah mengikuti kursus secara formal semua ini didapat secara otodidak karena semuanya ini rutin dilakukan setiap hari dirumahnya.Awalnya ketika masih muda Suwitri hanya melihat saja dari orang tuanya, lama-lama semuanya bisa dikerjakan sendiri dan akhirnya bisa mendatangkan pendapatan bagi keluarganya. Dengan modal awal Rp.500.000,- Kalau hari raya umat Hindu tiba, maka jumlah pesananya semakin banyak sehingga keuntungnya pun semakin besar. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari . Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya dan juga pendidikan kedua anaknya yang duduk di kelas 6 SD dan kelas 1 SD. Rumahnya dibangun sendiri ditanah orangtua dengan bangunan semi permanen. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Suwitri akan menambah modal usahanya dan Suwitri akan menjadi pengepul di desanya.

loans.use: To increase business capital so that be able to be a buyer of Hindu prayer materials from other producers and sell it to the consumer

loans.name: Thi Sau

texts.vi:
Mrs. Sáu, 45 years old, singled with two children. One is working, the other is still in school. The whole family’s income is about 4USD a day. Not much for their hard work but there are always laughter in their small house. She has tried hard to bring education to her children. She used to borrow money from her siblings. All debts were paid off. She would like to apply for a loan with Binh Minh. The weekly repayments are convenient for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Sáu, 45 tuổi, không có chồng và có 2 con, 1 đã đi làm còn 1 thì còn đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của cả gia đình là 50000-70000đ/ngày. Dù cuộc sống còn vất vả nhưng trong căn nhà nhỏ bé luôn đầy ắp tiếng cười. Cô cố gắng vay mượn anh em để có tiền cho con ăn học, nay đã trả hết. Cô thích vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì hình thức trả góp hàng tuần rất thuận tiện.

loans.use: Nuôi lợn

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.id:
Rearing pigs appear to be a common activity performed by mothers living in Sumbersari village. But because limited availability of funding, such activity were not carried out well, until the emergent of the idea of forming pig rearing groups with the hope that being together in a group thus able to have the opportunity to expend activity funding from parties are interested with the existence of small business. The name “Pigy Lestari” (Eternal Pigy) was finally selected as the name of the group with 11 members, with Ni Komang Ratiani as the leader. After the group Pigy Lestari was formed the members submit a start-up loan application with DINARI, whether for capital funding or veterinary assistance. From each funding they attained, will be used to purchase piglets, mother pig and also feed and supplies. Income from the sale varies depending on market situation. Gain is usually greater during religious celebrations because demand for pork is high thus increasing the price of pork. From 1 piglet alone, the net gain is approximately Rp 400.000, - after rearing for 6 months. Each gain will be use to supplement the families financial needs. All members of the Pigy Lestari group hope the start-up funding from DINARI will further advance their business also able to develop.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Memelihara ternak babi merupakan hal yang biasa dilakukan oleh ibu-ibu yang tinggal di dusun Sumbersari. Tetapi karena keterbatasan modal, usaha yang mereka tekuni ini tidak bisa berjalan dengan baik, sehingga munculah ide untuk membentuk kelompok peternak babi dengan harapan bahwa setelah tergabung dalam sebuah kelompok maka mereka akan memiliki peluang untuk mengusahakan modal usaha dari pihak lain yang peduli dengan keberadaan usaha kecil. Nama “Pigy Lestari” akhirnya dipilih sebagai nama kelompok mereka dengan jumlah anggota seluruhnya 11 orang,yang diketuai oleh Ni Komang Ratiani. Setelah kelompok Pigy Lestari ini terbentuk maka mereka mengajukan permohonan pembinaan kepada DINARI baik itu dalam permodalan maupun pendampingan oleh dokter hewan. Dari setiap modal yang mereka peroleh, itu dipakai untuk membeli bibit penggemukan, penginduk dan juga stok pakan untuk ternak mereka. Hasil penjualan yang biasa mereka peroleh cukup bervariasi berdasarkan situasi pasar. Keuntungan tertinggi bisa mereka peroleh menjelang hari-hari besar agama karena biasanya kebutuhan akan daging babi cukup banyak sehingga hargapun juga meningkat. Dari satu ekor penggemukan saja keuntungan bersih yang bisa diperoleh sekitar Rp 400.000,- setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan. Dari setiap keuntungan yang diperoleh ini mereka pergunakan untuk membantu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Semua anggota kelompok Pigy Lestari berharap pembinaan yang mereka peroleh dari DINARI bisa berlanjut terus sehingga usaha mereka juga bisa berkembang.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, mother and feed supplies (Membeli bibit penginduk dan pakan)

loans.name: Mir Sayaad

texts.en: Mir Sayaad lives with his own individual family (i.e., not in an extended family) in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He is a man with 10 years' experience in his business. He has a retail shop with good numbers of customers. He wants to expand his shop so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his inventory of everyday necessities and make good income to support his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his inventory of everyday necessities

loans.name: Thi Nguyet

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyet, 48 years old, has 3 children, one of which lives separately, one is working and the last one is going to school. Being active, beside collecting waste metal as her main activity, she does fish-monger and breeds chicken. However, her average income is only 50,000-70,000 VND/day (3.125 – 4.375 USD/day). She used to borrow money from other agencies and already repay. She prefers the Binh Minh Microeconomic Program because she can repay weekly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Nguyệt, 48 tuổi, có 3 con, 1 đã ra ở riêng, 1 đã đi làm còn 1 thì còn đang đi học. Là một người phụ nữ năng động, ngoài công việc chính của cô là làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn, cô còn bán cá và chăn nuôi gà. Tuy vậy, thu nhập trung bình của gia đình cô chỉ từ 50000-70000đ/ngày. Cô đã đi vay ở nhiều nơi khác, nhưng giờ đã trả hết. Cô thích vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminhcdc hơn vì thích được thức trả góp hàng tuần.

loans.use: collecting waste metal, breed chickens, fish-monger

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
A. Mahbuba is a 36-year-old mother of three children. 

Mahbuba's husband is a secondary school teacher, earning most of the family's income. In addition, Mahbuba earns money selling the national bread called “lepeshka” at the local market. The business has been quite stable so far, and has allowed Mahbuba to improve the family's living conditions. 

Mahbuba is asking for a loan of US$ 400 to be repayed in 6 months. She plans to purchase flour and the national bread “lepeshka” for sale. This is the first time that Mahbuba is taking out a loan. She promises to pay it back in time and is thankful for support.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and the national bread “lepeshka” for sale

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en: Yanti, 25, mother of 2 children, has a little poultry business. Every day she sells her chickens at the market and earns $15 a day. Her husband, U., is a rock coolie who earns very little income. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her poultry business

loans.name: Mir Abass

texts.en: Mir Abass lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of one son. He has a retail shop and he started this business 4 years ago. During this time he has attracted a lot of customers. Now he need to complete his stock so he has requested an individual loan to buy extra goods like shampoos, baskets, sweets, and chocolates. He is determined to work hard and make good income to help his family and to be able to enroll his son in a better school in Kabul. He is happy that he is able to request a small loan.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory like shampoos, baskets, sweets, chocolates

loans.name: Thi Ngat

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngat, 32 years old, has 2 children that are going to school. Every day, she sells clothes at Cho market. Besides, she is breeding approximately 10 pigs at home. Her income is 100,000 VND/day (6.25 USD/day). She used to loan money and already repay all. She likes the Binh Minh Microeconomic Program because she can borrow money for a long time and does not have to put any properties in pledge.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngát, 32 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Hàng ngày, chị bán quần áo tại chợ Chờ. Bên cạnh đó, chị còn có 1 đàn lợn nái hơn chục con nuôi thêm tại nhà. Thu nhập hàng ngày của gia đình chị là 100000đ. Chị đã từng vay ở ngoài và đã trả hết. Chị thích vay ở Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminhcdc hơn vì được vay lâu dài và không phải thế chất.

loans.use: general clothing stores

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Minh, 41 years old, has two school age children. She has a general stand at the market in Chờ for many years. Everyone knows her at her stand. The daily income is about 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more goods for her stand. She likes the weekly repayment schedule that she can fulfill easily. Currently, she has a educational loan for her children.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Minh, 41 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Cô bán hàng tạp hoá tại Chợ Chờ nhiều năm nay, nên có rất nhiều khách quen. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cố là 100000đ/ngày. Cô mong muốn vay vốn để mua thêm hàng. Hiện gia đình cô đang vay vốn của Ngân hàng chính sách xã hội theo diện học sinh sinh viên nghèo cho con cô đi học. Cô thích vay vốn ở Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc hơn vì được trả góp hàng tuần và lâu dài.

loans.use: bán hàng tạp hoá

loans.name: Dilbarjon

texts.en:
B. Dilbarjon is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. 

For the past 15 years, Dilbarjon has been selling bread in the local market. She mainly sells white and brown bread as well as rye rolls. The business is rather stable and allows Dilbarjon to improve the living conditions of her family.

Currently, Dilbarjon is asking for a loan of US$600 for a term of 6 months in order to be able to purchase flour and bread for sale. Dilbarjom has borrowed from IMON in the past and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchase of  flour and bread for sale

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
G. Mukaddas is 37 years old. She is married and has two children.

About ten years ago, the financial situation of Muhaddas's family forced her to start her own business. She decided to sell the fabrics used for making the national dresses. With time, the financial position of the family improved due to the profit generated by Mukaddas’s business as well as because her husband went to work in Russia, sending considerable amounts of his earnings back to Tajikistan each month. Nevertheless, Mukaddas made the decision to continue her business and is now trying to diversify the range of goods she sells, in order to be able to respond to the interests of clients with very diverse tastes and levels of income. Typically, she purchases the fabrics from wholesale markets and from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan.

Currently, Mukaddas is asking for a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 4 months in order to purchase more fabrics for sale. Having showed herself as a reliable client of the loan organization, Mukaddas will also pay back the current loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.en:
K. Abdulkosim is 25 years old and married. In spite of the fact that Abdulkosim does not have children yet, he is responsible for supporting a large family, consisting of six people, including his parents, younger brothers and sisters.

To earn a living, Abdulkosim sells confectionery and has been in this business for already five years. In addition, he raises cattle - currently, he owns a cow and a calf. These two businesses generate most of the income of Abdulkosim's family. 

Already popular in the neighborhood for selling the fresh and tasty pastries, Abdulkosim, nevertheless, would like to increase the range of the goods on his offer. Therefore, Abdulkosim is asking for a loan of US$600 for a term of 12 months in order to be able to purchase more confectionery for sale, as well as to buy fodder for the cattle.

loans.use: Purchase of confectionary for sale and of fodder for cattle

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
I. Shukufa, 46, resides in the village of Mammedabad, which is in the southeastern Saatli region of Azerbaijan. Along with her husband (who is pictured), she has bred cows for 15 years.

I. wants to grow her business in order to support her three children. She hopes to obtain a $1,000 loan to purchase more cows to breed and raise. She then sells them to farmers or butcher shops; most farmers in Azerbaijan own at least one or two cows, and beef is major part of the Azerbaijan diet.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Humay

texts.en:
In the picture, you'll see M. Humay's daughter. M., 56, worries about her future—and those of her four other children. In her village of Soltanabad, which is the southeast Saatli region of Azerbaijan, businesses are often passed down from generation to generation.

M.'s business is raising cattle to sell to farmers and butcher shops. She hopes to purchase more cows to breed, but doesn't have to money to do so. With a $500 loan, she will be able to build up her livestock so she can grow her business and help secure her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en:
K. Ahmadjon is 32 years old, married, and has a child. His wife works as an oculist.

Since he was 18, Ahmadjon has been selling foodstuffs like tea, food for infants, soft drinks and sweets from a stand in one of the local markets. The business is rather stable and generates the main income for the family. Also Ahmadjon's mother helps her son in the sales business.

Currently, Ahmadjon needs a loan of US$1,000 for a 6-month term. He is going to spend the loan to purchase a variety of foodstuffs for sale. Ahmadjon has taken out several loans from IMON in the past, and managed to successfully pay them back. He is thankful to everyone for support and promises to repay the current loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Eyzan

texts.en:
For nearly two decades, Ezyan S., a 51-year-old mother and wife, has raised cattle. In her village of Soltanabad, which is the southeast area of Azerbajian, breeding cattle is one of the only sources of income.

Ezyan has applied to Normicro Bank for a $600 loan to purchase a few more cows. She and her husband (who is pictured) hope to grow a business that they can pass down to their five children.

loans.use: To buy new calves

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
K. Zamira is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Zamira sells bread and rolls in the local market and has been in this business already for 13 years. Zamira's sales stand is located in a very busy place of the market, and both the buyers and the sellers of the market are Zamira's customers. As a result, the business provides a significant share of the family's income. 

Currently, Zamira needs a loan of US$800 for a 6-month term. With the borrowed money, she plans to purchase baked goods like bread and rolls for sale. Having proved herself as a reliable client of the loan organization, Zamira promises to pay the loan back in time and is thankful to everyone for support.

loans.use: Purchase of baked goods for sale

loans.name: Baqi

texts.en: Baqi lives with his own family (i.e., not in an extended family) in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and an educated  man who has a small business selling wood. He started this business one year ago. He works hard to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a better income to help his family and expand his business. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Juhairiyah

texts.id:
Juhairiyah previously runs a business selling sweet salad. She changed to the recyling business since 2000. This activity comprises from the phase of seeking used products; sort used products acquired; and the final phase to drop the used products with collection centers. Medium of transportation used are push cart and sacks. In a week, she generates earnings of Rp 400.000,00 (USD43). Loan she received will be used to increase funding – to purchase used products that she cannot find from rubbish dumps or by the roadside. However, she gets from homes and stores. Juhariyah’s husband is also in the similar field of business with earnings of Rp 250.000, (USD27)/week. Although they do not have dependent children, however they are planning for their future.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Juhairiyah pada mulanya menekuni usaha jualan Rujak Manis. Dia beralih usaha menjadi pemulung sejak tahun 2000. Kegiatan usaha ini terdiri dari tahap mencari barang – barang bekas; Menyeleksi barang – barang bekas yang diperoleh; Dan tahap yang terakhir menyetorkan barang – barang bekas tersebut ke Pengepul. Sarana yang digunakan berupa gerobak dorong dan karung. Dalam seminggu ia memperoleh keuntungan mencapai Rp 400.000,00. Pinjaman yang ia peroleh akan ia gunakan untuk menambah modal usaha - untuk membeli barang – barang bekas yang tidak ia dapatkan di tempat sampah ataupun di jalanan. Namun, ia dapatkan dari rumah – rumah penduduk atau toko – toko. Suami Juhariyah juga bergerak di bidang usaha yang sama dengan penghasilan Rp 250.000,00/minggu. Walaupun mereka tidak memiliki tanggungan anak , namun mereka harus tetap memikirkan masa depan mereka berdua.

loans.use: Purchase used products which cannot find in rubbish dumps or by the roadside (Membeli barang – barang bekas yang tidak ia dapatkan di tempat sampah ataupun di jalanan)

loans.name: Ragab Ali

texts.en: Ragab Ali lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married but he lives alone in Kabul since all his family is living in anther province in Afghanistan. He came to Kabul to work hard for his family and opened a retail shop. He is new in his business and he wants to expand it. He wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a better monthly income so that he can bring his family to the capital and help them better. He is happy that he can further his business by taking a small loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sevimnaz

texts.en:
Sevimnaz G., a 26-year-old mother of two, lives in Saatli, a town in southeast Azerbaijan. Breeding cattle is tradition in this rural area, where there are few job opportunities. Sevimnaz has raised calves since she was 14 years old. Today, she and her husband breed cows in their yard to sell at the local market or butcheries.

Sevimnaz hopes to grow her business, which is her family's only source of income. With $600, she'll be able to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. Because meat and dairy are mainstays in Azerbaijan culture, investing in more cattle would be a wonderful opportunity for her family's future.

loans.use: To buy calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bukasa B (2026)D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of groceries and motorcycles and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to expand her grocery business. Sarah is 42 years old and is divorced. She has 7 children ranging from age 5 to 27 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for the children Sarah is joined in her small group by Janat N., Milly Nakafero, Joyce N., and Prossy.

Janat N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to add to her stock. Milly Nakafero is currently in the business of selling fruit and is requesting a loan of UGX 250,000 to increase stock. Joyce N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to purchase more clothes for sale. Prossy is currently in the business of fruits and vegetables and is requesting a loan of UGX 350,000 to expand her vegetable business.

loans.use: To expand the grocery business

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Ms. Tarana, 26 years old, is married with two children. She lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Tarana owns a small herd of cattle. On Saturdays, she sells animals she has bred and buys calves in order to start breeding them again. The business is going well but it needs some improvements. Tarana plans to increase the number of calves she purchases to help her improve her vulnerable, low income status. Her family expenditures are rising as her children grow older and so she hopes this credit will help her improve her family life.  Tarana's application for a $600 loan has been approved by Normicro Saatli branch.

loans.use: To buy calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Yayuk

texts.id:
Everyday, Yayuk is busy serving customers that visit her food stall. Customers are from the surrounding neighborhood, from further places – those who are familiar with her stall – or those who pass by the area. Once every several days she markets to replenish supplies for her stall. Medium of transportation used is a motorcycle and delivered by her son. Each time she incurs Rp 200.000,00 (USD22). The supplies include meat, vegetables, spices, and others. Each week she earns Rp 200.000,00 (USD22). Although she is not responsible for her son, she does not want to depend upon other people. Daily living expenses of Rp 30.000,00 (USD3), place of residence and business under lease is in her mind.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Sehari hari Yayuk sibuk melayani para pelanggan yang mampir ke warung makanannya. Pelanggannya adalah tetangga sekitar tempat ia berjualan, dari tempat yang jauh - yang sudah mengenal warungnya - maupun mereka yang lewat daerah tersebut. Beberapa hari sekali dia ke pasar untuk menambah persediaan di warung. Sarana transportasi yang digunakan adalah sepeda motor dengan diantar oleh anaknya. Setiap kali belanja ia menghabiskan Rp 200.000,00. Itu berupa daging, sayur, bumbu, dan lain – lain. Per minggunya ia mendapat keuntungan Rp 200.000,00. Walaupun anaknya sudah tidak menjadi tanggungannya, ia tidak mau hidup bergantung pada orang lain. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00, tempat tinggal dan tempat usaha yang berstatus kontrak harus ia pikirkan.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, and others (Membeli bahan -bahan berupa daging, sayur, bumbu, dan lain – lain)

loans.name: Kikooza A(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Eva N.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to invest in her poultry business. Eva is 43 years old and is married. She has 7 children, ranging from age 5 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Eva makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the poultry business. Eva is joined in her small group by Joanita N., Harriet N., Jane K., and Christine N..

Joanita N. is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to purchase poultry feeds. Harriet N. is currently in the business of fresh foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to increase stock. Jane K. is currently in the wholesale business and is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to start selling shoes. Christine N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy new sewing machines.

loans.use: To invest in the poultry business.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en: Ms. Vafa, 28 years old, is a vulnerable, low income woman. She is married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Vafa has a scanty herd of milk cows and sells 30 liters of milk per day to the local milk processing shop and to the super market. The trade is good and Vafa can see potential to sell more milk. In order to do this, as well as increase her monthly turnover, she will require more cattle in her herd. She has applied for a $700 loan from Normicro Saatli branch for the purpose of buying a cow and increasing the number of cattle in her herd.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Zakhid

texts.en: Mr. Zakhid is 28 years old, married, with four children. He is a farmer who lives with his family in Saatli Town situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. In 2001, he started his business by purchasing one cow with money that he had saved up. Zakhid purchases and breeds calves, then cuts and sells them to the butcher who works in the local big market. However, the income from this business remains insufficient to cover both family and business expenditures.  To increase the profit margin from his sales, Zakhid needs investment money in order to expand his small herd. His application to Normicro Saatli branch for a $600 loan has already been approved. Eventually, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
K. Rohat is 37 years old, married, and has three children of school age. 

For the last 8 years, Rohat has been running her own sales business in the local market. She sells fabrics used for making national dresses which in Tajikistan are very beautiful and popular. Rohat's business is stable and generates a considerable share of the family's income. 

Rohat is planning to travel to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan, in order to purchase a variety of new fabrics for sale. For this purpose, she is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to be repaid in 4 months. Rohat has proved herself as an honest and reliable client of the loan organization, and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for sale

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
K. Dilshod is 27 years old, married, and has two children. 

Dilshod is a cattleman. He owns 2 cows, and has been in the business already for 4 years. Dilshod's mother helps him. In addition to cattle raising, Dilshod grows plants and herbs like parsley, dill, coriander, and spring onions for sale. The business provides the main income for the family, allowing Dilshod not only to maintain, but also to improve its living conditions. 

Dilshod is planning to expand his business and to purchase another cow. For this purpose, he is asking for a loan of US$700 for a term of 12 months. Part of the loan Dilshod plans to spend on buying the cow, while the rest will be used for buying fodder. This is the second time that Dilshod is borrowing, and he is confident that, like previously, he will be able to pay the loan back in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and of fodder

loans.name: Trisilo

texts.id:
To supplement her husband in seeking the necessities of the family, Trisilo tailors clothings. She purchases fabrics from Kumbasari market. She buys several rolls costing Rp 200.000,00 – Rp 300.000,00 (USD22 – USD33)/roll. The cloth will be tailored into clothings and sold for Rp 15.000,00 – Rp 20.000,00 (USD1.60 – USD2) each piece. Each roll of fabric usually makes 30 – 40 pieces of clothing. She sells them in traditional markets with earnings of Rp 800.000,00 (USD87)/month. She also custom tailors traditional woman blouses with a sewing machine.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Demi membantu suaminya untuk mencari nafkah keluarga, Trisilo menekuni usaha Menjahit Baju. Dia membeli kain di Pasar Kumbasari. Dia beli beberapa gulung seharga Rp 200.000,00 - Rp 300.000,00/gulung. Kain tersebut dijadikan baju dengan harga jual Rp 15.000,00 – Rp 20.000,00 per potongnya. Satu gulung kain biasanya menghasilkan 30 – 40 potong baju. Dia menjualnya di pasar – pasar tradisional dengan keuntungan usaha Rp 800.000,00/bulan. Dia ini juga jahit kebaya, sesuai dengan permintaan pelanggan dengan menggunakan mesin jahit..

loans.use: Purchase materials for clothings (Membeli bahan - bahan terutama kain).

loans.name: Sohiba

texts.en:
P. Sohiba is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Already a while ago, her husband left for Russia for work purposes.

Sohiba earns income selling foodstuffs, such as noodles, macaroni, canned food, coffee, condensed milk, and mayonnaise at the local market of Gafurov city. Her sales stand is located in the center of the market. Sohiba tries to offer a wide variety of quality goods at acceptable prices. Her business is stable and generates a considerable share of the family's income, especially since Sohiba's husband is in Russia and is not yet able to send his earnings back to Tajikistan.

Currently, Sohiba needs a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 12 months. She is planning to purchase a variety of foodstuffs for sale. Sohiba is thankful to everyone for support and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Resmi

texts.id:
Resmi purchases basic ingredients like chicken Rp 20.000,00/kilogram (USD2 for 2.2lb) and Lele Rp 8.000,00/kilogram (less than USD1 for 2.2lb), each 20 kg (44lbs) per day at the Badung market. While at the same time for spices she spends funding of Rp 100.000,00/week (about USD11). Her medium of transportation is a motorcycle. While for selling her goods she used large baskets. Income she earned from this activity is Rp 200.000,00/week (USD22). Profit from this activity she use to supplement her husband’s earnings to pay for their children’s education Rp 200.000,00 (about USD22)/month.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Resmi membeli bahan baku berupa ayam Rp 20.000,00/kg dan Lele Rp 8.000,00/kg masing –masing 20 kg per hari di Pasar Badung. Sedangkan untuk bumbu – bumbunya dia mengeluarkan modal Rp 100.000,00/ minggu. Sarana transportasinya sepeda motor. Sedangkan untuk berjualan ia menggunakan rombong. Dari usaha ini keuntungan yang ia peroleh mencapai Rp 200.000,00/minggu. Hasil usahanya ini ia gunakan untuk membantu suaminya salah satunya membiayai pendidikan anaknya Rp 200.000,00/bulan.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, flour, eggs, oil, and others (Membeli ayam hidup, tepung, telur, minyak, dan lain lain.)

loans.name: I Made Wenten

texts.id:
50 year old I Made wenten lives in Manistutu village in West Bali. 90% of the villagers work as farmers. I Made Wenten's neighbors mostly farms rice as the irrigation is very good for rice. As a farmer himself, I Made Wenten knows the needs of his neighbors during the planting season. Farmers in I Made Wenten's village really needs more fertilizer to improve productivity. However, it is difficult to procure fertilizer because the there are no nearby fertilizer vendors. Seeing this condition, I made Wenten saw a business opportunity. I made Wenten started selling fertilizer in addition to working his own farm. With DINARI loans, I made WEnten hopes to purchase more fertilizer from wholesaler to be resold. His farmer neighbors are so thankful to I made Wenten's effort to make it easier for them to obtain fertilizer. I Made Wenten also provides delivery service. This business really increased I Made Wenten's earnings. So he would be very thankful if his loan is approved.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Made Wenten, 50 tahun, tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa di Bali Barat yang mana hampir 90 % penduduknya bermata pencaharian sebagai petani. Khusus untuk lingkungan I Made Wenten, sebagian besar petani bercocok tanam dengan menanam padi. Hal ini disebabkan karena pengairan diwilayah tersebut mencukupi untuk menanam padi. Sebagai seorang petani, I Made Wenten paham akan kebutuhan para petani pada saat masa tanam. Petani di desa I Made Wenten sangat membutuhkan pupuk untuk meningkatkan produktifitas sawahnya. Namun yang menjadi kendala adalah sulitnya mencari pupuk karena selain jarak pedagang pupuk yang cukup jauh, ketersediaan pupuk pun sangat minim. Melihat hal ini, I Made Wenten menganggap sebagi peluang bisnis yang bisa diandalkan. Selain tetap mengerjakan sawahnya sendiri, I Made Wenten melayani penjualan beraneka jenis pupuk yang diperlukan oleh petani. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, I Made Wenten membeli pupuk di pedagang besar dan memasarkannya kembali. Para petani merasa sangat terbantu dengan usaha I Made Wenten, karena mereka dapat dengan mudah memperoleh pupuk. Satu hal yang sangat dihargai oleh para petani adalah layanan antar oleh I Made Wenten kepada para pembeli. Dengan usaha ini, I Made Wenten merasa sangat terbantu dari segi perekonomiannya dan ia sangat berterima kasih atas pinjaman yang didapatnya.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Women's Group

texts.en:
Suzan N., the chairperson of Akutwala Ekiro Women’s Group, is 29 years old. She is married and cares for her 2 children and three other relatives. She has been running a restaurant business for 11 years at Mengo hospital and her clients are mostly patients and their caretakers. Over the past 18 months she has received loans of various amounts just like her group members. Although she is married, Suzan's husband is mostly away from home, leaving the responsibility of her home to herself. She plans to expand her restaurant by buying more utensils like saucepans, plates, and forks, which will enable her to prepare more dishes for her customers like matooke (cooked unripened bananas that are wrapped in banana leaves), rice, posho, and cassava. Suzan is really hard working.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Suzan plans to expand her restaurant by buying more utensils to enable her to prepare more local dishes like matooke, rice, posho, and cassava.

loans.name: Zubaidah

texts.id:
Zubaidah lives in a rented house with her husband and 5 year old child. She rents a room with an outside bathroom. For her child's future, she started the business. Despite her husband working hard to support her family, their child's future needed more attention. She opened her kiosk about 100m from her home. She buys ingredients, such as chicken, cucumber, cauliflower and other vegetables, chili, tomato garlic, shallots and spices in the market everyday to make sure they are fresh. She spends about $33 each day to purchase ingredients, and she uses a motorcycle equipped with a storage box to sell her rice around the village. She can earn up to $17 profit each day.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Bersama suami dan satu anaknya yang berumur 5 tahun Zubaidah tinggal di kontrakan. Ia menyewa satu kamar dengan kamar mandi luar. Demi masa depan anaknya dia menjalankan usaha ini. Walaupun suaminya bekerja dan cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup mereka sehari – hari. Namun, masa depan anak mereka perlu mendapatkan perhatian. Tempat ia berjualan kurang lebih 100 m jauhnya dari tempat ia tinggal. Ia membeli bahan mentahnya di pasar setiap hari untuk menjaga kesegarannya. Bahan baku yang ia beli, antara lain : ayam, ketimun, kol dan sayuran lainnya; cabe, tomat, bawang putih/merah, kemiri dan bumbu lainnya. Sekali dia belanja modal yang ia keluarkan Rp 300.000,00. Sarana transportasi yang ia pakai adalah sepeda motor dan rombong untuk berjualan. Keuntungan per harinya mencapai Rp 150.000,00.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, e.g. chicken, rice and vegetables

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S., 27, is married with one child and works as a housewife cooking food and looking after her little one. Her husband supports the family by buying recycled items from the people of his community and reselling them to his local recycling plant. He makes about $6 a day. He and his wife hope to use this loan to expand their business -- and their income -- by buying a large quantity of recycled items to sell.

loans.use: to expand a business and a family's income by buying recycled items to sell.

loans.name: Twekembe Development Group

texts.en:
It is rare in Uganda for one to doubt a 48-year-old midwife with 17 years of experience. Mayi K., the chairperson of the Twekembe Development Group, can be best described as such. She is married with 4 children and provides for 6 of her relatives. She has a maternity home in Bulenga and she has been our client for 8 years. Her dream for the future is to have her own premises for the maternity home, which is currently in rented space. She believes her dream can only come true by having a loan together with her group. Mayi is result-oriented and hardworking.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Kato Mayi will invest more in her maternity home.

loans.name: Kikooza A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of fresh foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 500000 to purchase more foods for sale.
