As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material and accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a forty-six-year old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children.  She lives in the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo, where she runs a small business selling traditional Dominican meals.  She prepares the food within her house and sells it in a public place.  Monica explains that she hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy a local spot to run the business.  With her loan, Monica will buy a wide range of products in order to keep producing her food and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and other goods in order to keep producing food for the customers.

loans.name: Carlota Luis

texts.pt:
Carlota Luísa T. was born in the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo. She has 7 siblings, they are orphans. She was raised in the district of Boane where she still lives. She started primary school in Boane but did not attend secondary school because at that time Mozambique culture did not accept girls attending secondary school and she did not want to contradict her family.

Carlota was married but her husband died leaving her with 5 children to care for. She supported them through commerce. She heard of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA from her brother and friends. She has already borrowed twice, both times 5.000mt, which she repaid. Carlota is requesting a loan of 20000mt. Her dream is to see her home finished and her business doing well so she can support her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 2 Cliente: Carlota Luisa T. Actividade: Comércio Valor do empréstimo: 20.000,00mt Aplicação: Compra de mercadoria para revenda Início: 28/01/08 Fim: 22-05-09

Carlota Luísa T., nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província de Maputo. Tem 7 irmaos dos quais 2 são homens, é orfã de pai e mãe. Cresceu no distrito de Boane e vive até hoje. Começou a estudar na escola primária Boane sede. Não frequentou o nível secundário por ter ido ao lar com os seus 20 anos de idade visto que naquele tempo, ir a escola não havia muita aceitação para os moçambicanos e não deixando de lado a tradicao da sua família. Depois de começar a viver maritalmente, o seu marido vem a falecer deixando com ela 5 filhos dos quais 3 são rapazes e duas meninas. 3

Durante este tempo ela vive com base da actividade comercial estando de momento a tratar o assunto da pensão de sobrevivencia para seus filhos. Ouviu falar da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA apatir do seu irmão e amigas do mercado e decidiu aproximar-se para ter melhor esclarecimento e requisitos para aceder ao credito. Assim, reunindo requisitos, teve dois empréstimos um de 5.000,00MT e tendo pago sem nenhum constrangimento. Depois destes remeteu o seu terceiro pedido no valor de 20.000,00MT que ainda esta por ser financiado. Tem como seu maior sonho ver sua casa concluída e sua actividade comercia desenvolver muito bem pra poder sustentar seus filhos.

loans.use: To buy material to finish up her house

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Veronica M. is 29 years old and she is married with two children. In 2005 Veronica established a general store business and she now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of blankets, clothing, soft drinks and sugar. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of blankets, clothing, soft drinks and sugar.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Nurali O. is 34 years old, he has a technical education and is a veterinarian by profession. Nurali is married and has 4 children. He works as a veterinarian at an animal farm in the Vakhsh region. Nurali also fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 2 years. He will use his loan to purchase livestock to fatten and resell. Nurali will sell the livestock after fattening it for 40-45 days.

Nurali will use a portion of his revenues to purchase new livestock and a portion to support his family as he is the sole income earner in the family. Nurali’s main customers are local butchers who use his meat to create meat products and sell them to local residents. Nurali will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Одинаев Нурали, возраст – 34 года, образование средне-техническое, по специальности ветеренар, женат, имеет 4-х детей. В настоящее время Нурали работает на животноводческой ферме Вахшского района ветеренаром. Нурали занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести крупный рогатый скот для откорма и продажи. Скот он планирует продавать через 40-45 дней после его откорма. Часть вырученных денег он будет использовать на приобретение нового поголовья скота и корма, другую часть будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так только он один пока является источником дохода в семье. Основными его покупателями являются местные продавцы мясных продуктов, которые приобретая у него скот производят мясную продукцию и реализуют жителям данного района. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Dr. B. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and four children. She is an obstetrian/gynacologist and manages the Milimani Martenity and Nursing home in Kisumu, Kenya. She was employed by the government for fourteen years right after she graduated from university. Dr. B. then opened her own private hospital in 2000, where she focused her efforts on building a larger out-patient facility. Besides general curative services and check-ups, her facility has a pharmacy, an x-ray machine, a laboratory, and maternal and child health services. Dr. B. attributes her success to hard work, perseverance, and assistance from KMET through three previous loans that have allowed her to expand the clinic, increase the number of services it offers, and improve the quality of care it provides. Dr. B. also carries a very good reputation from her many years of good work in Kisumu. Her practice continues to grow as she attracts more corporate clients as well as private patients. To further expand her healthcare facility and partly cover the costs of an ultra-sound machine, Dr. B. has applied for a loan of US$1,200.

loans.use: Cover a part of the cost of an ultra-sound machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Alisher H. is 33 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 2 children. Alisher builds and repairs apartments for private individuals. He also raises and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 3 years. Alisher will use his loan to purchase livestock. He plans to fatten it and sell it every 40-45 days and purchase new calves. Alisher plans to make his loan payments using his earning from repairing apartments. This loan will give Alisher an additional income stream with which to support his family.

Alisher will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдаров Алишер, возраст – 33 года, образование средне, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Алишер занимается строительством и ремонтом квартир по частным заказам. Также помимо этого он занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение крупного рогатого скота. Он планирует после откорма, через 40-45 дней, продавать скот и приобретать новый молодняк. Текущие платежи по кредиту он планирует производить за счёт средств зарабатываемых ремонтом квартир. Данный кредит даст возможность Алишеру получить дополнительный источник получения дохода для соддержания своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Luís F. José was born in the city of Tete in the province of Tete. He is 39 years old, he has 4 siblings, including two girls and they are orphans. He grew up in the city of Tete. Luís studied until the 7th grade, later he moved to Cahora Bassa where he attended the secondary school of Songo. He graduated as a primary school teacher. Before he could start working he was forced to attend the Military school of Munguine in the province of Maputo in 1992.3

Later he worked as an instructor in Munguine for 2 years. In 1994, he was transferred to Quartel of Boane where he continued his career as a teacher until today. In 1997, he married. He has 5 children, still in their teens. He was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by his aunt Regina and co-workers. His first loan was of 8.000mt. He repaid this in a timely manner. Luís is requesting a loan of 14.000mt to buy construction material to build his home. His dream is to see his home finished and to make his family happy.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Luis F. José Actividade: Habitação Valor De Empréstimo: 14.000,00Mt Aplicação:Compra De Materiais De Construção Inicio:28/01/2008 Fim: 23/03/2009

Luís F. José, Natural de Cidade de Tete província de Tete, de 39 anos de idade tem 4 irmaos dos quais duas são meninas, e órfão de Pai. Cresceu na cidade de Tete onde estudou ate a 7ª classe e depois transferiu-se a Cahora Bassa para fazer o nível básico na escola secundária de Songo. Depois foi a formação de Professores primários. Antes de começar com o seu primeiro emprego foi capturado para a tropa e enviado para o centro de formação básica em Munguine na província de Maputo em 1992. Depois da formação Militar foi afecto em munguine como instrutor no centro, onde ficou dois anos. Em 1994 foi transferido para o Quartel de Boane pra continuar a sua carreira como instrutor, estando a desenvolve-la até hoje. Em 1997 casou-se e deste resultaram 5 filhos dos quais 3 são rapazes ainda adolescentes.

Ouviu falar da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA apartir de conversas com a sua tia Regina Dzimba, cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema e colegas de serviço. Depois decidiu aproximar-se para saber das condicoes de acesso ao credito. Tendo um conhecimento claro decide remeter seu pedido de credito no valor de 8.000,00MT tendo sido aprovado na sua totalidade e pagou-o em tempo recorde. Com o credito de 14.000,00MT que ainda esta por ser financiado, pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a sua obra. Tem como maior sonho ver sua casa concluída para confortar a sua família e alegra-la.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children and owns a small business selling children’s shoes and boots at an outdoor market in Melitopol, Ukraine. As a former school teacher who loves children, this business is a good fit for Olga. She has been in business for about seven years now. The business is a great source of income for Olga and her family. Her typical monthly profit is currently around $750.

Olga has requested a loan of $1000 to increase her available working business capital and to help purchase new inventory to sell. Olga has benefited in the past with loans from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist her in running a profitable business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two kids. He lives in Vinogradovo with his family. Alexander sells watches, batteries, hair dryers, drills, calculators, flashlights and other small items at the local market. His vending kiosk is located in the central part of the market which gives it a favorable location for trade. Alexander has been in this business for 8 years. Currently, he has about $3000 in inventory. His available turnover capital is about $2000 and his monthly profit is about $500.

Alexander’s natural cheerfulness and optimism have helped his enterprise grow and flourish. Today he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more inventory. He is hoping to increase his sales and earn extra income. Alexander is planning to invest generated revenue into the further expansion of his business. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance his business will continue to be successful and provide himself and his family with stable, long term income.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana B. is married and lives in Korolyovo, western Ukraine. She sells women’s clothing in the local market and has the biggest variety of women’s clothing items in the market. She is very cheerful and friendly. Her first goal, to please her customers, has added a lot to the success of her business. Maryana’s reasonable pricing policy also helps her keep loyal clients and attract new customers.

Maryana has been an entrepreneur for three years. Loans she has received and repaid through Nadiya Ukraine have also had a big part in the growth of her business. Presently, she has about $5000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $600.

Today Maryana is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her assorted inventory. This financial assistance will help her increase her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it help Maryana obtain the necessary inventory and attract more customers, it will help her meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona M. is a thirty-eight-year-old woman married to Miguel Benitez. Together they have two young children in middle school. Her children help with the family business when possible, but Petrona always stresses the importance of school. Their family business is their store “Luz de Luna,” which means “Moonlight.” In her store she sells clothing, uniforms, shoes, and bags. The business is lucrative because children are always in need of uniforms and shoes for their various sports and club activities.

To secure a sound future for her children and give them the greatest opportunities of education, she has worked hard to build her business. She is asking for a loan today to help her purchase more uniforms, bags, backpacks, and shoes.

loans.use: To buy uniforms, backpacks, and shoes.

loans.name: Uen

texts.en: Uen, 40, is the mother of 2 children. She sells traditional food called 'doclang' at her house, earning about $3 a day, while her husband, A., sells the food door-to-door around the villages and earns about $5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her food business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti M., 38, is the mother of 3 children. She has a vegetable garden and sells vegetables door-to-door or in a shop nearby. She earns around $4 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business so she can pay the tuition for her children's education. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little vegetable-growing business

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis, 35, mother of 2 children,  has a small grocery shop at her house, earning about $10 a day, while her husband, B., works at a construction site and earns very little. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital for her little grocery store

loans.name: Elah

texts.en: Elah, 26, is the mother of 2 children and she has a pretty large vegetable garden. She is able to pick the vegetables from her garden 3 times a day and sells them at the market or in shops nearby, earning about $5 a day. Her husband, D., has no fixed job. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her gardening business

loans.name: Dalias (Grupo 2) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Dalias es un grupo que ha estado armoniosamente junto por aproximadamente seis años. La diversidad de lenguas o idiomas dentro de este grupo es realmente fascinante ya que se oyen, de manera simultanea el español, el Maya-Kachikel y Maya-Tzu´tujil

Muchas de las mujeres que conforman Las Dalias son empresarias exitosas. Ellas enfocan la gran mayoría de sus esfuerzos e inverción en la crianza de marranlos, pollos y toros.

Las mayoría de clientas invierten su préstamo para comprar aquello animales que van a vender más adelante. Dependiendo del tamaño del préstamo ellas pueden comprar de uno a dos toros y criarlos durante un año para luego venderlos en el mercado. También pueden comprar de cuatro a seis marranos y criarlos durante 4 eses para luego venderlos o pueden comprar de veinte a cuarenta pollos que los criarían por ocho semanas. Las clientas combinan los números y los tipos de animales dependiendo de la demanda del mercado

El tiempo no pasa en vano y menos en un banco comunal tan consolidado como Las Dalias. Santos S. dijo que una de las maravillas de trabajar con Bancos Comunales es la intimidad que se crea dentro del grupo. Las clientas llegan a desarrollar lazos de amistad que no lo hubieran podido hacer en otra parte.

Las mujeres que participan en Las Dalias son un gran ejemplo ya que con poco capital han llegado a lograr cosas increíbles. Es por eso que las tenemos que segui apoyando para que asi pueden superarse.

loans.use: Comprar ganado y comida concentrada, compra y venta de ropa, comprar productos alimenticios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue to improve the variety and size of his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in different types of products for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the store

loans.name: Ma. Reyes

texts.es:
Because her husband—a bricklayer—does not earn enough money to cover the household expenses and raise 6 children, Ma. Reyes started a fast food business in 1987. She initially sold her meals from home, then sold traditional Mexican snack foods in a borrowed business space. After the owners asked for their space back, she started selling brand name cosmetics and perfume. In 2002, a friend sold a taco cart to her, which she set in her patio near a busy avenue, in installments. Since then, she has been selling tacos and sandwiches for a living.

However, Ma. Reyes needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she is willing to repay within 5 months. With this loan, Ma. Reyes will be able to purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her food, buy tables and chairs, and paint her cart so she can attract more customers. With your support, Ma. Reyes and her husband will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que lo que gana su esposo como albañil no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa y de sus 6 hijos, Ma. Reyes comenzó su negocio de venta de comidas desde 1987, primero elaborando comidas en su casa, después en un pequeño local que le prestaron comenzó a vender antojitos mexicanos, después le pidieron el local y se puso a vender cosméticos y perfumería de reconocidas marcas y a partir del año 2002 una comadre le traspasó un carrito de tacos en abonos, el cual instaló en el patio de su casa que da a una avenida principal (muy transitada) y desde entonces me se dedica a vender tacos y tortas.

Sin embargo Ma. Reyes necesita un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Ma. Reyes podrá comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos y unas mesas y sillas, además de poder pintar su carrito para que tenga mejor presencia y así los clientes se acerquen con más confianza. Con tu ayuda Ma. Reyes podrá sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos con la ayuda de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients, paint, tables, and chairs for taco business

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
María de la Luz started to sell cosmetics by catalogue 10 years ago in order to help her husband raise their 4 children. Her three eldest children are married, so she only has to support her youngest, who is a student. Nevertheless, she recently became a widow, which is why María continues with her business now that she has bills to pay and a child to raise on her own. María does not want to be a burden on her other children, and while they do help her out a bit, they cannot pay for everything she needs.

However because María has been in the business for many years, she has accumulated an extensive list of customers. Her only problem is that she has received many orders that she cannot fill due to lack of funds. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $700.00 USD, which she is willing to repay within 6 months. She will be able to purchase the merchandise that her customers are requesting with this loan. With your support, María can help her son get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 10 años que María de la Luz comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 4 hijos. Actualmente tres de ellos (los mayores) ya están casados y ella mantiene sólo al más pequeño quien está estudiando. Sin embargo hace poco que enviudó, y es por eso que María sigue con su negocio, puesto que necesita dinero para poder pagarle los gastos a su hijo y los de la casa puesto que María no desea ser una carga para sus hijos, a pesar de que éstos la ayudan poco, no pueden pagarle todo lo que ella necesita.

Sin embargo María por tener muchos años en este negocio ya cuenta con una cartera grande de clientes. Pero el problema que tiene es que ya le han hecho varios pedidos que María no a podido surtir por no tener dinero suficiente, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Oscar Damasco

texts.es:
Oscar Damasco is married and has two school-age children. For the past two years he has had his own business in which he rents videogames in the city of Leon, Nicaragua.

His business started as a necessity. In his old job he did not make enough money to support his family and that is why he invested C$25,000 (twenty five thousand Cordobas) in the purchase of two TVs and Nintendos in order to start his business.

His clients are now demanding new videogames, and that is why he has come to Ceprodel to obtain a new loan so that he can satisfy his customers. Oscar has already had a credit with Ceprodel which he has used towards that same goal.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Oscar Damasco es un caballero casado y con dos hijos en edad escolar que se dedica al negocio de alquiler de videojuegos desde hace 2 años en la ciudad de León del hermoso país de Nicaragua.

Su negocio nace al contemplar la gran necesidad que atravesaba su hogar ya que en el antiguo puesto de trabajo no ganaba lo suficiente para mantener su hogar. Es por esta razón que con una inversión de C$ 25,000 (Veinticinco mil Córdobas) logra comprar los televisores y los nintendos para iniciar su negocio.

Según cuenta, sus clientes demandan nuevos videojuegos por lo que acude a Ceprodel para recibir crédito y así satisfacer a sus clientes. Actualmente Oscar ha realizado un crédito en Ceprodel que lo ha utilizado para este mismo fin.

loans.use: To buy videogames for his business

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
María Josefina is a single-mother of 3 children. Because she did not earn enough income from her job to raise her children, she started selling perfumes by catalogue to her friends and neighbors 4 years ago. She now has a long list of customers who order perfume from her.

However, she currently has some orders that she has not been able to fill, so she is requesting a loan of $475.00 USD that she is willing to repay within 6 months. With this loan, she will be able to buy the perfume that her customers ordered, thus generating more revenue. With your support, María will be able to earn extra income that will help her pay for her children’s living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María Josefina es madre soltera de 3 niños. Y debido a que con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Es por lo que comenzó a vender perfumes por catálogo entre sus vecinas y amigos hace 4 años. Actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera grande de clientes que le piden los perfumes.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene unos pedidos que no a podido surtir es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar los perfumes que le encargaron y así tener mayores ingreso. Con tu ayuda María podrá obtener un dinero extra para pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Reducinda

texts.en:
Reducina B. is a divorced mother who lives in the city of Guayaybi. All of her children are grown and living on their own but she still needs to pay the bills. She is in the business of selling cellular phones. She has her own store in a good location. Reducina's business has been successful for five years. Her customers say she is a hardworking woman and is dedicated to her customers' needs.

With the loan, Reducina will continue to purchase cellular phones and accessories to keep the business vibrant and competitive.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María Laura started her snow cone business 8 years ago because her husband did not earn enough money as a headwaiter to pay for their children’s expenses. María Laura knew that those expenses would increase in the future, so she decided to start her own business. However, because snow cone sales decrease during the winter season, she also started selling snacks. The people in her neighborhood gradually realized what María Laura was selling.

Nevertheless, she currently does not have enough products, so she is requesting a loan of $475.00 USD that she is willing to repay within 6 months. She will be able to buy more products with this loan. With your support, María Laura will help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Laura comenzó con su negocio de venta de raspados hace 8 años. El negocio lo comenzó debido que lo que gana su esposo como jefe de meseros no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos y María Laura pensaba que en el futuro los gastos serían mayores y fue por eso que comenzó su negocio. Sin embargo debido a que en temporada de frio los raspados no se venden mucho, fue por lo que comenzó a vender cosas de snak. Poco a poco se fueron dando cuenta en su localidad de lo que vendía María Laura.

Sin embargo Actualmente no cuenta cn mercancía suficiente en su negocio, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María Laura podrá comprar más mercancía. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.en:
Rosalino B. is married and the father of three children. He owns a house in the General Resquin neighborhood in the city of Santaní. He has owned a general store for thirteen years and today is well known in the area.

The next step in his growing business is to invest money into buying a small truck to transport his goods faster and easier. The loan he is asking for will go towards purchasing a small truck. The loan will increase the size of his business and the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy articles of merchandise and invest in a truck

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Since María del Carmen’s husband did not earn enough income to raise their 3 children, ages 13, 12, and 4, she decided to sell sandwiches in March of 2003. She fashioned a little table on which to prepare her sandwiches, and she would heat the meat and bread in her own oven. Little by little, her business prospered, so she was able to buy a sandwich cart that she parked in front of her house, placing tables and chairs around it so that her customers could eat their sandwiches comfortably. Gradually, her neighbors and passersby realized what she was selling.

However, she currently does not have enough products to be able to make her sandwiches, which is why María del Carmen is requesting a loan of $475.00 USD that she is willing to repay within 5 months. She will be able to buy the ingredients needed to prepare a wider variety of sandwiches with this loan. With your support, María del Carmen will help both her business and her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que lo que gana el esposo de María del Carmen no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos de 13, 12 y 4 años. Comenzó en Marzo del 2003, vendiendo tortas en una mesita que acondicionó para poder elaborar las tortas y el pan y la carne la calentaba en la estufa de su casa, pero poco a poco le empezó a ir mejor y pudo comprar un carrito tortero en buenas condiciones el cual ubicó en el frente de su casa con unas mesitas y sillas para que sus clientes pudieran comerse las tortas de manera cómoda. Poco a poco sus vecinos y personas que pasan por su casa se dieron cuenta de lo que estaba vendiendo.

Sin embargo Actualmente no cuenta con material suficiente para poder elaborar las tortas. Es por eso que María del Carmen está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María del Carmen podrá comprar el material necesario para poder elaborar las tortas y comprar otros ingredientes para crear un repertorio de tortas mayor. Con tu ayuda María del carmen podrá sacar adelante su negocio y con este a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sandwich ingredients

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina is forty years old. She and her husband have five children, four of them boys, that range from ten to twenty years old.  Miguelina owns and operates a tailoring shop in the community of Altagracia in Santo Domingo.  She learned to sew at the age of twelve.  The entrepreneur has three different sewing machines that she works with.  Miguelina explains that she mostly prepares party and wedding dresses.   Sometimes she offers her services to school-going children.
Miguelina is requesting a loan to by a lot of material such as cloth, sewing thread, and zippers in other to keep preparing dresses for her customers.  Miguelina’s business supports her children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to satisfy the needs of her numerous customers

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en:
The committee of women, named Oñondivepa, was created with the help of women in another support group in the same town. Together they hold weekly meetings, discuss their businesses, and request loans. They make democratic decisions on how the money is spent and when to repay the loans.

Oñondivepa is a group of committed women working to better their situation in life and provide the best childhood for their children. With a variety of independent businesses, the women will use the loan to buy a variety of goods including linens, clothing, fruits, vegetables and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothing, vegetables, fruit, linens, and cosmetics

loans.name: María Altagracia

texts.en:
Hardworking, positive and honest are just some of the countless qualities that María Altagracia, mother of three children, possesses.  The promising entrepreneur owns and operates a grocery store which she started six years ago.
María Altagracia says that her store is very profitable.  With the profits from her business, she supports her children’s studies and pays the rent for her house. 
María Altagracia hopes that her business can keep growing so she can improve her family’s living conditions. With her loan, she will buy a lot of products to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase goods to restock her grocery store

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
The committee, “United Women,” is a group of eighteen women from the town of Cerrito in the city of Capiata. The town suffers from many problems including a lack of schools and many people are plagued with health problems. The women are happy with their work in the group and their goal is of course to better their own lives, along with the lives of their families.

The loan that they are asking for will be used to purchase food, clothing and cosmetics. With an increase in goods, the women can expand their profits and businesses.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy a variety of food, clothing, and cosmetics for the womens' independent businesses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria and Justo O. are the proud parents of three children, who are under the age of ten. For fifteen years the couple has worked together making shoes and school uniforms. Currently, they rent two salons. One is used by Maria’s husband to make shoes and from the other Maria sells shoes, uniforms, and other clothing. Eventually, they hope to increase business and have enough savings to buy a shop of their own. Until then, they are grateful that the profits they have made allowed them to build a home of their own.

Today, they are asking for a loan to buy school uniforms and more leather to make shoes.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and leather to make shoes

loans.name: Mauricia's Group

texts.en:
This group of women work everyday selling goods door-to-door. They live and run their businesses in an area of Paraguay where there is a great amount of poverty. People from neighboring cities migrate to their city to sell goods and work in various businesses. These women want to increase their profits and eventually own shops of their own. It is their aspiration to continue to live outside of poverty.

With the loan, they will purchase canned goods, non-perishable foods, animals, and home products.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and other non-perishable products.  Other goods to be purchased include animals and various home goods.

loans.name: Rincon Poty Group

texts.en:
This committee of 15 women is named “Rincón Poty” and is located in the city of Nemby. They understand the necessity to work together in order to amplify their successes. Most of the women sell their goods door-to-door in a very poor city. Together, they are asking for a loan to increase their profits.

Their long time goal, along with increasing their earnings, is to construct a safe place for their children to play. However, until then, their loan will be used to buy more goods to sell such as food, drinks, baking goods and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase various foods and goods for baking and food preparation, as well as clothing to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a forty-four year old mother of five children.  After her husband death about twenty six years ago, she had to struggle to raise her children alone.  
Gilda has a small business selling fried bananas, chicken, meats and natural juices.  She has a well established clientele. 
Now, the entrepreneur wants to expand her business.  She will use her loan to purchase a freezer to keep the meat and juices cold.  That way, Gilda will be able to better preserve the meat and not have to buy ice every day.  Gilda hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy her home.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to preserve meat and other goods with which the entrepreneur prepares fried food

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Aida Maria was a housewife before she started selling products at her own convenience store. Her spouse’s earnings were not enough to provide for herself and their two children, and that is why she decided to start her business by setting up a neighborhood store in the city of Leon which is where she resides.

Today Mrs. Aida Maria is very thankful since she has obtained three loans with Ceprodel with have enabled her to increase her working capital as well as help her improve her quality of life thanks to the profits that she gets from her neighborhood store in Leon. Currently she needs to urgently obtain more products so that she can sell them in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Aida Maria, antes de tener su negocio de venta de productos de variedad (pulpería) se desempeñaba como ama de casa. Sin embargo, por ser madre y tener a cargo dos hijos en edad escolar los ingresos que obtenía su cónyuge no eran lo suficiente para la subsistencia de su familia, por lo que decide iniciar su negocio poniendo una pulpería en la ciudad de León que es su localidad.

Hoy en día la Sra. Aida Maria se siente agradecida ya que ha obtenido 3 créditos con Ceprodel y gracias a esto ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo además de mejorar su nivel de vida por la ganancia que genera su pulpería en la ciudad de Leon. Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Sorayda Hortensia

texts.es:
Sorayda P. is married and has one son to take care of. She has a business selling food located in the beautiful city of León, in Nicaragua. She started the business when her husband's income became sufficiently low; she had always liked the cooking business since she sold out of her home every afternoon. She began the business five years ago, and since then she has generated enough income to maintain her home.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for the last two years, and told us that she feels very good about the credits requested since they have provided her with opportunity and been very flexible. They have helped her to get ahead, since through the income the business generates she has been able to improve her living conditions and has been able to make sure her son gets an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Sorayda P., es casada y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos ubicado en la bella ciudad de León en Nicaragua. El negocio lo comienza cuando los ingresos que percibía su esposo eran bastante bajos, a ella siempre le gustó el negocio de comidería ya que en su casa se vendía todas las tardes, este negocio lo emprende hace cinco años y hasta hoy le ha generado utilidades para mantener su hogar.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, ya que le han servido para salir a delante, debido a que a través de los ingresos que les ha generado este negocio han podido mejorar sus condiciones de su hogar y ha podido lograr que su hijo reciba la educacion.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Catalina Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Catalina T. dedicates herself to the business of selling all types of home decor and personal items, such as invitations for birthdays and other activities. Her business began twelve years ago with her traveling to sell her items, but after rebuilding her house, she established her business in the location its current locale.

She is a single mother taking care of her one son who fights to bring him education and a dignified roof over his head. The need Mrs. Catalina is going through is that, due to her economic situation, she has requested credits from CEPRODEL to improve her business. She currently has a total of 7 credits that she has used for the purchase of more products so that she can support her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Catalina T. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de la venta de todo tipo de productos decorativos de casa y personales como tarjetas para invitaciones de cumpleaños y otras actividades. Su negocio nace desde hace 12 años ambulantemente pero al reconstruir su casa de habitación establece su negocio en este local donde se encuentra actualmente.

Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo quien lucha por brindarle educaron y un techo digno. Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora Catalina es que debido a su situación económica ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente tiene un total de 7 créditos que los ha utilizado par la compra de los productos y así mantener a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use:
Compra de sus productos personales decorativos
Purchase of personal and decorative products

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana S. sells different products in her neighborhood store in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. She started her business as a street vendor, but with time she decided to ask for financing in order to install her business in a place that provides better conditions for her work. Despite the tough economic situation that she is going through, Mrs. Juana states that the economic support that she has received from CEPRODEL has been vital and that it has allowed her to developed her business as well as improve her quality of life. She no longer works as a street vendor but has her own place of business and one of her dreams is to be able to improve the conditions of her shop so that she can be a good merchant in the city of Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana S. se dedica a la venta de productos varios teniendo su pulpería en la ciudad de León de la bella nación de Nicaragua. Inicia su negocio ambulante pero en el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para instalar su negocio en su casa de habitación que presenta mejores condiciones para esta actividad. A pesar de la dura situación económica que le ha tocado vivir a la señora Juana manifiesta que el aporte económico que la han brindado en CEPRODEL ha sido decisivo en el desarrollo de su actividad y le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida de modo que ya no anda ambulante sino que ahora tiene un local propio y uno de sus mayores sueños es mejorar las condiciones de su pulpería para ser una gran comerciante en la ciudad de León de donde es originaria.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Selling food is a very common business in the city of León, Nicaragua. There is a lot of competition and the great majority of places that sell food are of excellent quality. Conscious of this, Mrs. María Isabel Millón has dedicated herself to the job for the past 30 years in order to support her son. Through this work María has been able to pay for her son's schooling and his home needs.

She began the business with 4,000 córdobas (approximately $200 dollars), and she has worked with Ceprodel in order to obtain loans that have greatly benefited her locale. Through these loans María has increased her earnings and purchased raw materials in larger volume in order to make food. As of date she has repaid 14 previous loans through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de León ya que existe mucha competencia y la gran mayoría de los lugares donde se vende la comida son de excelente calidad. Consiente de esto, la señora Maria Isabel M. se dedica desde hace 30 años a este negocio para apoyar a su hijo en las necesidades del hogar y el pago de los estudios

Inició su negocio con un capital de C$ 4000 (Cuatro mil córdobas) y ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 14 créditos con Ceprodel

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
María Dora Berrios is a single woman with a young daughter who has her own business selling cosmetics. She serves the general public in a small beauty salon. María began her business 15 years ago, applying all of her knowledge in the fields of beauty and fashion in order to purchase cosmetic products. Through the years her business has improved with the acquisition of better tools for use in her salon and also with increased sales of her cosmetics.

One need that is currently facing Ms. Berrios is that due to her lower income level, she believes it urgent to invest in the purchase of cosmetics and in remodeling her shop since the sector in which she is located is very competitive and the other salons are in better conditions. For this reason María sincerely requests to be granted a loan that she can invest in improving her salon and thereby continue to support her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, KIVA volunteer

María Dora Berrios es una dama soltera y con una pequeña hija que tiene su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y un pequeño salón de belleza donde atiende al publico en general. Su negocio lo inicia desde hace 15 años aplicando todos sus conocimientos en el ramo de la belleza y la moda para adquirir sus productos de cosmeticos. A través de los años ha venido mejorando su negocio con la adquisición de mejores herramientas para utilizar en su salón y a la vez con la puesta en venta de sus cosméticos.

Una necesidad que pasa la señora Berrios es que debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos le urge invertir en la compra de los cosméticos y remodelación del salón ya que en el sector donde ella se ubica existe mucha competencia y los otros salones se encuentran en mejores condiciones. Por esta razón es que muy confiadamente, se acerca a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con Créditos que los invierte en el mejoramiento de su salón y así continuar manteniendo a su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Javier wants to invest in clothing and appliances for his and his wife's businesses

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
The sale of cosmetics in León is a very common and lucrative business that has been surging in many Nicaraguan cities. Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora V. first dedicated herself to this trade 20 years ago in order to aid her husband in home expenses.

She began her business with some money she had saved herself. She has worked with Ceprodel for 20 years obtaining loans that have crucially helped her business. Because of the credits she has been able to increase her income and procure a greater volume of cosmetics for marketing. Her history shows 11 credits with Ceprodel, all paid on time and in agreement with the contract.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La venta de cosméticos en la ciudad de León es un negocio muy común y rentable que ha venido creciendo no solamente en León son también en el resto de ciudades de Nicaragua. La señora Maria Auxiliadora V. se dedica desde hace 20 años a este negocio para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

Inició su negocio con un pequeño capital obtenido por medio de sus propios ahorros y desde hace 20 años ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de cosméticos para su debida comercialización.

Su record crediticio actual es de 11 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma según lo acordado.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
For the past 30 years, Ms. María A. has worked selling meat in the city of Leon, Nicaragua. She began her business with 5,000 córdobas (approximately $250 dollars) which she invested directly in the purchase of meat products. It is important to mention that Ms. A. is single and for that reason she is responsible for supporting her aging parents, who now depend on their daughter.

Ms. A. needs funds in order to purchase meat that she will then sell. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to acquire the products that she needs to develop her business and to continue caring for her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 30 años en la ciudad de Leon la señora Maria A. se dedica a la venta de la carne iniciando con un capital de Cinco mil córdobas que los invirtió directamente para la compra de sus productos. Es necesario señalar que ella es soltera y por tal razón tiene el deber de apoyar a sus ancianos padres que ahora dependen de su hija.

La necesidad de la señora A. es la urgencia de invertir en la carne para comercializarla y por tal motivo ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada por esta institución y así adquirir sus productos que tanto necesita para sacar adelante su negocio y seguir manteniendo a sus padres.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Johanna Del Pilar

texts.es:
In the city of León, Nicaragua, Mrs. Johanna del Pilar V. works selling watches, cell phone accessories, and glasses. She began the business 10 years ago in her own home where she had only a table on which she put her merchandise (with the exception of cell phones, which were not as popular then as now). Her business has developed to such an extent that now Johanna has purchased a glass display case in which she exhibits her products for the general public.

One advantage for Mrs. V.’s business is that it is located on a very busy street that permits everyone who passes to see her products in the front window display. However, despite this location, Mrs. V. earns limited income from the business and at times she is unable to cover her household expenses. For this reason she has decided to request a loan from Ceprodel in order to improve her quality of life.

Currently, with a total of 8 previous loan repayments, Mrs. V. has been able to better stock her business and also make partial improvements to her store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de León, la señora Johanna del Pilar V. se dedica a la venta de relojes, accesorios para celulares y lentes. Su negocio nace hace 10 años en su hogar de habitación donde contaba solamente con una mesa donde ponía los productos a excepción de los celulares que para ese tiempo no tenían tanto auge como actualmente. Hoy en día a medida que ha venido desarrollándose en su negocio ha comprado una vitrina de vidrio donde exhibe sus productos al público en general.

Una ventaja que posee el negocio de la señora V. es que está ubicado en una calle muy transitada que permite que todo el que pase logre ver sus productos en su vitrina. Sin embargo, a pesar de esta situación, la señora V. percibe pocos ingresos económicos y en ocasiones no logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar por lo que decide recurrir a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para mejorar su condición de vida.

Hoy en día, con un total de 8 créditos ha logrado surtir mas su negocio y además ha mejorado en parte las condiciones de su local de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ana Yolanda

texts.es:
For the past 10 years Mrs. Ana Yolanda Q. has operated a general store in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. She is a woman worthy of imitation in that she started out as a house wife, but since she was unable to meet the necessities of her home, she decided to use her emergency savings to open her own business.

The loaning organization CEPRODEL has supported Mrs. Q. by giving her loans over the past six years. In spite of the strong competition in her business area, Mrs. Q. has begun to see better sales. For this reason she is asking to continue to receive credit in order to reach her dreams of being the best businesswoman in her field. She has successfully repaid a total of 36 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Ana Yolanda Q. se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Es una mujer digna de imitar por el hecho de que primeramente inició como ama de casa pero lastimosamente este negocio no cubría las necesidades de su hogar. Por este motivo decidió utilizar un ahorro que guardaba para cualquier emergencia y de aquí nació su negocio.

CEPRODEL ha apoyado a la señora Q. realizándole préstamos desde hace seis años y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos para lograr alcanzar sus sueños de ser la mejor comerciante en el negocio. Ella ha realizado un total de 36 créditos.

loans.use: To restock her general store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina R. works very hard selling ice cream in the Santa Ana market of the beautiful city of Chinandega.

She is married with one child and it is in order to support such a responsibility that she began her business selling ice cream. She started as a walking saleswoman inside the market, and later she established her own store in order to attract more customers. For the past three years Cristina has worked with the lending organization Ceprodel, which has given her loan assistance. She has used the money to purchase raw materials, and she has successfully repaid 15 previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de helados es el negocio al cual muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Cristina R. en el mercado Santa Ana de la bella ciudad de Chinandega.

Es madre casada y con un hijo a su responsabilidad y es por esta razón que emprende este negocio vendiendo primeramente ambulante en el interior del mercado, luego se establece en su localidad para asi captar mas clientes. Desde hace 3 años la señora Cristina ha recurrido a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado una mano de ayuda con créditos que los ha utilizado directamente para la inversión en la compra de su materia prima. Su record es de 15 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Jessica M. sells food that she has prepared herself. She makes it in her own home and then transfers it to a local market, called Santa Ana de Chinandega, in order to sell it.

Jessica has had her business for three years. She began the business with a small amount of personal savings that she had been collecting since she was very young. She started selling food on the outskirts of the market on benches in which she offered outdoor meals or picnics. Before starting this business Jessica worked as a housewife, but her difficult economic situation led her to begin a food-sales business.

Nowadays Jessica has obtained a more comfortable space so that she can spread out her things with sufficient room to be able to sell her foods. Jessica has three children and she has been struggling hard for many years to educate them. They are studying in elementary school, and their only means of support is Jessica’s business.

The institution Ceprodel has given Jessica a hand by helping her grow the business. She has received a total of 18 loans over three years which have had a direct impact on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de la sra. Jessica es la venta de comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega para comercializarla.

Tiene 3 años de tener su negocio y se inicio con un bajo monto producto de ahorros personales que almacenaba desde muy joven. Ella inició vendiendo comidas en las afueras del mercado en unas bancas en las cuales ofrecía alimentos al aire libre. Antes de tener este negocio trabajó como ama de casa pero la difícil situación la impulso a implementar este negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Jessica ha conseguido un lugar bastante cómodo ya que puede extender sus enseres con suficiente espacio para poder vender los alimentos. Ella es madre de tres hijos que por mucho tiempo atrás ha venido luchando fuertemente para educarlos ya que están estudiando la primaria y su único medio de sustento es su negocio.

La institución Ceprodel le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio desde hace 3 años con un total de 18 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase food

loans.name: Julia Esperanza

texts.es:
Julia C. sells seafood in the city of Chinandega for a living. She is a mother of one daughter who currently attends elementary school.

Ms. C. started her business 10 years ago with $4,000.00 Nicaraguan córdoba. She makes periodic trips to the sea, where she buys the best seafood, then sells it at the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. Her trips have caused her to incur transportation expenses, which is why she has felt the need to take out 6 loans in one year from Ceprodel, yielding great results for her business.

Since she started to use the loans that Ceprodel has provided her with, she has obtained numerous benefits, mainly the acquisition and construction of her own business space, where she currently sells seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia C. es una dama que se dedica a la venta de mariscos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es madre de una hija que actualmente cursa su primaria en un colegio de esta comunidad.

El negocio de la señora Julia inicia hace 10 años con una inversión de C$ 4,000 utilizando la forma de trabajo la cual consiste en realizar viajes esporádicamente al mar en donde compra los mejores mariscos para luego venderlos en el mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega. Esto ha causado que la señora Julia incurra en gastos de transporte por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (6 créditos) desde hace un año obteniendo mejores resultados para su negocio.

Desde el momento que comenzó a utilizar los créditos que le brindara Ceprodel ha obtenido numerosos beneficios siendo el principal de ellos la adquisición y construcción de un local propio que es donde actualmente se mantiene vendiendo los mariscos.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat and make improvements to his shop

loans.name: Lucrecia Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucrecia Tereza L. started her own business (in which she sells home made soft drinks) a year ago in the city of Chinandega in order to be able to support her two children.

The business is located in the market of Santa Ana, where she has been able to get several customers thanks to the quality of the soft drinks that she makes. Since last year, Ceprodel has helped Mrs. Lucrecia with 6 loans that she has used to buy fruits to make the soft drinks that she sells in order to be able to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace un año, en la ciudad de Chinandega, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos la señora Lucrecia Tereza L. inicia un negocio de venta de deliciosos refrescos elaborados por ella misma.

El negocio se ubica en el interior del mercado Santa Ana donde ha logrado obtener varios clientes por la calidad de los refrescos que ella misma elabora. No podemos omitir que desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Lucrecia con la realización de 6 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para invertir en la compra de las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To buy fruits to make soft drinks

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria E. is a fighter, a married mother that has supported her three children always working in the sale of prepared food. She sells out of her home which is her place of business. With the small income from her sales she has slowly improved her business being able to offer more variety to her loyal customers.

Mrs. E. has received eighteen loans through Ceprodel, maintaining an excellent credit record. This has helped her to start construction on her place of business and also obtain raw material for her food preparation. Currently her record is of eighteen loans, all repaid on time and according to the established agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria E. es una mujer muy luchadora, madre casada que ha mantenido a sus tres hijos trabajando siempre en la venta de comida. La venta la realiza en su casa que es el local donde su negocio se ubica. Con el poco ahorro de sus ventas decide ir mejorando poco a poco su negocio para ofrecer mas variedad de alimentos a su fiel clientela que tanto lo necesita.

La señora E. ha sido beneficiada por Ceprodel con dieciocho créditos teniendo un excelente record crediticio que le ha ayudado a comenzar a construir su local y a la vez para la compra de la materia prima de los alimentos. Actualmente su record es de 18 creiditos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of food ingredients

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Ligia is a single mother with three school aged children. She expends a lot of effort in the maintenance and support that they deserve.

Twenty years ago, with the amount of C$1,000 she started a general store and as the months progressed she has grown her product assortment. This lady is a great role model; even though she does not have a husband at her side to help her, she was able to improve her life and that of her children on her own.

She has acquired loans from Ceprodel since about a year ago, that being one of the reasons Mrs. Maria V. has been able to progress. She confesses that one of her dreams is some day seeing her children pursuing a university education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Ligia es una madre soltera y con tres hijos en la edad escolar que con muchísimo sacrificio se esfuerza para mantenerlos y brindarles todo su apoyo en lo que amerita.

Con un monto de C$ 1,000 desde hace 20 años inició su negocio de pulpería de los cuales a través de los meses ha venido surtiendo de mas productos. Esta dama es un gran ejemplo que a pesar de que no tiene a su esposo a su lado ha logrado superar su vida y la de sus hijos.

Ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel desde hace un año, esta es la razón por la que la señora Maria V. ha podido salir adelante. Confiesa que su sueño es ver algún día a sus hijos coronando una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase of general store inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sheyla

texts.es:
Three years ago, Ms. Sheyla F. started selling juice and soft drinks in the city of Chinandega in order to support her son and her elderly father.

It is important to note that this type of business is very competitive because there are many other similar entrepreneurs in the area.

Ceprodel has provided Ms. F. with support for a year now, offering her a total of 6 loans that she has utilized to make repairs on her business space and push her business forward because it so urgently needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace tres años, en la ciudad de Chinandega, para poder mantener a su hijo y a su anciano padre, la señora Sheyla F. inicia un negocio de venta de gaseosas y jugos con su poco capital que tenía.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy competitivo por el hecho de que la señora Sheyla se expone primeramente a la fuerte competencia que hay a sus alrededores.

Desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Sheyla con la realización de 6 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para darle mantenimiento a su localidad y seguir esforzándose por sacar adelante su negocio que tanto lo necesita

loans.use: Purchase of juice and soft drinks

loans.name: Arturo Armando

texts.es:
Mr. Arturo F.' business is a cell phone repair shop located in his own locale outside of the market Santa Ana in the beautiful city of Chinandega. He started the business 3 years ago with a capital of one thousand dollars to buy the tools, displays, and set up his locale.

He started this business because he needed to marry his wife, and when their two children were born, he had the need to have his own profession that would yield the income necessary to support his household. This is the reason that Arturo acquired these spare parts and display cabinet to set up his business.

His greatest need right now is investing in his business (infrastructure), so he went to Ceprodel so he could benefit from loans, which will help him improve his locale and support his family. He has a record of 18 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el Señor Arturo F. es a la reparación de celulares ubicado en un local propio en las afueras del mercado Santa Ana en la bella ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio lo inicia hace 3 años con un capital de Un mil Dólares para la compra de las herramientas, vitrinas y acondicionamiento de su local.

Comienza este negocio por la necesidad de que al contraer matrimonio con su esposa y al nacer sus 2 hijos debia de tener un oficio propio que le brindara ingresos para su hogar. Por este motivo es que Arturo adquiere estos repuestos y vitrina para ubicar su negocio.

Su mayor necesidad actualmente es la inversión en su negocio (infraestructura) por lo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con Créditos que le sirvan para mejorar su localidad y a la vez mantener su núcleo familiar. El tiene un record de 18 créditos.

loans.use: Cell phone repair (Reparación de celulares)
